Al-Baqara / البقرة / The Cow

At-Tawba (التوبة)10. Yunus (يونس)11. Hud (هود)12. Yusuf (يوسف)13. Ar-Ra'd (الرعد)14. Ibrahim (ابراهيم)15. Al-Hijr (الحجر)16. An-Nahl (النحل)17. Al-Israa (الإسراء)18. Al-Kahf (الكهف)19. Maryam (مريم)20. Taa-Haa (طه)21. Al-Anbiyaa (الأنبياء)22. Al-Hajj (الحج)23. Al-Muminoon (المؤمنون)24. An-Noor (النور)25. Al-Furqaan (الفرقان)26. Ash-Shu'araa (الشعراء)27. An-Naml (النمل)28. Al-Qasas (القصص)29. Al-Ankaboot (العنكبوت)30. Ar-Room (الروم)31. Luqman (لقمان)32. As-Sajda (السجدة)33. Al-Ahzaab (الأحزاب)34. Saba (سبإ)35. Faatir (فاطر)36. Yaseen (يس)37. As-Saaffaat (الصافات)38. Saad (ص)39. Az-Zumar (الزمر)40. Al-Ghaafir (غافر)41. Fussilat (فصلت)42. Ash-Shura (الشورى)43. Az-Zukhruf (الزخرف)44. Ad-Dukhaan (الدخان)45. Al-Jaathiya (الجاثية)46. Al-Ahqaf (الأحقاف)47. Muhammad (محمد)48. Al-Fath (الفتح)49. Al-Hujuraat (الحجرات)50. Qaaf (ق)51. Adh-Dhaariyat (الذاريات)52. At-Tur (الطور)53. An-Najm (النجم)54. Al-Qamar (القمر)55. Ar-Rahmaan (الرحمن)56. Al-Waaqia (الواقعة)57. Al-Hadid (الحديد)58. Al-Mujaadila (المجادلة)59. Al-Hashr (الحشر)60. Al-Mumtahana (الممتحنة)61. As-Saff (الصف)62. Al-Jumu'a (الجمعة)63. Al-Munaafiqoon (المنافقون)64. At-Taghaabun (التغابن)65. At-Talaaq (الطلاق)66. At-Tahrim (التحريم)67. Al-Mulk (الملك)68. Al-Qalam (القلم)69. Al-Haaqqa (الحاقة)70. Al-Ma'aarij (المعارج)71. Nooh (نوح)72. Al-Jinn (الجن)73. Al-Muzzammil (المزمل)74. Al-Muddaththir (المدثر)75. Al-Qiyaama (القيامة)76. Al-Insaan (الانسان)77. Al-Mursalaat (المرسلات)78. An-Naba (النبإ)79. An-Naazi'aat (النازعات)80. Abasa (عبس)81. At-Takwir (التكوير)82. Al-Infitaar (الإنفطار)83. Al-Mutaffifin (المطففين)84. Al-Inshiqaaq (الإنشقاق)85. Al-Burooj (البروج)86. At-Taariq (الطارق)87. Al-A'laa (الأعلى)88. Al-Ghaashiya (الغاشية)89. Al-Fajr (الفجر)90. Al-Balad (البلد)91. Ash-Shams (الشمس)92. Al-Lail (الليل)93. Ad-Dhuhaa (الضحى)94. Ash-Sharh (الشرح)95. At-Tin (التين)96. Al-Alaq (العلق)97. Al-Qadr (القدر)98. Al-Bayyina (البينة)99. Az-Zalzala (الزلزلة)100. Al-Aadiyaat (العاديات)101. Al-Qaari'a (القارعة)102. At-Takaathur (التكاثر)103. Al-Asr (العصر)104. Al-Humaza (الهمزة)105. Al-Fil (الفيل)106. Quraish (قريش)107. Al-Maa'un (الماعون)108. Al-Kawthar (الكوثر)109. Al-Kaafiroon (الكافرون)110. An-Nasr (النصر)111. Al-Masad (المسد)112. Al-Ikhlaas (الإخلاص)113. Al-Falaq (الفلق)114. An-Naas (الناس)

alif-Lam-meem
الٓمٓ
Alif Laam Meem

1

1.

Alif, Lam, Meem.

1

dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
l-kitābu
الْكِتَابُ
(is) the Book
lā
لَا
no
rayba
رَيْبَ
doubt
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
hudan
هُدًى
a Guidance
lil'muttaqīna
لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
for the God-conscious

2

2.

This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah -

2

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
believe
bil-ghaybi
بِالْغَيْبِ
in the unseen
wayuqīmūna
وَيُقِيمُونَ
and establish
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
wamimmā
وَمِمَّا
and out of what
razaqnāhum
رَزَقْنَاهُمْ
We have provided them
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
they spend

3

3.

Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them,

3

wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those who
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
believe
bimā
بِمَا
in what
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
(is) sent down
ilayka
إِلَيْكَ
to you
wamā
وَمَا
and what
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
was sent down
min
مِنْ
from
qablika
قَبْلِكَ
before you
wabil-ākhirati
وَبِالْءَاخِرَةِ
and in the Hereafter
hum
هُمْ
they
yūqinūna
يُوقِنُونَ
firmly believe

4

4.

And who believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

4

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
ʿalā
عَلَى
(are) on
hudan
هُدًى
Guidance
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
wa-ulāika
وَأُولَئِكَ
and those
humu
هُمُ
they
l-muf'liḥūna
الْمُفْلِحُونَ
(are) the successful ones

5

5.

Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

5

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieve[d]
sawāon
سَوَاءٌ
(it) is same
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
to them
a-andhartahum
ءَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ
whether you warn them
am
أَمْ
or
lam
لَمْ
not
tundhir'hum
تُنْذِرْهُمْ
you warn them
lā
لَا
not
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
they believe

6

6.

Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.

6

khatama
خَتَمَ
Has set a seal
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
qulūbihim
قُلُوبِهِمْ
their hearts
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
and on
samʿihim
سَمْعِهِمْ
their hearing
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
and on
abṣārihim
أَبْصَارِهِمْ
their vision
ghishāwatun
غِشَاوَةٌ
(is) a veil
walahum
وَلَهُمْ
And for them
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
ʿaẓīmun
عَظِيمٌ
great

7

7.

Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.

7

wamina
وَمِنَ
And of
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the people
man
مَنْ
(are some) who
yaqūlu
يَقُولُ
say
āmannā
ءَامَنَّا
We believed
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wabil-yawmi
وَبِالْيَوْمِ
and in the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
wamā
وَمَا
but not
hum
هُمْ
they
bimu'minīna
بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
(are) believers (at all)

8

8.

And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allah and the Last Day," but they are not believers.

8

yukhādiʿūna
يُخَادِعُونَ
They seek to deceive
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
and those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
wamā
وَمَا
and not
yakhdaʿūna
يَخْدَعُونَ
they deceive
illā
إِلَّا
except
anfusahum
أَنْفُسَهُمْ
themselves
wamā
وَمَا
and not
yashʿurūna
يَشْعُرُونَ
they realize (it)

9

9.

They [think to] deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves and perceive [it] not.

9

fī
فِي
In
qulūbihim
قُلُوبِهِمْ
their hearts
maraḍun
مَرَضٌ
(is) a disease
fazādahumu
فَزَادَهُمُ
so has increased them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
maraḍan
مَرَضًا
(in) disease
walahum
وَلَهُمْ
and for them
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
alīmun
أَلِيمٌ
painful
bimā
بِمَا
because
kānū
كَانُوا
they used (to)
yakdhibūna
يَكْذِبُونَ
[they] lie

10

10.

In their hearts is disease, so Allah has increased their disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they [habitually] used to lie.

10

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qīla
قِيلَ
it is said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
lā
لَا
(Do) not
tuf'sidū
تُفْسِدُوا
spread corruption
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
innamā
إِنَّمَا
Only
naḥnu
نَحْنُ
we
muṣ'liḥūna
مُصْلِحُونَ
(are) reformers

11

11.

And when it is said to them, "Do not cause corruption on the earth," they say, "We are but reformers."

11

alā
أَلَا
Beware
innahum
إِنَّهُمْ
indeed they
humu
هُمُ
themselves
l-muf'sidūna
الْمُفْسِدُونَ
(are) the ones who spread corruption
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
lā
لَا
not
yashʿurūna
يَشْعُرُونَ
they realize (it)

12

12.

Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they perceive [it] not.

12

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qīla
قِيلَ
it is said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
āminū
ءَامِنُوا
Believe
kamā
كَمَا
as
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believed
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
the people
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
anu'minu
أَنُؤْمِنُ
Should we believe
kamā
كَمَا
as
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believed
l-sufahāu
السُّفَهَاءُ
the fools
alā
أَلَا
Beware
innahum
إِنَّهُمْ
certainly they
humu
هُمُ
themselves
l-sufahāu
السُّفَهَاءُ
(are) the fools
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
lā
لَا
not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
they know

13

13.

And when it is said to them, "Believe as the people have believed," they say, "Should we believe as the foolish have believed?" Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they know [it] not.

13

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
laqū
لَقُوا
they meet
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
āmannā
ءَامَنَّا
We believe[d]
wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
But when
khalaw
خَلَوْا
they are alone
ilā
إِلَى
with
shayāṭīnihim
شَيَاطِينِهِمْ
their evil ones
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
innā
إِنَّا
Indeed, we
maʿakum
مَعَكُمْ
(are) with you
innamā
إِنَّمَا
only
naḥnu
نَحْنُ
we
mus'tahziūna
مُسْتَهْزِءُونَ
(are) mockers

14

14.

And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We believe"; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers."

14

al-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
yastahzi-u
يَسْتَهْزِئُ
mocks
bihim
بِهِمْ
at them
wayamudduhum
وَيَمُدُّهُمْ
and prolongs them
fī
فِي
in
ṭugh'yānihim
طُغْيَانِهِمْ
their transgression
yaʿmahūna
يَعْمَهُونَ
they wander blindly

15

15.

[But] Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression [while] they wander blindly.

15

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(are) the ones who
ish'tarawū
اشْتَرَوُا
bought
l-ḍalālata
الضَّلَالَةَ
[the] astraying
bil-hudā
بِالْهُدَى
for [the] guidance
famā
فَمَا
So not
rabiḥat
رَبِحَتْ
profited
tijāratuhum
تِجَارَتُهُمْ
their commerce
wamā
وَمَا
and not
kānū
كَانُوا
were they
muh'tadīna
مُهْتَدِينَ
guided-ones

16

16.

Those are the ones who have purchased error [in exchange] for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.

16

mathaluhum
مَثَلُهُمْ
Their example
kamathali
كَمَثَلِ
(is) like (the) example
alladhī
الَّذِي
(of) the one who
is'tawqada
اسْتَوْقَدَ
kindled
nāran
نَارًا
a fire
falammā
فَلَمَّا
then, when
aḍāat
أَضَاءَتْ
it lighted
mā
مَا
what
ḥawlahu
حَوْلَهُ
his surroundings
dhahaba
ذَهَبَ
took away
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
binūrihim
بِنُورِهِمْ
their light
watarakahum
وَتَرَكَهُمْ
and left them
fī
فِي
in
ẓulumātin
ظُلُمَاتٍ
darkness[es]
lā
لَا
(so) not
yub'ṣirūna
يُبْصِرُونَ
(do) they see

17

17.

Their example is that of one who kindled a fire, but when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness [so] they could not see.

17

ṣummun
صُمٌّ
Deaf
buk'mun
بُكْمٌ
dumb
ʿum'yun
عُمْيٌ
blind
fahum
فَهُمْ
so they
lā
لَا
not
yarjiʿūna
يَرْجِعُونَ
[they] will not return

18

18.

Deaf, dumb and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].

18

aw
أَوْ
Or
kaṣayyibin
كَصَيِّبٍ
like a rainstorm
mina
مِنَ
from
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the sky
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it (are)
ẓulumātun
ظُلُمَاتٌ
darkness[es]
waraʿdun
وَرَعْدٌ
and thunder
wabarqun
وَبَرْقٌ
and lightning
yajʿalūna
يَجْعَلُونَ
They put
aṣābiʿahum
أَصَابِعَهُمْ
their fingers
fī
فِي
in
ādhānihim
ءَاذَانِهِمْ
their ears
mina
مِنَ
from
l-ṣawāʿiqi
الصَّوَاعِقِ
the thunderclaps
ḥadhara
حَذَرَ
(in) fear (of)
l-mawti
الْمَوْتِ
[the] death
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
muḥīṭun
مُحِيطٌ
(is) [the One Who] encompasses
bil-kāfirīna
بِالْكَافِرِينَ
the disbelievers

19

19.

Or [it is] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.

19

yakādu
يَكَادُ
Almost
l-barqu
الْبَرْقُ
the lightning
yakhṭafu
يَخْطَفُ
snatches away
abṣārahum
أَبْصَارَهُمْ
their sight
kullamā
كُلَّمَا
Whenever
aḍāa
أَضَاءَ
it flashes
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
mashaw
مَشَوْا
they walk
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
and when
aẓlama
أَظْلَمَ
it darkens
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
qāmū
قَامُوا
they stand (still)
walaw
وَلَوْ
And if
shāa
شَاءَ
had willed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
ladhahaba
لَذَهَبَ
He would certainly have taken away
bisamʿihim
بِسَمْعِهِمْ
their hearing
wa-abṣārihim
وَأَبْصَارِهِمْ
and their sight
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
(is) on
kulli
كُلِّ
every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
qadīrun
قَدِيرٌ
All-Powerful

20

20.

The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights [the way] for them, they walk therein; but when darkness comes over them, they stand [still]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

20

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
mankind
uʿ'budū
اعْبُدُوا
worship
rabbakumu
رَبَّكُمُ
your Lord
alladhī
الَّذِي
the One Who
khalaqakum
خَلَقَكُمْ
created you
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
and those [who]
min
مِنْ
from
qablikum
قَبْلِكُمْ
before you
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tattaqūna
تَتَّقُونَ
become righteous

21

21.

O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, that you may become righteous -

21

alladhī
الَّذِي
The One Who
jaʿala
جَعَلَ
made
lakumu
لَكُمُ
for you
l-arḍa
الْأَرْضَ
the earth
firāshan
فِرَاشًا
a resting place
wal-samāa
وَالسَّمَاءَ
and the sky
bināan
بِنَاءً
a canopy
wa-anzala
وَأَنْزَلَ
and sent down
mina
مِنَ
from
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the sky
māan
مَاءً
water
fa-akhraja
فَأَخْرَجَ
then brought forth
bihi
بِهِ
therewith
mina
مِنَ
[of]
l-thamarāti
الثَّمَرَاتِ
the fruits
riz'qan
رِزْقًا
(as) provision
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
falā
فَلَا
So (do) not
tajʿalū
تَجْعَلُوا
set up
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
to Allah
andādan
أَنْدَادًا
rivals
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
[you] know

22

22.

[He] who made for you the earth a bed [spread out] and the sky a ceiling and sent down from the sky, rain and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not attribute to Allah equals while you know [that there is nothing similar to Him].

22

wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
fī
فِي
in
raybin
رَيْبٍ
doubt
mimmā
مِمَّا
about what
nazzalnā
نَزَّلْنَا
We have revealed
ʿalā
عَلَى
to
ʿabdinā
عَبْدِنَا
Our slave
fatū
فَأْتُوا
then produce
bisūratin
بِسُورَةٍ
a chapter
min
مِنْ
[of]
mith'lihi
مِثْلِهِ
like it
wa-id'ʿū
وَادْعُوا
and call
shuhadāakum
شُهَدَاءَكُمْ
your witnesses
min
مِنْ
from
dūni
دُونِ
other than
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
ṣādiqīna
صَادِقِينَ
truthful

23

23.

And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our Servant [Muhammad], then produce a surah the like thereof and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful.

23

fa-in
فَإِنْ
But if
lam
لَمْ
not
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
you do
walan
وَلَنْ
and never
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
will you do
fa-ittaqū
فَاتَّقُوا
then fear
l-nāra
النَّارَ
the Fire
allatī
الَّتِي
whose
waqūduhā
وَقُودُهَا
[its] fuel
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
(is) [the] men
wal-ḥijāratu
وَالْحِجَارَةُ
and [the] stones
uʿiddat
أُعِدَّتْ
prepared
lil'kāfirīna
لِلْكَافِرِينَ
for the disbelievers

24

24.

But if you do not - and you will never be able to - then fear the Fire, whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.

24

wabashiri
وَبَشِّرِ
And give good news
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(to) those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe
waʿamilū
وَعَمِلُوا
and do
l-ṣāliḥāti
الصَّالِحَاتِ
[the] righteous deeds
anna
أَنَّ
that
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
jannātin
جَنَّاتٍ
(will be) Gardens
tajrī
تَجْرِي
flow
min
مِنْ
[from]
taḥtihā
تَحْتِهَا
under them
l-anhāru
الْأَنْهَارُ
the rivers
kullamā
كُلَّمَا
Every time
ruziqū
رُزِقُوا
they are provided
min'hā
مِنْهَا
therefrom
min
مِنْ
of
thamaratin
ثَمَرَةٍ
fruit
riz'qan
رِزْقًا
(as) provision
qālū
قَالُوا
they (will) say
hādhā
هَذَا
This (is)
alladhī
الَّذِي
the one which
ruziq'nā
رُزِقْنَا
we were provided
min
مِنْ
from
qablu
قَبْلُ
before
wa-utū
وَأُتُوا
And they will be given
bihi
بِهِ
therefrom
mutashābihan
مُتَشَابِهًا
(things) in resemblance
walahum
وَلَهُمْ
And for them
fīhā
فِيهَا
therein
azwājun
أَزْوَاجٌ
spouses
muṭahharatun
مُطَهَّرَةٌ
purified
wahum
وَهُمْ
and they
fīhā
فِيهَا
therein
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
(will) abide forever

25

25.

And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with a provision of fruit therefrom, they will say, "This is what we were provided with before." And it is given to them in likeness. And they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein eternally.

25

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
lā
لَا
(is) not
yastaḥyī
يَسْتَحْيِي
ashamed
an
أَنْ
to
yaḍriba
يَضْرِبَ
set forth
mathalan
مَثَلًا
an example
mā
مَا
(like) even
baʿūḍatan
بَعُوضَةً
(of) a mosquito
famā
فَمَا
and (even) something
fawqahā
فَوْقَهَا
above it
fa-ammā
فَأَمَّا
Then as for
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believed
fayaʿlamūna
فَيَعْلَمُونَ
[thus] they will know
annahu
أَنَّهُ
that it
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
(is) the truth
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
wa-ammā
وَأَمَّا
And as for
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieved
fayaqūlūna
فَيَقُولُونَ
[thus] they will say
mādhā
مَاذَا
what
arāda
أَرَادَ
(did) intend
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bihādhā
بِهَذَا
by this
mathalan
مَثَلًا
example
yuḍillu
يُضِلُّ
He lets go astray
bihi
بِهِ
by it
kathīran
كَثِيرًا
many
wayahdī
وَيَهْدِي
and He guides
bihi
بِهِ
by it
kathīran
كَثِيرًا
many
wamā
وَمَا
And not
yuḍillu
يُضِلُّ
He lets go astray
bihi
بِهِ
by it
illā
إِلَّا
except
l-fāsiqīna
الْفَاسِقِينَ
the defiantly disobedient

26

26.

Indeed, Allah is not timid to present an example - that of a mosquito or what is smaller than it. And those who have believed know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, "What did Allah intend by this as an example?" He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient,

26

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yanquḍūna
يَنْقُضُونَ
break
ʿahda
عَهْدَ
(the) Covenant
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mīthāqihi
مِيثَاقِهِ
its ratification
wayaqṭaʿūna
وَيَقْطَعُونَ
and [they] cut
mā
مَا
what
amara
أَمَرَ
has ordered
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bihi
بِهِ
it
an
أَنْ
to
yūṣala
يُوصَلَ
be joined
wayuf'sidūna
وَيُفْسِدُونَ
and [they] spread corruption
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
humu
هُمُ
they
l-khāsirūna
الْخَاسِرُونَ
(are) the losers

27

27.

Who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and cause corruption on earth. It is those who are the losers.

27

kayfa
كَيْفَ
How
takfurūna
تَكْفُرُونَ
(can) you disbelieve
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wakuntum
وَكُنْتُمْ
While you were
amwātan
أَمْوَاتًا
dead
fa-aḥyākum
فَأَحْيَاكُمْ
then He gave you life
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
yumītukum
يُمِيتُكُمْ
He will cause you to die
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
yuḥ'yīkum
يُحْيِيكُمْ
He will give you life
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
to Him
tur'jaʿūna
تُرْجَعُونَ
you will be returned

28

28.

How can you disbelieve in Allah when you were lifeless and He brought you to life; then He will cause you to die, then He will bring you [back] to life, and then to Him you will be returned.

28

huwa
هُوَ
He
alladhī
الَّذِي
(is) the One Who
khalaqa
خَلَقَ
created
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
mā
مَا
what
fī
فِي
(is) in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
jamīʿan
جَمِيعًا
all
thumma
ثُمَّ
Moreover
is'tawā
اسْتَوَى
He turned
ilā
إِلَى
to
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the heaven
fasawwāhunna
فَسَوَّاهُنَّ
and fashioned them
sabʿa
سَبْعَ
seven
samāwātin
سَمَاوَاتٍ
heavens
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
And He
bikulli
بِكُلِّ
of every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knowing

29

29.

It is He who created for you all of that which is on the earth. Then He directed Himself to the heaven, [His being above all creation], and made them seven heavens, and He is Knowing of all things.

29

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qāla
قَالَ
said
rabbuka
رَبُّكَ
your Lord
lil'malāikati
لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ
to the angels
innī
إِنِّي
Indeed, I (am)
jāʿilun
جَاعِلٌ
going to place
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
khalīfatan
خَلِيفَةً
a vicegerent
qālū
قَالُوا
they said
atajʿalu
أَتَجْعَلُ
Will You place
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
man
مَنْ
(one) who
yuf'sidu
يُفْسِدُ
will spread corruption
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
wayasfiku
وَيَسْفِكُ
and will shed
l-dimāa
الدِّمَاءَ
[the] blood[s]
wanaḥnu
وَنَحْنُ
while we
nusabbiḥu
نُسَبِّحُ
[we] glorify (You)
biḥamdika
بِحَمْدِكَ
with Your praises
wanuqaddisu
وَنُقَدِّسُ
and we sanctify
laka
لَكَ
[to] You
qāla
قَالَ
He said
innī
إِنِّي
Indeed, I
aʿlamu
أَعْلَمُ
[I] know
mā
مَا
what
lā
لَا
(do) not
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
you know

30

30.

And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority." They said, "Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we declare Your praise and sanctify You?" Allah said, "Indeed, I know that which you do not know."

30

waʿallama
وَعَلَّمَ
And He taught
ādama
ءَادَمَ
Adam
l-asmāa
الْأَسْمَاءَ
the names
kullahā
كُلَّهَا
all of them
thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
ʿaraḍahum
عَرَضَهُمْ
He displayed them
ʿalā
عَلَى
to
l-malāikati
الْمَلَائِكَةِ
the angels
faqāla
فَقَالَ
then He said
anbiūnī
أَنْبِئُونِي
Inform Me
bi-asmāi
بِأَسْمَاءِ
of (the) names
hāulāi
هَؤُلَاءِ
(of) these
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
ṣādiqīna
صَادِقِينَ
truthful

31

31.

And He taught Adam the names - all of them. Then He showed them to the angels and said, "Inform Me of the names of these, if you are truthful."

31

qālū
قَالُوا
They said
sub'ḥānaka
سُبْحَانَكَ
Glory be to You
lā
لَا
No
ʿil'ma
عِلْمَ
knowledge
lanā
لَنَا
(is) for us
illā
إِلَّا
except
mā
مَا
what
ʿallamtanā
عَلَّمْتَنَا
You have taught us
innaka
إِنَّكَ
Indeed You
anta
أَنْتَ
You
l-ʿalīmu
الْعَلِيمُ
(are) the All-Knowing
l-ḥakīmu
الْحَكِيمُ
the All-Wise

32

32.

They said, "Exalted are You; we have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Indeed, it is You who is the Knowing, the Wise."

32

qāla
قَالَ
He said
yāādamu
يَاءَادَمُ
O Adam!
anbi'hum
أَنْبِئْهُمْ
Inform them
bi-asmāihim
بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ
of their names
falammā
فَلَمَّا
And when
anba-ahum
أَنْبَأَهُمْ
he had informed them
bi-asmāihim
بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ
of their names
qāla
قَالَ
He said
alam
أَلَمْ
Did not
aqul
أَقُلْ
I say
lakum
لَكُمْ
to you
innī
إِنِّي
Indeed, I
aʿlamu
أَعْلَمُ
[I] know
ghayba
غَيْبَ
(the) unseen
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
(of) the heavens
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth
wa-aʿlamu
وَأَعْلَمُ
and I know
mā
مَا
what
tub'dūna
تُبْدُونَ
you reveal
wamā
وَمَا
and what
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you [were]
taktumūna
تَكْتُمُونَ
conceal

33

33.

He said, "O Adam, inform them of their names." And when he had informed them of their names, He said, "Did I not tell you that I know the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth? And I know what you reveal and what you have concealed."

33

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qul'nā
قُلْنَا
We said
lil'malāikati
لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ
to the angels
us'judū
اسْجُدُوا
Prostrate
liādama
لِءَادَمَ
to Adam
fasajadū
فَسَجَدُوا
[so] they prostrated
illā
إِلَّا
except
ib'līsa
إِبْلِيسَ
Iblees
abā
أَبَى
He refused
wa-is'takbara
وَاسْتَكْبَرَ
and was arrogant
wakāna
وَكَانَ
and became
mina
مِنَ
of
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
the disbelievers

34

34.

And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate before Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.

34

waqul'nā
وَقُلْنَا
And We said
yāādamu
يَاءَادَمُ
O Adam
us'kun
اسْكُنْ
Dwell
anta
أَنْتَ
you
wazawjuka
وَزَوْجُكَ
and your spouse
l-janata
الْجَنَّةَ
(in) Paradise
wakulā
وَكُلَا
and [you both] eat
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from it
raghadan
رَغَدًا
freely
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
(from) wherever
shi'tumā
شِئْتُمَا
you [both] wish
walā
وَلَا
But do not
taqrabā
تَقْرَبَا
[you two] approach
hādhihi
هَذِهِ
this
l-shajarata
الشَّجَرَةَ
[the] tree
fatakūnā
فَتَكُونَا
lest you [both] be
mina
مِنَ
of
l-ẓālimīna
الظَّالِمِينَ
the wrongdoers

35

35.

And We said, "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will. But do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."

35

fa-azallahumā
فَأَزَلَّهُمَا
Then made [both of] them slip
l-shayṭānu
الشَّيْطَانُ
the Shaitaan
ʿanhā
عَنْهَا
from it
fa-akhrajahumā
فَأَخْرَجَهُمَا
and he got [both of] them out
mimmā
مِمَّا
from what
kānā
كَانَا
they [both] were
fīhi
فِيهِ
in [it]
waqul'nā
وَقُلْنَا
And We said
ih'biṭū
اهْبِطُوا
Go down (all of you)
baʿḍukum
بَعْضُكُمْ
some of you
libaʿḍin
لِبَعْضٍ
to others
ʿaduwwun
عَدُوٌّ
(as) enemy
walakum
وَلَكُمْ
and for you
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
mus'taqarrun
مُسْتَقَرٌّ
(is) a dwelling place
wamatāʿun
وَمَتَاعٌ
and a provision
ilā
إِلَى
for
ḥīnin
حِينٍ
a period

36

36.

But Satan caused them to slip out of it and removed them from that [condition] in which they had been. And We said, "Go down, [all of you], as enemies to one another, and you will have upon the earth a place of settlement and provision for a time."

36

fatalaqqā
فَتَلَقَّى
Then received
ādamu
ءَادَمُ
Adam
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihi
رَبِّهِ
his Lord
kalimātin
كَلِمَاتٍ
words
fatāba
فَتَابَ
So (his Lord) turned
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
towards him
innahu
إِنَّهُ
Indeed He
huwa
هُوَ
He
l-tawābu
التَّوَّابُ
(is) the Oft-returning (to mercy)
l-raḥīmu
الرَّحِيمُ
the Most Merciful

37

37.

Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

37

qul'nā
قُلْنَا
We said
ih'biṭū
اهْبِطُوا
Go down
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from it
jamīʿan
جَمِيعًا
all (of you)
fa-immā
فَإِمَّا
and when
yatiyannakum
يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ
comes to you
minnī
مِنِّي
from Me
hudan
هُدًى
Guidance
faman
فَمَنْ
then whoever
tabiʿa
تَبِعَ
follows
hudāya
هُدَايَ
My Guidance
falā
فَلَا
[then] no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
(will be) on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
will grieve

38

38.

We said, "Go down from it, all of you. And when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

38

wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
who disbelieve[d]
wakadhabū
وَكَذَّبُوا
and deny
biāyātinā
بِءَايَاتِنَا
Our Signs
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
those
aṣḥābu
أَصْحَابُ
(are the) companions
l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire
hum
هُمْ
they
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
(will) abide forever

39

39.

And those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those will be companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally."

39

yābanī
يَابَنِي
O Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel!
udh'kurū
اذْكُرُوا
Remember
niʿ'matiya
نِعْمَتِيَ
My Favor
allatī
الَّتِي
which
anʿamtu
أَنْعَمْتُ
I bestowed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
wa-awfū
وَأَوْفُوا
and fulfill
biʿahdī
بِعَهْدِي
My Covenant
ūfi
أُوفِ
I will fulfill
biʿahdikum
بِعَهْدِكُمْ
your covenant
wa-iyyāya
وَإِيَّايَ
and Me Alone
fa-ir'habūni
فَارْهَبُونِ
fear [Me]

40

40.

O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and fulfill My covenant [upon you] that I will fulfill your covenant [from Me], and be afraid of [only] Me.

40

waāminū
وَءَامِنُوا
And believe
bimā
بِمَا
in what
anzaltu
أَنْزَلْتُ
I have sent down
muṣaddiqan
مُصَدِّقًا
confirming
limā
لِمَا
that which
maʿakum
مَعَكُمْ
(is) with you
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
takūnū
تَكُونُوا
be
awwala
أَوَّلَ
(the) first
kāfirin
كَافِرٍ
disbeliever
bihi
بِهِ
of it
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tashtarū
تَشْتَرُوا
exchange
biāyātī
بِءَايَاتِي
My Signs (for)
thamanan
ثَمَنًا
a price
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
small
wa-iyyāya
وَإِيَّايَ
and Me Alone
fa-ittaqūni
فَاتَّقُونِ
fear [Me]

41

41.

And believe in what I have sent down confirming that which is [already] with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it. And do not exchange My signs for a small price, and fear [only] Me.

41

walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
talbisū
تَلْبِسُوا
mix
l-ḥaqa
الْحَقَّ
the Truth
bil-bāṭili
بِالْبَاطِلِ
with [the] falsehood
wataktumū
وَتَكْتُمُوا
and conceal
l-ḥaqa
الْحَقَّ
the Truth
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
[you] know

42

42.

And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].

42

wa-aqīmū
وَأَقِيمُوا
And establish
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
waātū
وَءَاتُوا
and give
l-zakata
الزَّكَوةَ
zakah
wa-ir'kaʿū
وَارْكَعُوا
and bow down
maʿa
مَعَ
with
l-rākiʿīna
الرَّاكِعِينَ
those who bow down

43

43.

And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in worship and obedience].

43

atamurūna
أَتَأْمُرُونَ
Do you order
l-nāsa
النَّاسَ
[the] people
bil-biri
بِالْبِرِّ
[the] righteousness
watansawna
وَتَنْسَوْنَ
and you forget
anfusakum
أَنْفُسَكُمْ
yourselves
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
tatlūna
تَتْلُونَ
[you] recite
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
afalā
أَفَلَا
Then will not
taʿqilūna
تَعْقِلُونَ
you use reason

44

44.

Do you order righteousness of the people and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Then will you not reason?

44

wa-is'taʿīnū
وَاسْتَعِينُوا
And seek help
bil-ṣabri
بِالصَّبْرِ
through patience
wal-ṣalati
وَالصَّلَوةِ
and the prayer
wa-innahā
وَإِنَّهَا
and indeed it
lakabīratun
لَكَبِيرَةٌ
(is) surely difficult
illā
إِلَّا
except
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
l-khāshiʿīna
الْخَاشِعِينَ
the humble ones

45

45.

And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive [to Allah]

45

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yaẓunnūna
يَظُنُّونَ
believe
annahum
أَنَّهُمْ
that they
mulāqū
مُلَاقُوا
will meet
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
wa-annahum
وَأَنَّهُمْ
and that they
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
to Him
rājiʿūna
رَاجِعُونَ
will return

46

46.

Who are certain that they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.

46

yābanī
يَابَنِي
O Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel!
udh'kurū
اذْكُرُوا
Remember
niʿ'matiya
نِعْمَتِيَ
My Favor
allatī
الَّتِي
which
anʿamtu
أَنْعَمْتُ
I bestowed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
wa-annī
وَأَنِّي
and that I
faḍḍaltukum
فَضَّلْتُكُمْ
[I] preferred you
ʿalā
عَلَى
over
l-ʿālamīna
الْعَالَمِينَ
the worlds

47

47.

O Children of Israel, remember My favor that I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.

47

wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
yawman
يَوْمًا
a day
lā
لَا
(will) not
tajzī
تَجْزِي
avail
nafsun
نَفْسٌ
any soul
ʿan
عَنْ
for
nafsin
نَفْسٍ
(another) soul
shayan
شَيْئًا
anything
walā
وَلَا
and not
yuq'balu
يُقْبَلُ
will be accepted
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from it
shafāʿatun
شَفَاعَةٌ
any intercession
walā
وَلَا
and not
yu'khadhu
يُؤْخَذُ
will be taken
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from it
ʿadlun
عَدْلٌ
a compensation
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yunṣarūna
يُنْصَرُونَ
will be helped

48

48.

And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be aided.

48

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
najjaynākum
نَجَّيْنَاكُمْ
We saved you
min
مِنْ
from
āli
ءَالِ
(the) people
fir'ʿawna
فِرْعَوْنَ
(of) Firaun
yasūmūnakum
يَسُومُونَكُمْ
(who were) afflicting you (with)
sūa
سُوءَ
horrible
l-ʿadhābi
الْعَذَابِ
torment
yudhabbiḥūna
يُذَبِّحُونَ
slaughtering
abnāakum
أَبْنَاءَكُمْ
your sons
wayastaḥyūna
وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ
and letting live
nisāakum
نِسَاءَكُمْ
your women
wafī
وَفِي
And in
dhālikum
ذَلِكُمْ
that
balāon
بَلَاءٌ
(was) a trial
min
مِنْ
from
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
ʿaẓīmun
عَظِيمٌ
great

49

49.

And [recall] when We saved your forefathers from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment, slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

49

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
faraqnā
فَرَقْنَا
We parted
bikumu
بِكُمُ
for you
l-baḥra
الْبَحْرَ
the sea
fa-anjaynākum
فَأَنْجَيْنَاكُمْ
then We saved you
wa-aghraqnā
وَأَغْرَقْنَا
and We drowned
āla
ءَالَ
(the) people
fir'ʿawna
فِرْعَوْنَ
(of) Firaun
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
tanẓurūna
تَنْظُرُونَ
(were) looking

50

50.

And [recall] when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.

50

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
wāʿadnā
وَاعَدْنَا
We appointed
mūsā
مُوسَى
(for) Musa
arbaʿīna
أَرْبَعِينَ
forty
laylatan
لَيْلَةً
nights
thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
ittakhadhtumu
اتَّخَذْتُمُ
you took
l-ʿij'la
الْعِجْلَ
the calf
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdihi
بَعْدِهِ
after him
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you
ẓālimūna
ظَالِمُونَ
(were) wrongdoers

51

51.

And [recall] when We made an appointment with Moses for forty nights. Then you took [for worship] the calf after him, while you were wrongdoers.

51

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
ʿafawnā
عَفَوْنَا
We forgave
ʿankum
عَنْكُمْ
you
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tashkurūna
تَشْكُرُونَ
(be) grateful

52

52.

Then We forgave you after that so perhaps you would be grateful.

52

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
ātaynā
ءَاتَيْنَا
We gave
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
wal-fur'qāna
وَالْفُرْقَانَ
and the Criterion
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
perhaps you
tahtadūna
تَهْتَدُونَ
(would be) guided

53

53.

And [recall] when We gave Moses the Scripture and criterion that perhaps you would be guided.

53

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qāla
قَالَ
said
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
liqawmihi
لِقَوْمِهِ
to his people
yāqawmi
يَاقَوْمِ
O my people!
innakum
إِنَّكُمْ
Indeed you
ẓalamtum
ظَلَمْتُمْ
[you] have wronged
anfusakum
أَنْفُسَكُمْ
yourselves
bi-ittikhādhikumu
بِاتِّخَاذِكُمُ
by your taking
l-ʿij'la
الْعِجْلَ
the calf
fatūbū
فَتُوبُوا
So turn in repentance
ilā
إِلَى
to
bāri-ikum
بَارِئِكُمْ
your Creator
fa-uq'tulū
فَاقْتُلُوا
and kill
anfusakum
أَنْفُسَكُمْ
yourselves
dhālikum
ذَلِكُمْ
That
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) better
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
bāri-ikum
بَارِئِكُمْ
your Creator
fatāba
فَتَابَ
Then He turned
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
towards you
innahu
إِنَّهُ
Indeed He!
huwa
هُوَ
He
l-tawābu
التَّوَّابُ
(is) the Oft-returning
l-raḥīmu
الرَّحِيمُ
the Most Merciful

54

54.

And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship]. So repent to your Creator and kill yourselves. That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator." Then He accepted your repentance; indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

54

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qul'tum
قُلْتُمْ
you said
yāmūsā
يَامُوسَى
O Musa
lan
لَنْ
Never
nu'mina
نُؤْمِنَ
(will) we believe
laka
لَكَ
in you
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
narā
نَرَى
we see
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
jahratan
جَهْرَةً
manifestly
fa-akhadhatkumu
فَأَخَذَتْكُمُ
So seized you
l-ṣāʿiqatu
الصَّاعِقَةُ
the thunderbolt
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
tanẓurūna
تَنْظُرُونَ
(were) looking

55

55.

And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we will never believe you until we see Allah outright"; so the thunderbolt took you while you were looking on.

55

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
baʿathnākum
بَعَثْنَاكُمْ
We revived you
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mawtikum
مَوْتِكُمْ
your death
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tashkurūna
تَشْكُرُونَ
(be) grateful

56

56.

Then We revived you after your death that perhaps you would be grateful.

56

waẓallalnā
وَظَلَّلْنَا
And We shaded
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
[over] you
l-ghamāma
الْغَمَامَ
(with) [the] clouds
wa-anzalnā
وَأَنْزَلْنَا
and We sent down
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
to you
l-mana
الْمَنَّ
[the] manna
wal-salwā
وَالسَّلْوَى
and [the] quails
kulū
كُلُوا
Eat
min
مِنْ
from
ṭayyibāti
طَيِّبَاتِ
(the) good things
mā
مَا
that
razaqnākum
رَزَقْنَاكُمْ
We have provided you
wamā
وَمَا
And not
ẓalamūnā
ظَلَمُونَا
they wronged Us
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
but
kānū
كَانُوا
they were
anfusahum
أَنْفُسَهُمْ
(to) themselves
yaẓlimūna
يَظْلِمُونَ
doing wrong

57

57.

And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not - but they were [only] wronging themselves.

57

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qul'nā
قُلْنَا
We said
ud'khulū
ادْخُلُوا
Enter
hādhihi
هَذِهِ
this
l-qaryata
الْقَرْيَةَ
town
fakulū
فَكُلُوا
then eat
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from [it]
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
wherever
shi'tum
شِئْتُمْ
you wish[ed]
raghadan
رَغَدًا
abundantly
wa-ud'khulū
وَادْخُلُوا
and enter
l-bāba
الْبَابَ
the gate
sujjadan
سُجَّدًا
prostrating
waqūlū
وَقُولُوا
And say
ḥiṭṭatun
حِطَّةٌ
Repentance
naghfir
نَغْفِرْ
We will forgive
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
khaṭāyākum
خَطَايَاكُمْ
your sins
wasanazīdu
وَسَنَزِيدُ
And We will increase
l-muḥ'sinīna
الْمُحْسِنِينَ
the good-doers (in reward)

58

58.

And [recall] when We said, "Enter this city and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance, and enter the gate bowing humbly and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens.' We will [then] forgive your sins for you, and We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

58

fabaddala
فَبَدَّلَ
But changed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ẓalamū
ظَلَمُوا
wronged
qawlan
قَوْلًا
(the) word
ghayra
غَيْرَ
other (than)
alladhī
الَّذِي
that which
qīla
قِيلَ
was said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
fa-anzalnā
فَأَنْزَلْنَا
so We sent down
ʿalā
عَلَى
upon
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ẓalamū
ظَلَمُوا
wronged
rij'zan
رِجْزًا
a punishment
mina
مِنَ
from
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the sky
bimā
بِمَا
because
kānū
كَانُوا
they were
yafsuqūna
يَفْسُقُونَ
defiantly disobeying

59

59.

But those who wronged changed [those words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them, so We sent down upon those who wronged a punishment from the sky because they were defiantly disobeying.

59

wa-idhi
وَإِذِ
And when
is'tasqā
اسْتَسْقَى
asked (for) water
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
liqawmihi
لِقَوْمِهِ
for his people
faqul'nā
فَقُلْنَا
[so] We said
iḍ'rib
اضْرِبْ
Strike
biʿaṣāka
بِعَصَاكَ
with your staff
l-ḥajara
الْحَجَرَ
the stone
fa-infajarat
فَانْفَجَرَتْ
Then gushed forth
min'hu
مِنْهُ
from it
ith'natā
اثْنَتَا
(of)
ʿashrata
عَشْرَةَ
twelve
ʿaynan
عَيْنًا
springs
qad
قَدْ
Indeed
ʿalima
عَلِمَ
knew
kullu
كُلُّ
all
unāsin
أُنَاسٍ
(the) people
mashrabahum
مَشْرَبَهُمْ
their drinking place
kulū
كُلُوا
Eat
wa-ish'rabū
وَاشْرَبُوا
and drink
min
مِنْ
from
riz'qi
رِزْقِ
(the) provision (of)
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
taʿthaw
تَعْثَوْا
act wickedly
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
muf'sidīna
مُفْسِدِينَ
spreading corruption

60

60.

And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people, so We said, "Strike with your staff the stone." And there gushed forth from it twelve springs, and every people knew its watering place. "Eat and drink from the provision of Allah, and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

60

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qul'tum
قُلْتُمْ
you said
yāmūsā
يَامُوسَى
O Musa
lan
لَنْ
Never (will)
naṣbira
نَصْبِرَ
we endure
ʿalā
عَلَى
[on]
ṭaʿāmin
طَعَامٍ
food
wāḥidin
وَاحِدٍ
(of) one (kind)
fa-ud'ʿu
فَادْعُ
so pray
lanā
لَنَا
for us
rabbaka
رَبَّكَ
(to) your Lord
yukh'rij
يُخْرِجْ
to bring forth
lanā
لَنَا
for us
mimmā
مِمَّا
out of what
tunbitu
تُنْبِتُ
grows
l-arḍu
الْأَرْضُ
the earth
min
مِنْ
of
baqlihā
بَقْلِهَا
its herbs
waqithāihā
وَقِثَّائِهَا
[and] its cucumbers
wafūmihā
وَفُومِهَا
[and] its garlic
waʿadasihā
وَعَدَسِهَا
[and] its lentils
wabaṣalihā
وَبَصَلِهَا
and its onions
qāla
قَالَ
He said
atastabdilūna
أَتَسْتَبْدِلُونَ
Would you exchange
alladhī
الَّذِي
that which
huwa
هُوَ
[it]
adnā
أَدْنَى
(is) inferior
bi-alladhī
بِالَّذِي
for that which
huwa
هُوَ
[it]
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) better
ih'biṭū
اهْبِطُوا
Go down
miṣ'ran
مِصْرًا
(to) a city
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
so indeed
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
mā
مَا
(is) what
sa-altum
سَأَلْتُمْ
you have asked (for)
waḍuribat
وَضُرِبَتْ
And were struck
ʿalayhimu
عَلَيْهِمُ
on them
l-dhilatu
الذِّلَّةُ
the humiliation
wal-maskanatu
وَالْمَسْكَنَةُ
and the misery
wabāū
وَبَاءُو
and they drew on themselves
bighaḍabin
بِغَضَبٍ
wrath
mina
مِنَ
of
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That (was)
bi-annahum
بِأَنَّهُمْ
because they
kānū
كَانُوا
used to
yakfurūna
يَكْفُرُونَ
disbelieve
biāyāti
بِءَايَاتِ
in (the) Signs
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wayaqtulūna
وَيَقْتُلُونَ
and kill
l-nabiyīna
النَّبِيِّينَ
the Prophets
bighayri
بِغَيْرِ
without (any)
l-ḥaqi
الْحَقِّ
[the] right
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
bimā
بِمَا
(was) because
ʿaṣaw
عَصَوْا
they disobeyed
wakānū
وَكَانُوا
and they were
yaʿtadūna
يَعْتَدُونَ
transgressing

61

61.

And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food. So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic and its lentils and its onions." [Moses] said, "Would you exchange what is better for what is less? Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked." And they were covered with humiliation and poverty and returned with anger from Allah [upon them]. That was because they [repeatedly] disbelieved in the signs of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and were [habitually] transgressing.

61

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believed
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
and those who
hādū
هَادُوا
became Jews
wal-naṣārā
وَالنَّصَارَى
and the Christians
wal-ṣābiīna
وَالصَّابِءِينَ
and the Sabians
man
مَنْ
who
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believed
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
waʿamila
وَعَمِلَ
and did
ṣāliḥan
صَالِحًا
righteous deeds
falahum
فَلَهُمْ
so for them
ajruhum
أَجْرُهُمْ
(is) their reward
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
walā
وَلَا
and no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
will grieve

62

62.

Indeed, those who believed and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabeans [before Prophet Muhammad] - those [among them] who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

62

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
akhadhnā
أَخَذْنَا
We took
mīthāqakum
مِيثَاقَكُمْ
your covenant
warafaʿnā
وَرَفَعْنَا
and We raised
fawqakumu
فَوْقَكُمُ
over you
l-ṭūra
الطُّورَ
the mount
khudhū
خُذُوا
Hold
mā
مَا
what
ātaynākum
ءَاتَيْنَاكُمْ
We have given you
biquwwatin
بِقُوَّةٍ
with strength
wa-udh'kurū
وَاذْكُرُوا
and remember
mā
مَا
what
fīhi
فِيهِ
(is) in it
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
perhaps you
tattaqūna
تَتَّقُونَ
(would become) righteous

63

63.

And [recall] when We took your covenant, [O Children of Israel, to abide by the Torah] and We raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that perhaps you may become righteous."

63

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
tawallaytum
تَوَلَّيْتُمْ
you turned away
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
falawlā
فَلَوْلَا
So if not
faḍlu
فَضْلُ
(for the) Grace
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
waraḥmatuhu
وَرَحْمَتُهُ
and His Mercy
lakuntum
لَكُنْتُمْ
surely you would have been
mina
مِنَ
of
l-khāsirīna
الْخَاسِرِينَ
the losers

64

64.

Then you turned away after that. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have been among the losers.

64

walaqad
وَلَقَدْ
And indeed
ʿalim'tumu
عَلِمْتُمُ
you knew
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
iʿ'tadaw
اعْتَدَوْا
transgressed
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
fī
فِي
in
l-sabti
السَّبْتِ
the (matter of) Sabbath
faqul'nā
فَقُلْنَا
So We said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
kūnū
كُونُوا
Be
qiradatan
قِرَدَةً
apes
khāsiīna
خَاسِئِينَ
despised

65

65.

And you had already known about those who transgressed among you concerning the sabbath, and We said to them, "Be apes, despised."

65

fajaʿalnāhā
فَجَعَلْنَاهَا
So We made it
nakālan
نَكَالًا
a deterrent punishment
limā
لِمَا
for those
bayna
بَيْنَ
(in) front
yadayhā
يَدَيْهَا
(of) them
wamā
وَمَا
and those
khalfahā
خَلْفَهَا
after them
wamawʿiẓatan
وَمَوْعِظَةً
and an admonition
lil'muttaqīna
لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
for those who fear (Allah)

66

66.

And We made it a deterrent punishment for those who were present and those who succeeded [them] and a lesson for those who fear Allah.

66

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qāla
قَالَ
said
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
liqawmihi
لِقَوْمِهِ
to his people
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha

Allah

commands you
an

that

baqaratan
بَقَرَةً
a cow
qālū
قَالُوا
They said
atattakhidhunā
أَتَتَّخِذُنَا
Do you take us

هُزُوًا

qāla

He said
aʿūdhu
أَعُوذُ
I seek refuge
bil-lahi

in Allah
an
أَنْ
that
akūna
أَكُونَ
I be
mina
مِنَ
among
l-jāhilīna
الْجَاهِلِينَ
the ignorant

67

67.

And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow." They said, "Do you take us in ridicule?" He said, "I seek refuge in Allah from being among the ignorant."

67

qālū
قَالُوا
They said
ud'ʿu

لَنَا
for us

baqaratun
بَقَرَةٌ
(is) a cow
lā
لَا
not

فَارِضٌ
old
walā
وَلَا
and not
bik'run
بِكْرٌ
young
ʿawānun
عَوَانٌ
middle aged
bayna
بَيْنَ
between
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
fa-if'ʿalū
فَافْعَلُوا
so do
mā
مَا
what
tu'marūna
تُؤْمَرُونَ
you are commanded

68

68.

They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is." [Moses] said, "[Allah] says, 'It is a cow which is neither old nor virgin, but median between that,' so do what you are commanded."

68

qālū
قَالُوا
They said

for us

qāla

He said

إِنَّهَا
[Indeed] it is
baqaratun
بَقَرَةٌ
a cow
ṣafrāu
صَفْرَاءُ

fāqiʿun
فَاقِعٌ
bright
lawnuhā
لَوْنُهَا
(in) its color
tasurru
تَسُرُّ
pleasing
l-nāẓirīna
النَّاظِرِينَ
(to) those who see (it)

69

69.

They said, "Call upon your Lord to show us what is her color." He said, "He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers.' "

69

qālū
قَالُوا
They said
ud'ʿu

Pray

لَنَا
for us

to us

what
hiya

it (is)
inna

Indeed
l-baqara
الْبَقَرَ
[the] cows
tashābaha
تَشَابَهَ
look alike
ʿalaynā
عَلَيْنَا
to us
wa-innā
وَإِنَّا
And indeed we
in
إِنْ
if
shāa
شَاءَ
wills
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lamuh'tadūna
لَمُهْتَدُونَ
(will) surely be those who are guided

70

70.

They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is. Indeed, [all] cows look alike to us. And indeed we, if Allah wills, will be guided."

70

qāla
قَالَ
He said
innahu
إِنَّهُ
Indeed He
yaqūlu
يَقُولُ
says
innahā
إِنَّهَا
[Indeed] it
baqaratun
بَقَرَةٌ
(is) a cow
lā
لَا
not
dhalūlun
ذَلُولٌ
trained
tuthīru
تُثِيرُ
to plough
l-arḍa
الْأَرْضَ
the earth
walā
وَلَا
and not
tasqī
تَسْقِي
water
l-ḥartha
الْحَرْثَ
the field
musallamatun
مُسَلَّمَةٌ
sound
lā
لَا
no
shiyata
شِيَةَ
blemish
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
qālū
قَالُوا
They said
l-āna
الْءَانَ
Now
ji'ta
جِئْتَ
you have come
bil-ḥaqi
بِالْحَقِّ
with the truth
fadhabaḥūhā
فَذَبَحُوهَا
So they slaughtered it
wamā
وَمَا
and not
kādū
كَادُوا
they were near
yafʿalūna
يَفْعَلُونَ
(to) doing (it)

71

71.

He said, "He says, 'It is a cow neither trained to plow the earth nor to irrigate the field, one free from fault with no spot upon her.' " They said, "Now you have come with the truth." So they slaughtered her, but they could hardly do it.

71

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qataltum
قَتَلْتُمْ
you killed
nafsan
نَفْسًا
a man
fa-iddāratum
فَادَّارَءْتُمْ
then you disputed
fīhā
فِيهَا
concerning it
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
but Allah
mukh'rijun
مُخْرِجٌ
(is) the One Who brought forth
mā
مَا
what
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you were
taktumūna
تَكْتُمُونَ
concealing

72

72.

And [recall] when you slew a man and disputed over it, but Allah was to bring out that which you were concealing.

72

faqul'nā
فَقُلْنَا
So We said
iḍ'ribūhu
اضْرِبُوهُ
Strike him
bibaʿḍihā
بِبَعْضِهَا
with a part of it
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Like this
yuḥ'yī
يُحْيِي
revives
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
l-mawtā
الْمَوْتَى
the dead
wayurīkum
وَيُرِيكُمْ
and shows you
āyātihi
ءَايَاتِهِ
His Signs
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
perhaps you may
taʿqilūna
تَعْقِلُونَ
use your intellect

73

73.

So, We said, "Strike the slain man with part of it." Thus does Allah bring the dead to life, and He shows you His signs that you might reason.

73

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
qasat
قَسَتْ
hardened
qulūbukum
قُلُوبُكُمْ
your hearts
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
fahiya
فَهِيَ
so they
kal-ḥijārati
كَالْحِجَارَةِ
(became) like [the] stones
aw
أَوْ
or
ashaddu
أَشَدُّ
stronger
qaswatan
قَسْوَةً
(in) hardness
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
And indeed
mina
مِنَ
from
l-ḥijārati
الْحِجَارَةِ
the stones
lamā
لَمَا
certainly (there are some) which
yatafajjaru
يَتَفَجَّرُ
gush forth

مِنْهُ
from it
l-anhāru
الْأَنْهَارُ
[the] rivers
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
and indeed
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from them
lamā
لَمَا
certainly (there are some) which
yashaqqaqu
يَشَّقَّقُ

فَيَخْرُجُ
so comes out

مِنْهُ
from it
l-māu
الْمَاءُ
[the] water
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
and indeed
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from them
lamā
لَمَا
certainly (there are some) which
yahbiṭu
يَهْبِطُ
fall down
min
مِنْ
from
khashyati
خَشْيَةِ
fear
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wamā
وَمَا
And not
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(is) Allah
bighāfilin
بِغَافِلٍ
unaware
ʿammā
عَمَّا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do

74

74.

Then your hearts became hardened after that, being like stones or even harder. For indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth, and there are some of them that split open and water comes out, and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allah. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

74

afataṭmaʿūna
أَفَتَطْمَعُونَ
Do you hope
an
أَنْ
that
yu'minū
يُؤْمِنُوا
they will believe
lakum
لَكُمْ
[for] you
waqad
وَقَدْ
while indeed
kāna
كَانَ
(there) has been
farīqun
فَرِيقٌ
a party
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
of them
yasmaʿūna
يَسْمَعُونَ
(who used to) hear
kalāma
كَلَامَ
(the) words
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
yuḥarrifūnahu
يُحَرِّفُونَهُ
they distort it
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
ʿaqalūhu
عَقَلُوهُ
they understood it
wahum
وَهُمْ
while they
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know

75

75.

Do you covet [the hope, O believers], that they would believe for you while a party of them used to hear the words of Allah and then distort the Torah after they had understood it while they were knowing?

75

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
laqū
لَقُوا
they meet
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
āmannā
ءَامَنَّا
We have believed
wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
But when
khalā
خَلَا
meet in private
baʿḍuhum
بَعْضُهُمْ
some of them
ilā
إِلَى
with
baʿḍin
بَعْضٍ
some (others)
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
atuḥaddithūnahum
أَتُحَدِّثُونَهُمْ
Do you tell them
bimā
بِمَا
what
fataḥa
فَتَحَ
has
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
to you
liyuḥājjūkum
لِيُحَاجُّوكُمْ
so that they argue with you
bihi
بِهِ
therewith
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
before
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
afalā
أَفَلَا
Then do (you) not
taʿqilūna
تَعْقِلُونَ
understand

76

76.

And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We have believed"; but when they are alone with one another, they say, "Do you talk to them about what Allah has revealed to you so they can argue with you about it before your Lord?" Then will you not reason?

76

awalā
أَوَلَا
Do not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
they know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yaʿlamu
يَعْلَمُ
knows
mā
مَا
what
yusirrūna
يُسِرُّونَ
they conceal
wamā
وَمَا
and what
yuʿ'linūna
يُعْلِنُونَ
they declare

77

77.

But do they not know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare?

77

wamin'hum
وَمِنْهُمْ
And among them
ummiyyūna
أُمِّيُّونَ
(are) unlettered ones
lā
لَا
(who) do not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the book
illā
إِلَّا
except
amāniyya
أَمَانِيَّ
wishful thinking
wa-in
وَإِنْ
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
illā
إِلَّا
(do anything) except
yaẓunnūna
يَظُنُّونَ
guess

78

78.

And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Scripture except in wishful thinking, but they are only assuming.

78

fawaylun
فَوَيْلٌ
So woe
lilladhīna
لِلَّذِينَ
to those who
yaktubūna
يَكْتُبُونَ
write
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the book
bi-aydīhim
بِأَيْدِيهِمْ
with their (own) hands
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
yaqūlūna
يَقُولُونَ
they say
hādhā
هَذَا
This
min
مِنْ
(is)
ʿindi
عِنْدِ
from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
liyashtarū
لِيَشْتَرُوا
to barter
bihi
بِهِ
with it
thamanan
ثَمَنًا
(for) a price
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
little
fawaylun
فَوَيْلٌ
So woe
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
mimmā
مِمَّا
for what
katabat
كَتَبَتْ
have written
aydīhim
أَيْدِيهِمْ
their hands
wawaylun
وَوَيْلٌ
and woe
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
mimmā
مِمَّا
for what
yaksibūna
يَكْسِبُونَ
they earn

79

79.

So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands, then say, "This is from Allah," in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.

79

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they say
lan
لَنْ
Never
tamassanā
تَمَسَّنَا
will touch us
l-nāru
النَّارُ
the Fire
illā
إِلَّا
except
ayyāman
أَيَّامًا
(for) days
maʿdūdatan
مَعْدُودَةً
numbered
qul
قُلْ
Say
attakhadhtum
أَتَّخَذْتُمْ
Have you taken
ʿinda

from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
ʿahdan
عَهْدًا
a covenant
falan
فَلَنْ
so never
yukh'lifa
يُخْلِفَ
will break
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
ʿahdahu
عَهْدَهُ
His Covenant
am
أَمْ
Or
taqūlūna
تَقُولُونَ
(do) you say
ʿalā
عَلَى
against
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
mā
مَا
what
lā
لَا
not
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
you know

80

80.

And they say, "Never will the Fire touch us, except for a few days." Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will never break His covenant. Or do you say about Allah that which you do not know?"

80

balā
بَلَى
Yes
man
مَنْ
whoever
kasaba
كَسَبَ
earned
sayyi-atan
سَيِّئَةً
evil
wa-aḥāṭat
وَأَحَاطَتْ
and surrounded him
bihi
بِهِ
with
khaṭīatuhu
خَطِيءَتُهُ
his sins
fa-ulāika
فَأُولَئِكَ
[so] those
aṣḥābu

(are the) companions
l-nāri

hum
هُمْ
they
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
(will) abide forever

81

81.

Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

81

wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ

believed

they
fīhā

in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
(will) abide forever

82

82.

But they who believe and do righteous deeds - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.

82

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
akhadhnā
أَخَذْنَا
We took

(the) covenant
banī
بَنِي
(from the) Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel
lā
لَا
Not
taʿbudūna
تَعْبُدُونَ
you will worship
illā
إِلَّا
except
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wabil-wālidayni
وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ
and with [the] parents
iḥ'sānan
إِحْسَانًا
(be) good
wadhī
وَذِي
and (with)
l-qur'bā
الْقُرْبَى
relatives
wal-yatāmā
وَالْيَتَامَى

wal-masākīni
وَالْمَسَاكِينِ
and the needy
waqūlū
وَقُولُوا
and speak
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
to [the] people
ḥus'nan
حُسْنًا
good
wa-aqīmū
وَأَقِيمُوا
and establish
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
waātū
وَءَاتُوا
and give
l-zakata
الزَّكَوةَ
the zakah
thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
tawallaytum
تَوَلَّيْتُمْ
you turned away
illā
إِلَّا
except
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
a few
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
of you
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you (were)
muʿ'riḍūna
مُعْرِضُونَ
refusing

83

83.

And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], "Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah." Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.

83

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
akhadhnā
أَخَذْنَا
We took
mīthāqakum
مِيثَاقَكُمْ
your covenant
lā
لَا
Not
tasfikūna
تَسْفِكُونَ
will you shed
dimāakum
دِمَاءَكُمْ
your blood
walā
وَلَا
and not
tukh'rijūna
تُخْرِجُونَ
(will) evict
anfusakum
أَنْفُسَكُمْ
yourselves
min
مِنْ
from
diyārikum
دِيَارِكُمْ
your homes
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
aqrartum
أَقْرَرْتُمْ
you ratified
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
tashhadūna
تَشْهَدُونَ
(were) witnessing

84

84.

And [recall] when We took your covenant, [saying], "Do not shed each other's blood or evict one another from your homes." Then you acknowledged [this] while you were witnessing.

84

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
antum
أَنْتُمْ
you

هَؤُلَاءِ

yourselves

and evict

a party
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
of you
min
مِنْ
from
diyārihim
دِيَارِهِمْ

taẓāharūna
تَظَاهَرُونَ

ʿalayhim

against them
bil-ith'mi
بِالْإِثْمِ
in sin
wal-ʿud'wāni

and [the] transgression
wa-in

usārā

afatu'minūna
أَفَتُؤْمِنُونَ

bibaʿḍi

watakfurūna
وَتَكْفُرُونَ

بِبَعْضٍ
in part
famā
فَمَا
Then what
jazāu
جَزَاءُ
(should be the) recompense
man

(for the one) who
yafʿalu
يَفْعَلُ
does
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
illā

except

خِزْيٌ

fī
فِي
in
l-ḥayati
الْحَيَوةِ
the life
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
(of) the world
wayawma
وَيَوْمَ
and (on the) Day
l-qiyāmati
الْقِيَامَةِ
of [the] Resurrection
yuraddūna
يُرَدُّونَ
they will be sent back
ilā
إِلَى
to
ashaddi
أَشَدِّ
(the) most severe
l-ʿadhābi
الْعَذَابِ

wamā
وَمَا
And not
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(is) Allah
bighāfilin
بِغَافِلٍ
unaware
ʿammā
عَمَّا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do

85

85.

Then, you are those [same ones who are] killing one another and evicting a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest of punishment. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

85

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(are) the ones who
ish'tarawū
اشْتَرَوُا
bought
l-ḥayata
الْحَيَوةَ
the life
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
(of) the world
bil-ākhirati
بِالْءَاخِرَةِ
for the Hereafter
falā
فَلَا
so not
yukhaffafu
يُخَفَّفُ
will be lightened
ʿanhumu
عَنْهُمُ
for them
l-ʿadhābu
الْعَذَابُ
the punishment
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yunṣarūna
يُنْصَرُونَ
will be helped

86

86.

Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world [in exchange] for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided.

86

walaqad
وَلَقَدْ
And indeed
ātaynā
ءَاتَيْنَا
We gave
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
waqaffaynā
وَقَفَّيْنَا
and We followed up
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdihi
بَعْدِهِ
after him
bil-rusuli
بِالرُّسُلِ
with [the] Messengers
waātaynā
وَءَاتَيْنَا
And We gave
ʿīsā
عِيسَى
Isa
ib'na
ابْنَ
(the) son
maryama
مَرْيَمَ
(of) Maryam
l-bayināti
الْبَيِّنَاتِ
[the] clear signs
wa-ayyadnāhu
وَأَيَّدْنَاهُ
and We supported him
birūḥi
بِرُوحِ
(with)
l-qudusi
الْقُدُسِ
the Holy Spirit
afakullamā
أَفَكُلَّمَا
Is it (not) so (that) whenever
jāakum
جَاءَكُمْ
came to you
rasūlun
رَسُولٌ
a Messenger
bimā
بِمَا
with what
lā
لَا
(does) not
tahwā
تَهْوَى
desire
anfusukumu
أَنْفُسُكُمُ
yourselves
is'takbartum
اسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ
you acted arrogantly
fafarīqan
فَفَرِيقًا
So a party
kadhabtum
كَذَّبْتُمْ
you denied
wafarīqan
وَفَرِيقًا
and a party
taqtulūna
تَقْتُلُونَ
you kill(ed)

87

87.

And We did certainly give Moses the Torah and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.

87

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they said
qulūbunā
قُلُوبُنَا
Our hearts
ghul'fun
غُلْفٌ
(are) wrapped
bal
بَلْ
Nay
laʿanahumu
لَعَنَهُمُ
has cursed them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bikuf'rihim
بِكُفْرِهِمْ
for their disbelief
faqalīlan
فَقَلِيلًا
so little
mā
مَا
(is) what
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
they believe

88

88.

And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped." But, [in fact], Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe.

88

walammā
وَلَمَّا
And when
jāahum
جَاءَهُمْ
came to them

كِتَابٌ
a Book
min

what (was)
maʿahum
مَعَهُمْ
with them

وَكَانُوا
though they used to
min
مِنْ
from
qablu
قَبْلُ
before
yastaftiḥūna

(that), pray for victory
ʿalā

over

came to them

kafarū
كَفَرُوا
they disbelieved
bihi
بِهِ
in it

فَلَعْنَةُ
So (the) curse
l-lahi

(of) Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
(is) on
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
the disbelievers

89

89.

And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which was with them - although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers.

89

bi'samā
بِئْسَمَا
Evil (is) that
ish'taraw
اشْتَرَوْا
(for) which they have sold
bihi
بِهِ
with
anfusahum
أَنْفُسَهُمْ
themselves
an
أَنْ
that
yakfurū
يَكْفُرُوا
they disbelieve
bimā
بِمَا
in what
anzala
أَنْزَلَ
has revealed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
baghyan
بَغْيًا
grudging
an
أَنْ
that
yunazzila
يُنَزِّلَ
sends down
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
min
مِنْ
of
faḍlihi
فَضْلِهِ
His Grace
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
min
مِنْ
from
ʿibādihi
عِبَادِهِ
His servants
fabāū
فَبَاءُو
So they have drawn (on themselves)
bighaḍabin
بِغَضَبٍ
wrath
ʿalā
عَلَى
upon
ghaḍabin
غَضَبٍ
wrath
walil'kāfirīna
وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ
And for the disbelievers
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
muhīnun
مُهِينٌ
humiliating

90

90.

How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed through [their] outrage that Allah would send down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they returned having [earned] wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.

90

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qīla
قِيلَ
it is said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
āminū
ءَامِنُوا
Believe
bimā
بِمَا
in what
anzala
أَنْزَلَ
has revealed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
nu'minu
نُؤْمِنُ
We believe
bimā
بِمَا
in what
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
was revealed
ʿalaynā
عَلَيْنَا
to us
wayakfurūna
وَيَكْفُرُونَ
And they disbelieve
bimā
بِمَا
in what
warāahu
وَرَاءَهُ
(is) besides it
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
while it
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
(is) the truth
muṣaddiqan
مُصَدِّقًا
confirming
limā
لِمَا
what
maʿahum
مَعَهُمْ
(is) with them
qul
قُلْ
Say
falima
فَلِمَ
Then why
taqtulūna
تَقْتُلُونَ
(did) you kill
anbiyāa
أَنْبِيَاءَ
(the) Prophets
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
min
مِنْ
from
qablu
قَبْلُ
before
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you were
mu'minīna
مُؤْمِنِينَ
believers

91

91.

And when it is said to them, "Believe in what Allah has revealed," they say, "We believe [only] in what was revealed to us." And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are [indeed] believers?"

91

walaqad
وَلَقَدْ
And indeed
jāakum
جَاءَكُمْ
came to you
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
bil-bayināti
بِالْبَيِّنَاتِ
with [the] clear signs
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
ittakhadhtumu
اتَّخَذْتُمُ
you took
l-ʿij'la
الْعِجْلَ
the calf
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdihi
بَعْدِهِ
after him
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you
ẓālimūna
ظَالِمُونَ
(were) wrongdoers

92

92.

And Moses had certainly brought you clear proofs. Then you took the calf [in worship] after that, while you were wrongdoers.

92

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
akhadhnā
أَخَذْنَا
We took
mīthāqakum
مِيثَاقَكُمْ
your covenant
warafaʿnā
وَرَفَعْنَا
and We raised
fawqakumu
فَوْقَكُمُ
over you
l-ṭūra
الطُّورَ
the mount
khudhū
خُذُوا
Hold
mā
مَا
what
ātaynākum
ءَاتَيْنَاكُمْ
We gave you
biquwwatin
بِقُوَّةٍ
with firmness
wa-is'maʿū
وَاسْمَعُوا
and listen
qālū
قَالُوا
They said
samiʿ'nā
سَمِعْنَا
We heard
waʿaṣaynā
وَعَصَيْنَا
and we disobeyed
wa-ush'ribū
وَأُشْرِبُوا
And they were made to drink
fī
فِي
in
qulūbihimu
قُلُوبِهِمُ
their hearts
l-ʿij'la
الْعِجْلَ
(love of) the calf
bikuf'rihim
بِكُفْرِهِمْ
because of their disbelief
qul
قُلْ
Say
bi'samā
بِئْسَمَا
Evil (is) that
yamurukum
يَأْمُرُكُمْ
orders you (to do) it
bihi
بِهِ
with
īmānukum
إِيمَانُكُمْ
your faith
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
mu'minīna
مُؤْمِنِينَ
believers

93

93.

And [recall] when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and listen." They said [instead], "We hear and disobey." And their hearts absorbed [the worship of] the calf because of their disbelief. Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers."

93

qul
قُلْ
Say
in
إِنْ
If
kānat
كَانَتْ
is
lakumu
لَكُمُ
for you
l-dāru
الدَّارُ
the home
l-ākhiratu
الْءَاخِرَةُ
(of) the Hereafter
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
khāliṣatan
خَالِصَةً
exclusively
min
مِنْ
from
dūni
دُونِ
excluding
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the mankind
fatamannawū
فَتَمَنَّوُا
then wish
l-mawta
الْمَوْتَ
(for) [the] death
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
ṣādiqīna
صَادِقِينَ
truthful

94

94.

Say, [O Muhammad], "If the home of the Hereafter with Allah is for you alone and not the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful.

94

walan
وَلَنْ
And never (will)
yatamannawhu
يَتَمَنَّوْهُ
they wish for it
abadan
أَبَدًا
ever
bimā
بِمَا
because
qaddamat
قَدَّمَتْ
(of what) sent ahead
aydīhim
أَيْدِيهِمْ
their hands
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knower
bil-ẓālimīna
بِالظَّالِمِينَ
of the wrongdoers

95

95.

But they will never wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

95

walatajidannahum
وَلَتَجِدَنَّهُمْ
And surely you will find them
aḥraṣa
أَحْرَصَ
(the) most greedy
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
(of) [the] mankind
ʿalā
عَلَى
for
ḥayatin
حَيَوةٍ
life
wamina
وَمِنَ
and (greedier) than
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ashrakū
أَشْرَكُوا
associate[d] partners (with Allah)
yawaddu
يَوَدُّ
Loves
aḥaduhum
أَحَدُهُمْ
(each) one of them
law
لَوْ
if
yuʿammaru
يُعَمَّرُ
he could be granted a life
alfa
أَلْفَ
(of) a thousand
sanatin
سَنَةٍ
year(s)
wamā
وَمَا
But not
huwa
هُوَ
it
bimuzaḥziḥihi
بِمُزَحْزِحِهِ
(will) remove him
mina
مِنَ
from
l-ʿadhābi
الْعَذَابِ
the punishment
an
أَنْ
that
yuʿammara
يُعَمَّرَ
he should be granted life
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
baṣīrun
بَصِيرٌ
(is) All-Seer
bimā
بِمَا
of what
yaʿmalūna
يَعْمَلُونَ
they do

96

96.

And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - [even] more than those who associate others with Allah. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years, but it would not remove him in the least from the [coming] punishment that he should be granted life. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.

96

qul
قُلْ
Say
man
مَنْ
Whoever
kāna
كَانَ
is
ʿaduwwan
عَدُوًّا
an enemy
lijib'rīla
لِجِبْرِيلَ
to Jibreel
fa-innahu
فَإِنَّهُ
then indeed he
nazzalahu
نَزَّلَهُ
brought it down
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
qalbika
قَلْبِكَ
your heart
bi-idh'ni
بِإِذْنِ
by (the) permission
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
muṣaddiqan
مُصَدِّقًا
confirming
limā
لِمَا
what
bayna
بَيْنَ
(was)
yadayhi
يَدَيْهِ
before it
wahudan
وَهُدًى
and a guidance
wabush'rā
وَبُشْرَى
and glad tiding(s)
lil'mu'minīna
لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
for the believers

97

97.

Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is [none but] he who has brought the Qur'an down upon your heart, [O Muhammad], by permission of Allah, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."

97

man
مَنْ
Whoever
kāna
كَانَ
is
ʿaduwwan
عَدُوًّا
an enemy
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
(to) Allah
wamalāikatihi
وَمَلَائِكَتِهِ
and His Angels
warusulihi
وَرُسُلِهِ
and His Messengers
wajib'rīla
وَجِبْرِيلَ
and Jibreel
wamīkāla
وَمِيكَالَ
and Meekael
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿaduwwun
عَدُوٌّ
(is) an enemy
lil'kāfirīna
لِلْكَافِرِينَ
to the disbelievers

98

98.

Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.

98

walaqad
وَلَقَدْ
And indeed
anzalnā
أَنْزَلْنَا
We revealed
ilayka
إِلَيْكَ
to you
āyātin
ءَايَاتٍ
Verses
bayyinātin
بَيِّنَاتٍ
clear
wamā
وَمَا
and not
yakfuru
يَكْفُرُ
disbelieves
bihā
بِهَا
in them
illā
إِلَّا
except
l-fāsiqūna
الْفَاسِقُونَ
the defiantly disobedient

99

99.

And We have certainly revealed to you verses [which are] clear proofs, and no one would deny them except the defiantly disobedient.

99

awakullamā
أَوَكُلَّمَا
And is (it not that) whenever
ʿāhadū
عَاهَدُوا
they took
ʿahdan
عَهْدًا
a covenant
nabadhahu
نَبَذَهُ
threw it away
farīqun

a party
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
of them
bal
بَلْ
Nay
aktharuhum
أَكْثَرُهُمْ
most of them
lā
لَا
(do) not
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
believe

100

100.

Is it not [true] that every time they took a covenant a party of them threw it away? But, [in fact], most of them do not believe.

100

walammā
وَلَمَّا
And when
jāahum
جَاءَهُمْ
came to them
rasūlun
رَسُولٌ
a Messenger
min
مِنْ
(of)
ʿindi

from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
muṣaddiqun
مُصَدِّقٌ
confirming
limā
لِمَا
what
maʿahum

(was) with them
nabadha
نَبَذَ
threw away
farīqun
فَرِيقٌ
a party
mina
مِنَ
of
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ūtū

were given
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book

l-lahi

(of) Allah
warāa

behind
ẓuhūrihim
ظُهُورِهِمْ

ka-annahum
كَأَنَّهُمْ
as if they
lā
لَا
(do) not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know

101

101.

And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].

101

wa-ittabaʿū
وَاتَّبَعُوا
And they followed
mā

what
tatlū

ʿalā

over
mul'ki

(the) kingdom

(of) Sulaiman
wamā
وَمَا
And not
kafara
كَفَرَ
disbelieved
sulaymānu
سُلَيْمَانُ
Sulaiman
walākinna
وَلَكِنَّ
[and] but
l-shayāṭīna
الشَّيَاطِينَ
the devils

كَفَرُوا

wamā

yuʿallimāni

they both teach
min

any
aḥadin

one

unless

they [both] say
innamā
إِنَّمَا
Only
naḥnu

فِتْنَةٌ
(are) a trial
falā
فَلَا
so (do) not
takfur

disbelieve

from those two

what
yufarriqūna

wayataʿallamūna

what

profits them
walaqad

And indeed
ʿalimū

lamani

that whoever
ish'tarāhu

buys it
mā

lahu
لَهُ
for him
fī
فِي
in
l-ākhirati
الْءَاخِرَةِ
the Hereafter
min
مِنْ
any
khalāqin
خَلَاقٍ
share
walabi'sa
وَلَبِئْسَ
And surely evil
mā
مَا
(is) what
sharaw
شَرَوْا
they sold
bihi
بِهِ
with it
anfusahum
أَنْفُسَهُمْ
themselves
law
لَوْ
if
kānū
كَانُوا
they were
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
(to) know

102

102.

And they followed [instead] what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon. It was not Solomon who disbelieved, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut. But the two angels do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]." And [yet] they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allah. And the people learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But the Children of Israel certainly knew that whoever purchased the magic would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew.

102

walaw
وَلَوْ
And if
annahum
أَنَّهُمْ
[that] they
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
(had) believed
wa-ittaqaw
وَاتَّقَوْا
and feared (Allah)
lamathūbatun
لَمَثُوبَةٌ
surely (the) reward
min
مِنْ
(of)
ʿindi
عِنْدِ
from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(would have been) better
law
لَوْ
if
kānū
كَانُوا
they were
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
(to) know

103

103.

And if they had believed and feared Allah, then the reward from Allah would have been [far] better, if they only knew.

103

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
lā
لَا
(Do) not
taqūlū
تَقُولُوا
say
rāʿinā
رَاعِنَا
Raina
waqūlū
وَقُولُوا
and say
unẓur'nā
انْظُرْنَا
Unzurna
wa-is'maʿū
وَاسْمَعُوا
and listen
walil'kāfirīna
وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ
And for the disbelievers
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
alīmun
أَلِيمٌ
painful

104

104.

O you who have believed, say not [to Allah 's Messenger], "Ra'ina" but say, "Unthurna" and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

104

mā
مَا
(Do) not
yawaddu
يَوَدُّ
like
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieve
min
مِنْ
from
ahli
أَهْلِ
(the) People
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
(of) the Book
walā
وَلَا
and not
l-mush'rikīna
الْمُشْرِكِينَ
those who associate partners (with Allah)
an
أَنْ
that
yunazzala
يُنَزَّلَ
(there should) be sent down
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
to you
min
مِنْ
any
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
min
مِنْ
from
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yakhtaṣṣu
يَخْتَصُّ
chooses
biraḥmatihi
بِرَحْمَتِهِ
for His Mercy
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
dhū
ذُو
(is the) Possessor
l-faḍli
الْفَضْلِ
(of) [the] Bounty
l-ʿaẓīmi
الْعَظِيمِ
[the] Great

105

105.

Neither those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture nor the polytheists wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

105

mā
مَا
What
nansakh
نَنْسَخْ
We abrogate
min
مِنْ
(of)
āyatin
ءَايَةٍ
a sign
aw
أَوْ
or
nunsihā
نُنْسِهَا
[We] cause it to be forgotten
nati
نَأْتِ
We bring
bikhayrin
بِخَيْرٍ
better
min'hā
مِنْهَا
than it
aw
أَوْ
or
mith'lihā
مِثْلِهَا
similar (to) it
alam
أَلَمْ
Do not
taʿlam
تَعْلَمْ
you know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
over
kulli
كُلِّ
every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
qadīrun
قَدِيرٌ
(is) All-Powerful

106

106.

We do not abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten except that We bring forth [one] better than it or similar to it. Do you not know that Allah is over all things competent?

106

alam
أَلَمْ
Do not
taʿlam
تَعْلَمْ
you know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
lahu
لَهُ
for Him
mul'ku
مُلْكُ
(is the) Kingdom
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
(of) the heavens
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth
wamā
وَمَا
And not
lakum
لَكُمْ
(is) for you
min
مِنْ
from
dūni
دُونِ
besides
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
min
مِنْ
any
waliyyin
وَلِيٍّ
protector
walā
وَلَا
and not
naṣīrin
نَصِيرٍ
any helper

107

107.

Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and [that] you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper?

107

am
أَمْ
Or
turīdūna
تُرِيدُونَ
(do) you wish
an
أَنْ
that
tasalū
تَسْءَلُوا
you ask
rasūlakum
رَسُولَكُمْ
your Messenger
kamā
كَمَا
as
su-ila
سُئِلَ
was asked
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
min
مِنْ
from
qablu
قَبْلُ
before
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
yatabaddali
يَتَبَدَّلِ
exchanges
l-kuf'ra
الْكُفْرَ
[the] disbelief
bil-īmāni
بِالْإِيمَانِ
with [the] faith
faqad
فَقَدْ
so certainly
ḍalla
ضَلَّ
he went astray (from)
sawāa
سَوَاءَ
(the) evenness
l-sabīli
السَّبِيلِ
(of) the way

108

108.

Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

108

wadda
وَدَّ
Wish[ed]
kathīrun
كَثِيرٌ
many
min
مِنْ
from
ahli
أَهْلِ
(the) People
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
(of) the Book
law
لَوْ
if
yaruddūnakum
يَرُدُّونَكُمْ
they could turn you back
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
īmānikum
إِيمَانِكُمْ
your (having) faith
kuffāran
كُفَّارًا
(to) disbelievers
ḥasadan
حَسَدًا
(out of) jealousy
min
مِنْ
from
ʿindi
عِنْدِ
(of)
anfusihim
أَنْفُسِهِمْ
themselves
min
مِنْ
(even) from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
tabayyana
تَبَيَّنَ
became clear
lahumu
لَهُمُ
to them
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
the truth
fa-iʿ'fū
فَاعْفُوا
So forgive
wa-iṣ'faḥū
وَاصْفَحُوا
and overlook
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yatiya
يَأْتِيَ
brings
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bi-amrihi
بِأَمْرِهِ
His Command
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
kulli
كُلِّ
every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
qadīrun
قَدِيرٌ
(is) All-Powerful

109

109.

Many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves [even] after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allah delivers His command. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

109

wa-aqīmū
وَأَقِيمُوا
And establish
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
waātū
وَءَاتُوا
and give
l-zakata
الزَّكَوةَ
[the] zakah
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tuqaddimū
تُقَدِّمُوا
you send forth
li-anfusikum
لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ
for yourselves
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good (deeds)
tajidūhu
تَجِدُوهُ
you will find it
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
baṣīrun
بَصِيرٌ
(is) All-Seer

110

110.

And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah of what you do, is Seeing.

110

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they said
lan
لَنْ
Never
yadkhula
يَدْخُلَ
will enter
l-janata
الْجَنَّةَ
the Paradise
illā
إِلَّا
except
man
مَنْ
who
kāna
كَانَ
is
hūdan
هُودًا
(a) Jew[s]
aw
أَوْ
or
naṣārā
نَصَارَى
(a) Christian[s]
til'ka
تِلْكَ
That
amāniyyuhum
أَمَانِيُّهُمْ
(is) their wishful thinking
qul
قُلْ
Say
hātū
هَاتُوا
Bring
bur'hānakum
بُرْهَانَكُمْ
your proof
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
ṣādiqīna
صَادِقِينَ
[those who are] truthful

111

111.

And they say, "None will enter Paradise except one who is a Jew or a Christian." That is [merely] their wishful thinking, Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."

111

balā
بَلَى
Yes
man
مَنْ
whoever
aslama
أَسْلَمَ
submits
wajhahu
وَجْهَهُ
his face
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
to Allah
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
and he
muḥ'sinun
مُحْسِنٌ
(is) a good-doer
falahu
فَلَهُ
so for him
ajruhu
أَجْرُهُ
(is) his reward
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
rabbihi
رَبِّهِ
his Lord
walā
وَلَا
And no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
(will be) on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
(will) grieve

112

112.

Yes [on the contrary], whoever submits his face in Islam to Allah while being a doer of good will have his reward with his Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

112

waqālati
وَقَالَتِ
And said
l-yahūdu
الْيَهُودُ
the Jews
laysati
لَيْسَتِ
Not

the Christians

shayin

anything

the Christians
laysati
لَيْسَتِ
Not
l-yahūdu

the Jews
ʿalā
عَلَى
(are) on
shayin

anything

قَالَ
said

الَّذِينَ
those who
lā
لَا
(do) not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know
mith'la
مِثْلَ
similar
qawlihim
قَوْلِهِمْ
their saying
fal-lahu
فَاللَّهُ
[So] Allah
yaḥkumu
يَحْكُمُ
will judge
baynahum
بَيْنَهُمْ
between them
yawma
يَوْمَ
(on the) Day
l-qiyāmati
الْقِيَامَةِ
(of) Resurrection
fīmā
فِيمَا
in what
kānū
كَانُوا
they were
fīhi
فِيهِ
[in it]
yakhtalifūna
يَخْتَلِفُونَ
differing

113

113.

The Jews say "The Christians have nothing [true] to stand on," and the Christians say, "The Jews have nothing to stand on," although they [both] recite the Scripture. Thus the polytheists speak the same as their words. But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

113

waman
وَمَنْ
And who
aẓlamu
أَظْلَمُ
(is) more unjust
mimman
مِمَّنْ
than (one) who
manaʿa
مَنَعَ
prevents
masājida
مَسَاجِدَ
(the) masajid
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
an
أَنْ
to
yudh'kara
يُذْكَرَ
be mentioned
fīhā
فِيهَا
in them
us'muhu
اسْمُهُ
His name
wasaʿā
وَسَعَى
and strives
fī
فِي
for
kharābihā
خَرَابِهَا
their destruction
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those!
mā
مَا
Not
kāna
كَانَ
it is
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
an
أَنْ
that
yadkhulūhā
يَدْخُلُوهَا
they enter them
illā
إِلَّا
except
khāifīna
خَائِفِينَ
(like) those in fear
lahum
لَهُمْ
For them
fī
فِي
in
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
khiz'yun
خِزْيٌ
(is) disgrace
walahum
وَلَهُمْ
and for them
fī
فِي
in
l-ākhirati
الْءَاخِرَةِ
the Hereafter
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
ʿaẓīmun
عَظِيمٌ
great

114

114.

And who are more unjust than those who prevent the name of Allah from being mentioned in His mosques and strive toward their destruction. It is not for them to enter them except in fear. For them in this world is disgrace, and they will have in the Hereafter a great punishment.

114

walillahi
وَلِلَّهِ
And for Allah
l-mashriqu
الْمَشْرِقُ
(is) the east
wal-maghribu
وَالْمَغْرِبُ
and the west
fa-aynamā
فَأَيْنَمَا
so wherever
tuwallū
تُوَلُّوا
you turn
fathamma
فَثَمَّ
[so] there
wajhu
وَجْهُ
(is the) face
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wāsiʿun
وَاسِعٌ
(is) All-Encompassing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

115

115.

And to Allah belongs the east and the west. So wherever you [might] turn, there is the Face of Allah. Indeed, Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

115

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they said
ittakhadha
اتَّخَذَ
has taken
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
waladan
وَلَدًا
a son
sub'ḥānahu
سُبْحَانَهُ
Glory be to Him
bal
بَلْ
Nay
lahu
لَهُ
for Him
mā
مَا
(is) what
fī
فِي
(is) in
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
the heavens
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth
kullun
كُلٌّ
All
lahu
لَهُ
to Him
qānitūna
قَانِتُونَ
(are) humbly obedient

116

116.

They say, "Allah has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him,

116

badīʿu
بَدِيعُ
(The) Originator
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
(of) the heavens
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth!
wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qaḍā
قَضَى
He decrees
amran
أَمْرًا
a matter
fa-innamā
فَإِنَّمَا
[so] only
yaqūlu
يَقُولُ
He says
lahu
لَهُ
to it
kun
كُنْ
Be
fayakūnu
فَيَكُونُ
and it becomes

117

117.

Originator of the heavens and the earth. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

117

waqāla
وَقَالَ
And said
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
lā
لَا
(do) not
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know

لَوْلَا
Why not

يُكَلِّمُنَا
speaks to us

aw

or

from

مِثْلَ
similar
qawlihim
