their saying
tashābahat
تَشَابَهَتْ
Became alike
qulūbuhum
قُلُوبُهُمْ
their hearts
qad
قَدْ
Indeed
bayyannā
بَيَّنَّا
We have made clear
l-āyāti
الْءَايَاتِ
the signs
liqawmin
لِقَوْمٍ
for people
yūqinūna
يُوقِنُونَ
(who) firmly believe

118

118.

Those who do not know say, "Why does Allah not speak to us or there come to us a sign?" Thus spoke those before them like their words. Their hearts resemble each other. We have shown clearly the signs to a people who are certain [in faith].

118

innā
إِنَّا
Indeed We!
arsalnāka
أَرْسَلْنَاكَ
[We] have sent you
bil-ḥaqi
بِالْحَقِّ
with the truth
bashīran
بَشِيرًا
(as) a bearer of good news
wanadhīran
وَنَذِيرًا
and (as) a warner
walā
وَلَا
And not
tus'alu
تُسْءَلُ
you will be asked
ʿan
عَنْ
about
aṣḥābi
أَصْحَابِ
(the) companions
l-jaḥīmi
الْجَحِيمِ
(of) the blazing Fire

119

119.

Indeed, We have sent you, [O Muhammad], with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.

119

walan
وَلَنْ
And never

تَرْضَى
will be pleased

عَنْكَ
with you

الْيَهُودُ

Indeed
hudā

(the) Guidance

huwa
هُوَ

وَلِيٍّ

walā
وَلَا
and not
naṣīrin
نَصِيرٍ
any helper

120

120.

And never will the Jews or the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance." If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah no protector or helper.

120

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those
ātaynāhumu
ءَاتَيْنَاهُمُ
We have given them
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
yatlūnahu
يَتْلُونَهُ
recite it
ḥaqqa
حَقَّ
(as it has the) right
tilāwatihi
تِلَاوَتِهِ
(of) its recitation
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those (people)
yu'minūna
يُؤْمِنُونَ
believe
bihi
بِهِ
in it
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
yakfur
يَكْفُرْ
disbelieves
bihi
بِهِ
in it
fa-ulāika
فَأُولَئِكَ
then those
humu
هُمُ
they
l-khāsirūna
الْخَاسِرُونَ
(are) the losers

121

121.

Those to whom We have given the Book recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it. And whoever disbelieves in it - it is they who are the losers.

121

yābanī
يَابَنِي
O Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel!
udh'kurū
اذْكُرُوا
Remember
niʿ'matiya
نِعْمَتِيَ
My Favor
allatī
الَّتِي
which
anʿamtu
أَنْعَمْتُ
I bestowed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
wa-annī
وَأَنِّي
and that I
faḍḍaltukum
فَضَّلْتُكُمْ
[I] preferred you
ʿalā
عَلَى
over
l-ʿālamīna
الْعَالَمِينَ
the worlds

122

122.

O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.

122

wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
yawman
يَوْمًا
a day
lā
لَا
not
tajzī
تَجْزِي
will avail
nafsun
نَفْسٌ
a soul
ʿan
عَنْ
(of)
nafsin
نَفْسٍ
(another) soul
shayan
شَيْئًا
anything
walā
وَلَا
and not
yuq'balu
يُقْبَلُ
will be accepted
min'hā
مِنْهَا
from it
ʿadlun
عَدْلٌ
any compensation
walā
وَلَا
and not
tanfaʿuhā
تَنْفَعُهَا
will benefit it
shafāʿatun
شَفَاعَةٌ
any intercession
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yunṣarūna
يُنْصَرُونَ
will be helped

123

123.

And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, and no compensation will be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided.

123

wa-idhi
وَإِذِ
And when
ib'talā
ابْتَلَى
tried
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Ibrahim
rabbuhu
رَبُّهُ
his Lord
bikalimātin
بِكَلِمَاتٍ
with words
fa-atammahunna
فَأَتَمَّهُنَّ
and he fulfilled them
qāla
قَالَ
He said
innī
إِنِّي
Indeed I
jāʿiluka
جَاعِلُكَ
(am) the One to make you
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for the mankind
imāman
إِمَامًا
a leader
qāla
قَالَ
He said
wamin
وَمِنْ
And from
dhurriyyatī
ذُرِّيَّتِي
my offspring
qāla
قَالَ
He said
lā
لَا
(Does) not
yanālu
يَنَالُ
reach
ʿahdī
عَهْدِي
My Covenant
l-ẓālimīna
الظَّالِمِينَ
(to) the wrongdoers

124

124.

And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them. [Allah] said, "Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people." [Abraham] said, "And of my descendants?" [Allah] said, "My covenant does not include the wrongdoers."

124

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
jaʿalnā
جَعَلْنَا
We made
l-bayta
الْبَيْتَ
the House
mathābatan
مَثَابَةً
a place of return
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for mankind
wa-amnan
وَأَمْنًا
and (a place of) security
wa-ittakhidhū
وَاتَّخِذُوا
and (said) Take
min
مِنْ
[from]
maqāmi
مَقَامِ
(the) standing place
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
(of) Ibrahim
muṣallan
مُصَلًّى
(as) a place of prayer
waʿahid'nā
وَعَهِدْنَا
And We made a covenant
ilā
إِلَى
with
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Ibrahim
wa-is'māʿīla
وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ
and Ismail
an
أَنْ
[that]
ṭahhirā
طَهِّرَا
[You both] purify
baytiya
بَيْتِيَ
My House
lilṭṭāifīna
لِلطَّائِفِينَ
for those who circumambulate
wal-ʿākifīna
وَالْعَاكِفِينَ
and those who seclude themselves for devotion and prayer
wal-rukaʿi
وَالرُّكَّعِ
and those who bow down
l-sujūdi
السُّجُودِ
and those who prostrate

125

125.

And [mention] when We made the House a place of return for the people and [a place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], "Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying [there] for worship and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer]."

125

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qāla
قَالَ
said
ib'rāhīmu
إِبْرَاهِيمُ
Ibrahim
rabbi
رَبِّ
My Lord
ij'ʿal
اجْعَلْ
make
hādhā
هَذَا
this
baladan
بَلَدًا
a city
āminan
ءَامِنًا
secure
wa-ur'zuq
وَارْزُقْ
and provide
ahlahu
أَهْلَهُ
its people
mina
مِنَ
with
l-thamarāti
الثَّمَرَاتِ
fruits
man
مَنْ
(to) whoever
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believed
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
from them
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
the Last
qāla
قَالَ
He said
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
kafara
كَفَرَ
disbelieved
fa-umattiʿuhu
فَأُمَتِّعُهُ
[then] I will grant him enjoyment
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
a little
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
aḍṭarruhu
أَضْطَرُّهُ
I will force him
ilā
إِلَى
to
ʿadhābi
عَذَابِ
(the) punishment
l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire
wabi'sa
وَبِئْسَ
and evil
l-maṣīru
الْمَصِيرُ
(is) the destination

126

126.

And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." [Allah] said. "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."

126

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
yarfaʿu
يَرْفَعُ
(was) raising
ib'rāhīmu
إِبْرَاهِيمُ
Ibrahim
l-qawāʿida
الْقَوَاعِدَ
the foundations
mina
مِنَ
of
l-bayti
الْبَيْتِ
the House
wa-is'māʿīlu
وَإِسْمَاعِيلُ
and Ishmael
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
(saying), "Our Lord
taqabbal
تَقَبَّلْ
Accept
minnā
مِنَّا
from us
innaka
إِنَّكَ
Indeed You
anta
أَنْتَ
[You] (are)
l-samīʿu
السَّمِيعُ
the All-Hearing
l-ʿalīmu
الْعَلِيمُ
the All-Knowing

127

127.

And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

127

rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord!
wa-ij'ʿalnā
وَاجْعَلْنَا
[and] Make us
mus'limayni
مُسْلِمَيْنِ
both submissive
laka
لَكَ
to You
wamin
وَمِنْ
And from
dhurriyyatinā

our offspring
ummatan
أُمَّةً
a community
mus'limatan
مُسْلِمَةً
submissive
laka
لَكَ
to You
wa-arinā
وَأَرِنَا
And show us
manāsikanā
مَنَاسِكَنَا
our ways of worship
watub
وَتُبْ
and turn
ʿalaynā
عَلَيْنَا
to us
innaka
إِنَّكَ
Indeed You!
anta
أَنْتَ
[You] (are)
l-tawābu
التَّوَّابُ
the Oft-returning
l-raḥīmu
الرَّحِيمُ
the Most Merciful

128

128.

Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

128

rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord!
wa-ib'ʿath
وَابْعَثْ
[And] raise up
fīhim
فِيهِمْ
in them
rasūlan
رَسُولًا
a Messenger
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
from them
yatlū
يَتْلُوا
(who) will recite
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
to them
āyātika
ءَايَاتِكَ
Your Verses
wayuʿallimuhumu
وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ
and will teach them
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
wal-ḥik'mata
وَالْحِكْمَةَ
and the wisdom
wayuzakkīhim
وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ
and purify them
innaka
إِنَّكَ
Indeed You!
anta
أَنْتَ
You (are)
l-ʿazīzu
الْعَزِيزُ
the All-Mighty
l-ḥakīmu
الْحَكِيمُ
the All-Wise

129

129.

Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

129

waman
وَمَنْ
And who
yarghabu
يَرْغَبُ
will turn away
ʿan
عَنْ
from
millati
مِلَّةِ
(the) religion
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
(of) Ibrahim
illā
إِلَّا
except
man
مَنْ
who
safiha
سَفِهَ

nafsahu
نَفْسَهُ
himself
walaqadi
وَلَقَدِ
And indeed
iṣ'ṭafaynāhu
اصْطَفَيْنَاهُ
We chose him
fī
فِي
in
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
wa-innahu
وَإِنَّهُ
and indeed he
fī
فِي
in
l-ākhirati
الْءَاخِرَةِ
the Hereafter
lamina
لَمِنَ
surely (will be) among
l-ṣāliḥīna
الصَّالِحِينَ
the righteous

130

130.

And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.

130

idh
إِذْ
When
qāla
قَالَ
said
lahu
لَهُ
to him
rabbuhu
رَبُّهُ
his Lord
aslim
أَسْلِمْ
Submit (yourself)
qāla
قَالَ
he said
aslamtu
أَسْلَمْتُ
I (have) submitted (myself)
lirabbi
لِرَبِّ
to (the) Lord
l-ʿālamīna
الْعَالَمِينَ
(of) the worlds

131

131.

When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted [in Islam] to the Lord of the worlds."

131

wawaṣṣā
وَوَصَّى
And enjoined
bihā
بِهَا
[it]
ib'rāhīmu
إِبْرَاهِيمُ
Ibrahim
banīhi
بَنِيهِ
(upon) his sons
wayaʿqūbu
وَيَعْقُوبُ
and Yaqub
yābaniyya
يَابَنِيَّ
O my sons
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ

iṣ'ṭafā
اصْطَفَى
has chosen
lakumu
لَكُمُ
for you
l-dīna
الدِّينَ
the religion
falā
فَلَا
so not
tamūtunna
تَمُوتُنَّ
(should) you die
illā

except
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
mus'limūna
مُسْلِمُونَ
(are) submissive

132

132.

And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allah has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims."

132

am
أَمْ
Or
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
were you
shuhadāa
شُهَدَاءَ
witnesses
idh
إِذْ
when
ḥaḍara
حَضَرَ
came to
yaʿqūba
يَعْقُوبَ
Yaqub
l-mawtu
الْمَوْتُ
[the] death
idh
إِذْ
when
qāla
قَالَ
he said
libanīhi
لِبَنِيهِ
to his sons
mā
مَا
What
taʿbudūna

will you worship
min

from
baʿdī

after me
qālū
قَالُوا
They said

نَعْبُدُ

ilāhaka
إِلَهَكَ
your God
wa-ilāha
وَإِلَهَ
and (the) God

ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Ibrahim

and Ismail

and Ishaq

God
wāḥidan

One

And we
lahu
لَهُ
to Him
mus'limūna
مُسْلِمُونَ
(are) submissive

133

133.

Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" They said, "We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

133

til'ka
تِلْكَ
This
ummatun
أُمَّةٌ
(was) a community
qad
قَدْ
(which)
khalat
خَلَتْ
has passed away
lahā
لَهَا
for it
mā
مَا
what
kasabat
كَسَبَتْ
it earned
walakum
وَلَكُمْ
and for you
mā
مَا
what
kasabtum
كَسَبْتُمْ
you earned
walā
وَلَا
And not
tus'alūna
تُسْءَلُونَ
you will be asked
ʿammā
عَمَّا
about what
kānū
كَانُوا
they used to
yaʿmalūna
يَعْمَلُونَ
do

134

134.

That was a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.

134

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they said
kūnū
كُونُوا
Be
hūdan
هُودًا
Jews
aw
أَوْ
or
naṣārā
نَصَارَى
Christians
tahtadū
تَهْتَدُوا
(then) you will be guided
qul
قُلْ
Say
bal
بَلْ
Nay
millata
مِلَّةَ
(the) religion
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
(of) Ibrahim
ḥanīfan
حَنِيفًا
(the) upright
wamā
وَمَا
and not
kāna
كَانَ
he was
mina
مِنَ
of
l-mush'rikīna
الْمُشْرِكِينَ
those who associated partners (with Allah)

135

135.

They say, "Be Jews or Christians [so] you will be guided." Say, "Rather, [we follow] the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of the polytheists."

135

qūlū
قُولُوا
Say
āmannā
ءَامَنَّا
We have believed
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wamā
وَمَا
and what
unzila

(is) revealed
ilaynā
إِلَيْنَا
to us
wamā
وَمَا
and what
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
was revealed
ilā
إِلَى
to
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Ibrahim
wa-is'māʿīla
وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ
and Ismail
wa-is'ḥāqa

and Ishaq

and Yaqub

wamā

and what

was given

waʿīsā

and Isa
wamā
وَمَا
and what
ūtiya
أُوتِيَ
was given
l-nabiyūna
النَّبِيُّونَ
(to) the Prophets
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
lā
لَا
Not
nufarriqu
نُفَرِّقُ
we make distinction
bayna
بَيْنَ
between
aḥadin
أَحَدٍ
any
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
of them
wanaḥnu
وَنَحْنُ
And we
lahu
لَهُ
to Him
mus'limūna
مُسْلِمُونَ
(are) submissive

136

136.

Say, [O believers], "We have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

136

fa-in
فَإِنْ
So if
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
they believe[d]
bimith'li
بِمِثْلِ
in (the) like
mā
مَا
(of) what
āmantum
ءَامَنْتُمْ
you have believed
bihi
بِهِ
in [it]
faqadi
فَقَدِ
then indeed
ih'tadaw
اهْتَدَوْا
they are (rightly) guided
wa-in
وَإِنْ
But if
tawallaw
تَوَلَّوْا
they turn away
fa-innamā
فَإِنَّمَا
then only
hum
هُمْ
they
fī
فِي
(are) in
shiqāqin
شِقَاقٍ
dissension
fasayakfīkahumu
فَسَيَكْفِيكَهُمُ
So will suffice you against them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
and He
l-samīʿu
السَّمِيعُ
(is) the All-Hearing
l-ʿalīmu
الْعَلِيمُ
the All-Knowing

137

137.

So if they believe in the same as you believe in, then they have been [rightly] guided; but if they turn away, they are only in dissension, and Allah will be sufficient for you against them. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

137

ṣib'ghata
صِبْغَةَ
(The) color (religion)
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
waman
وَمَنْ
And who
aḥsanu
أَحْسَنُ
(is) better
mina
مِنَ
than
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
ṣib'ghatan
صِبْغَةً
at coloring
wanaḥnu
وَنَحْنُ
And we
lahu
لَهُ
to Him
ʿābidūna
عَابِدُونَ
(are) worshippers

138

138.

[And say, "Ours is] the religion of Allah. And who is better than Allah in [ordaining] religion? And we are worshippers of Him."

138

qul
قُلْ
Say
atuḥājjūnanā
أَتُحَاجُّونَنَا
Do you argue with us
fī
فِي
about
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
while He
rabbunā
رَبُّنَا
(is) our Lord
warabbukum
وَرَبُّكُمْ
and your Lord
walanā
وَلَنَا
And for us
aʿmālunā
أَعْمَالُنَا
(are) our deeds
walakum
وَلَكُمْ
and for you
aʿmālukum
أَعْمَالُكُمْ
(are) your deeds
wanaḥnu
وَنَحْنُ
and we
lahu
لَهُ
to Him
mukh'liṣūna
مُخْلِصُونَ
(are) sincere

139

139.

Say, [O Muhammad], "Do you argue with us about Allah while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. And we are sincere [in deed and intention] to Him."

139

am
أَمْ
Or
taqūlūna
تَقُولُونَ
(do) you say
inna
إِنَّ
that
ib'rāhīma
إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Ibrahim
wa-is'māʿīla
وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ
and Ismail
wa-is'ḥāqa
وَإِسْحَاقَ
and Ishaq
wayaʿqūba
وَيَعْقُوبَ
and Yaqub
wal-asbāṭa
وَالْأَسْبَاطَ
and the descendants
kānū
كَانُوا
were
hūdan
هُودًا
Jews
aw
أَوْ
or
naṣārā
نَصَارَى
Christians
qul
قُلْ
Say
a-antum
ءَأَنْتُمْ
Are you
aʿlamu
أَعْلَمُ
better knowing
ami
أَمِ
or
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(is) Allah
waman
وَمَنْ
And who
aẓlamu
أَظْلَمُ
(is) more unjust
mimman
مِمَّنْ
than (the one) who
katama
كَتَمَ
concealed
shahādatan
شَهَادَةً
a testimony
ʿindahu
عِنْدَهُ
(that) he has
mina
مِنَ
from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
wamā
وَمَا
And not
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(is) Allah
bighāfilin
بِغَافِلٍ
unaware
ʿammā
عَمَّا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do

140

140.

Or do you say that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants were Jews or Christians? Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allah?" And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

140

til'ka
تِلْكَ
This
ummatun
أُمَّةٌ
(was) a community
qad
قَدْ
(which)
khalat
خَلَتْ
has passed away
lahā
لَهَا
for it
mā
مَا
what
kasabat
كَسَبَتْ
it earned
walakum
وَلَكُمْ
and for you
mā
مَا
what
kasabtum
كَسَبْتُمْ
you have earned
walā
وَلَا
And not
tus'alūna
تُسْءَلُونَ
you will be asked
ʿammā
عَمَّا
about what
kānū
كَانُوا
they used to
yaʿmalūna
يَعْمَلُونَ
do

141

141.

That is a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.

141

sayaqūlu
سَيَقُولُ
Will say
l-sufahāu
السُّفَهَاءُ
the foolish ones
mina
مِنَ
from
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the people
mā
مَا
What
wallāhum
وَلَّاهُمْ
(has) turned them
ʿan
عَنْ
from
qib'latihimu
قِبْلَتِهِمُ
their direction of prayer
allatī
الَّتِي
which
kānū
كَانُوا
they were used to
ʿalayhā
عَلَيْهَا
[on it]
qul
قُلْ
Say
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
For Allah
l-mashriqu
الْمَشْرِقُ
(is) the east
wal-maghribu
وَالْمَغْرِبُ
and the west
yahdī
يَهْدِي
He guides
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
ilā
إِلَى
to
ṣirāṭin
صِرَاطٍ
a path
mus'taqīmin
مُسْتَقِيمٍ
straight

142

142.

The foolish among the people will say, "What has turned them away from their qiblah, which they used to face?" Say, "To Allah belongs the east and the west. He guides whom He wills to a straight path."

142

wakadhālika
وَكَذَلِكَ
And thus
jaʿalnākum
جَعَلْنَاكُمْ
We made you
ummatan
أُمَّةً
a community
wasaṭan
وَسَطًا
(of the) middle way
litakūnū
لِتَكُونُوا
so that you will be
shuhadāa
شُهَدَاءَ
witnesses
ʿalā
عَلَى
over
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the mankind
wayakūna
وَيَكُونَ
and will be
l-rasūlu
الرَّسُولُ
the Messenger
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
on you
shahīdan
شَهِيدًا
a witness
wamā
وَمَا
And not
jaʿalnā
جَعَلْنَا
We made
l-qib'lata
الْقِبْلَةَ
the direction of prayer
allatī
الَّتِي
which
kunta
كُنْتَ
you were used to
ʿalayhā
عَلَيْهَا
[on it]
illā
إِلَّا
except
linaʿlama
لِنَعْلَمَ
that We make evident
man
مَنْ
(he) who
yattabiʿu
يَتَّبِعُ
follows
l-rasūla
الرَّسُولَ
the Messenger
mimman
مِمَّنْ
from (he) who
yanqalibu
يَنْقَلِبُ
turns back
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
ʿaqibayhi
عَقِبَيْهِ
his heels
wa-in
وَإِنْ
And indeed
kānat
كَانَتْ
it was
lakabīratan
لَكَبِيرَةً
certainly a great (test)
illā
إِلَّا
except
ʿalā
عَلَى
for
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those whom
hadā
هَدَى
guided
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(by) Allah
wamā
وَمَا
And not
kāna
كَانَ
will
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
liyuḍīʿa
لِيُضِيعَ
let go waste
īmānakum
إِيمَانَكُمْ
your faith
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bil-nāsi
بِالنَّاسِ
(is) to [the] mankind
laraūfun
لَرَءُوفٌ
Full of Kindness
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
Most Merciful

143

143.

And thus we have made you a just community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who would follow the Messenger from who would turn back on his heels. And indeed, it is difficult except for those whom Allah has guided. And never would Allah have caused you to lose your faith. Indeed Allah is, to the people, Kind and Merciful.

143

qad
قَدْ
Indeed
narā
نَرَى
We see
taqalluba
تَقَلُّبَ
(the) turning
wajhika
وَجْهِكَ
(of) your face
fī
فِي
towards
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the heaven
falanuwalliyannaka
فَلَنُوَلِّيَنَّكَ
So We will surely turn you
qib'latan
قِبْلَةً
(to the) direction of prayer
tarḍāhā
تَرْضَاهَا
you will be pleased with
fawalli
فَوَلِّ
So turn
wajhaka
وَجْهَكَ
your face
shaṭra
شَطْرَ
towards the direction
l-masjidi
الْمَسْجِدِ
(of) Al-Masjid
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
Al-Haraam
waḥaythu
وَحَيْثُ
and wherever
mā
مَا
that
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
fawallū
فَوَلُّوا
[so] turn
wujūhakum
وُجُوهَكُمْ
your faces
shaṭrahu
شَطْرَهُ
(in) its direction
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
And indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ūtū
أُوتُوا
were given
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
layaʿlamūna
لَيَعْلَمُونَ
surely know
annahu
أَنَّهُ
that it
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
(is) the truth
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
wamā
وَمَا
And not
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(is) Allah
bighāfilin
بِغَافِلٍ
unaware
ʿammā
عَمَّا
of what
yaʿmalūna
يَعْمَلُونَ
they do

144

144.

We have certainly seen the turning of your face, [O Muhammad], toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [in prayer]. Indeed, those who have been given the Scripture well know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what they do.

144

wala-in
وَلَئِنْ
And even if
atayta
أَتَيْتَ
you come
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(to) those who
ūtū
أُوتُوا
were given
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
bikulli
بِكُلِّ
with all
āyatin
ءَايَةٍ
(the) signs
mā
مَا
not
tabiʿū
تَبِعُوا
they would follow
qib'lataka
قِبْلَتَكَ
your direction of prayer
wamā
وَمَا
and not
anta
أَنْتَ
(will) you (be)
bitābiʿin
بِتَابِعٍ
a follower
qib'latahum
قِبْلَتَهُمْ
(of) their direction of prayer
wamā
وَمَا
And not
baʿḍuhum
بَعْضُهُمْ
some of them
bitābiʿin
بِتَابِعٍ
(are) followers
qib'lata
قِبْلَةَ
(of the) direction of prayer
baʿḍin
بَعْضٍ
(of each) other
wala-ini
وَلَئِنِ
And if
ittabaʿta
اتَّبَعْتَ
you followed
ahwāahum
أَهْوَاءَهُمْ
their desires
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
jāaka
جَاءَكَ
came to you
mina
مِنَ
of
l-ʿil'mi
الْعِلْمِ
the knowledge
innaka
إِنَّكَ
indeed, you
idhan
إِذًا
(would) then
lamina
لَمِنَ
(be) surely among
l-ẓālimīna
الظَّالِمِينَ
the wrongdoers

145

145.

And if you brought to those who were given the Scripture every sign, they would not follow your qiblah. Nor will you be a follower of their qiblah. Nor would they be followers of one another's qiblah. So if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, indeed, you would then be among the wrongdoers.

145

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(To) those whom
ātaynāhumu
ءَاتَيْنَاهُمُ
We gave [them]
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
yaʿrifūnahu
يَعْرِفُونَهُ
they recognize it
kamā
كَمَا
like
yaʿrifūna
يَعْرِفُونَ
they recognize
abnāahum
أَبْنَاءَهُمْ
their sons
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
And indeed
farīqan
فَرِيقًا
a group
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
of them
layaktumūna
لَيَكْتُمُونَ
surely they conceal
l-ḥaqa
الْحَقَّ
the Truth
wahum
وَهُمْ
while they
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
know

146

146.

Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know [it].

146

al-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
The Truth
min
مِنْ
(is) from
rabbika
رَبِّكَ
your Lord
falā
فَلَا
so (do) not
takūnanna
تَكُونَنَّ
be
mina
مِنَ
among
l-mum'tarīna
الْمُمْتَرِينَ
the doubters

147

147.

The truth is from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.

147

walikullin
وَلِكُلٍّ
And for everyone
wij'hatun
وِجْهَةٌ
(is) a direction
huwa
هُوَ
he
muwallīhā
مُوَلِّيهَا
turns towards it
fa-is'tabiqū
فَاسْتَبِقُوا
so race
l-khayrāti
الْخَيْرَاتِ
(to) the good
ayna
أَيْنَ
Wherever
mā
مَا
that
takūnū
تَكُونُوا
you will be
yati
يَأْتِ
will bring
bikumu
بِكُمُ
you
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(by) Allah
jamīʿan
جَمِيعًا
together
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
(is) on
kulli
كُلِّ
every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
qadīrun
قَدِيرٌ
All-Powerful

148

148.

For each [religious following] is a direction toward which it faces. So race to [all that is] good. Wherever you may be, Allah will bring you forth [for judgement] all together. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

148

wamin
وَمِنْ
And from
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
wherever

فَوَلِّ

wajhaka

your face

(in the) direction
l-masjidi

(of) Al-Masjid
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
Al-Haraam
wa-innahu

lalḥaqqu
لَلْحَقُّ
(is) surely the truth
min

from
rabbika

your Lord
wamā

bighāfilin

of what

you do

149

149.

So from wherever you go out [for prayer, O Muhammad] turn your face toward al- Masjid al-Haram, and indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

149

wamin
وَمِنْ
And from
ḥaythu

wherever

mā

that

your faces

شَطْرَهُ

li-allā
لِئَلَّا
so that not
yakūna

will be

لِلنَّاسِ
for the people
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
against you
ḥujjatun
حُجَّةٌ
any argument
illā

except
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ẓalamū
ظَلَمُوا

min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
among them
falā
فَلَا
so (do) not
takhshawhum
تَخْشَوْهُمْ
fear them
wa-ikh'shawnī
وَاخْشَوْنِي
but fear Me
wali-utimma
وَلِأُتِمَّ
And that I complete
niʿ'matī
نِعْمَتِي
My favor
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
walaʿallakum
وَلَعَلَّكُمْ
[and] so that you may
tahtadūna
تَهْتَدُونَ
(be) guided

150

150.

And from wherever you go out [for prayer], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] may be, turn your faces toward it in order that the people will not have any argument against you, except for those of them who commit wrong; so fear them not but fear Me. And [it is] so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.

150

kamā
كَمَا
As
arsalnā
أَرْسَلْنَا
We sent
fīkum
فِيكُمْ
among you
rasūlan
رَسُولًا
a Messenger
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
from you
yatlū
يَتْلُوا
(who) recites
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
to you
āyātinā
ءَايَاتِنَا
Our verses
wayuzakkīkum
وَيُزَكِّيكُمْ
and purifies you
wayuʿallimukumu
وَيُعَلِّمُكُمُ
and teaches you
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
wal-ḥik'mata
وَالْحِكْمَةَ
and the wisdom
wayuʿallimukum
وَيُعَلِّمُكُمْ
and teaches you
mā
مَا
what
lam
لَمْ
not
takūnū
تَكُونُوا
you were
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
knowing

151

151.

Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know.

151

fa-udh'kurūnī
فَاذْكُرُونِي
So remember Me
adhkur'kum
أَذْكُرْكُمْ
I will remember you
wa-ush'kurū
وَاشْكُرُوا
and be grateful
lī
لِي
to Me
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
takfurūni
تَكْفُرُونِ
(be) ungrateful to Me

152

152.

So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.

152

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
is'taʿīnū
اسْتَعِينُوا
Seek help
bil-ṣabri
بِالصَّبْرِ
through patience
wal-ṣalati
وَالصَّلَوةِ
and the prayer
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
maʿa
مَعَ
(is) with
l-ṣābirīna
الصَّابِرِينَ
the patient ones

153

153.

O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.

153

walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
taqūlū
تَقُولُوا
say
liman
لِمَنْ
for (the ones) who
yuq'talu
يُقْتَلُ
are slain
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
amwātun
أَمْوَاتٌ
(They are) dead
bal
بَلْ
Nay
aḥyāon
أَحْيَاءٌ
(they are) alive
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
lā
لَا
you (do) not
tashʿurūna
تَشْعُرُونَ
perceive

154

154.

And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, "They are dead." Rather, they are alive, but you perceive [it] not.

154

walanabluwannakum
وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ
And surely We will test you
bishayin
بِشَيْءٍ
with something
mina
مِنَ
of
l-khawfi
الْخَوْفِ
[the] fear
wal-jūʿi
وَالْجُوعِ
and [the] hunger
wanaqṣin
وَنَقْصٍ
and loss
mina
مِنَ
of
l-amwāli
الْأَمْوَالِ
[the] wealth
wal-anfusi
وَالْأَنْفُسِ
and [the] lives
wal-thamarāti
وَالثَّمَرَاتِ
and [the] fruits
wabashiri
وَبَشِّرِ
but give good news
l-ṣābirīna
الصَّابِرِينَ
(to) the patient ones

155

155.

And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient,

155

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
idhā
إِذَا
when
aṣābathum
أَصَابَتْهُمْ
strikes them
muṣībatun
مُصِيبَةٌ
a misfortune
qālū
قَالُوا
they say
innā
إِنَّا
Indeed, we
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
belong to Allah
wa-innā
وَإِنَّا
and indeed we
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
towards Him
rājiʿūna
رَاجِعُونَ
will return

156

156.

Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return."

156

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
ṣalawātun
صَلَوَاتٌ
(are) blessings
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
waraḥmatun
وَرَحْمَةٌ
and Mercy
wa-ulāika
وَأُولَئِكَ
And those
humu
هُمُ
[they]
l-muh'tadūna
الْمُهْتَدُونَ
(are) the guided ones

157

157.

Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided.

157

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-ṣafā
الصَّفَا
the Safa
wal-marwata
وَالْمَرْوَةَ
and the Marwah
min
مِنْ
(are) from
shaʿāiri
شَعَائِرِ
(the) symbols
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
faman
فَمَنْ
So whoever
ḥajja
حَجَّ
performs Hajj
l-bayta
الْبَيْتَ
(of) the House
awi
أَوِ
or
iʿ'tamara
اعْتَمَرَ
performs Umrah
falā
فَلَا
so no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on him
an
أَنْ
that
yaṭṭawwafa
يَطَّوَّفَ
he walks
bihimā
بِهِمَا
between [both of] them
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
taṭawwaʿa
تَطَوَّعَ
voluntarily does
khayran
خَيْرًا
good
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
shākirun
شَاكِرٌ
(is) All-Appreciative
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

158

158.

Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is appreciative and Knowing.

158

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
yaktumūna
يَكْتُمُونَ
conceal
mā
مَا
what
anzalnā
أَنْزَلْنَا
We revealed
mina
مِنَ
of
l-bayināti
الْبَيِّنَاتِ
the clear proofs
wal-hudā
وَالْهُدَى
and the Guidance
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
bayyannāhu
بَيَّنَّاهُ
We made clear
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
to the people
fī
فِي
in
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
the Book
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
those
yalʿanuhumu
يَلْعَنُهُمُ
curses them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
wayalʿanuhumu
وَيَلْعَنُهُمُ
and curse them
l-lāʿinūna
اللَّاعِنُونَ
the ones who curse

159

159.

Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse,

159

illā
إِلَّا
Except
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those
tābū
تَابُوا
who repent[ed]
wa-aṣlaḥū
وَأَصْلَحُوا
and reform[ed]
wabayyanū
وَبَيَّنُوا
and openly declar[ed]
fa-ulāika
فَأُولَئِكَ
Then those
atūbu
أَتُوبُ
I will accept repentance
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
from them
wa-anā
وَأَنَا
and I (am)
l-tawābu
التَّوَّابُ
the Acceptor of Repentance
l-raḥīmu
الرَّحِيمُ
the Most Merciful

160

160.

Except for those who repent and correct themselves and make evident [what they concealed]. Those - I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.

160

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieve[d]
wamātū
وَمَاتُوا
and die[d]
wahum
وَهُمْ
while they
kuffārun
كُفَّارٌ
(were) disbelievers
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
those
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
laʿnatu
لَعْنَةُ
(is the) curse
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wal-malāikati
وَالْمَلَائِكَةِ
and the Angels
wal-nāsi
وَالنَّاسِ
and the mankind
ajmaʿīna
أَجْمَعِينَ
all together

161

161.

Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - upon them will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and the people, all together,

161

khālidīna
خَالِدِينَ
(Will) abide forever
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
lā
لَا
Not
yukhaffafu
يُخَفَّفُ
will be lightened
ʿanhumu
عَنْهُمُ
for them
l-ʿadhābu
الْعَذَابُ
the punishment
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yunẓarūna
يُنْظَرُونَ
will be reprieved

162

162.

Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

162

wa-ilāhukum
وَإِلَهُكُمْ
And your God
ilāhun
إِلَهٌ
(is) God
wāḥidun
وَاحِدٌ
one (only)
lā
لَا
(there is) no
ilāha
إِلَهَ
god
illā
إِلَّا
except
huwa
هُوَ
Him
l-raḥmānu
الرَّحْمَنُ
the Most Gracious
l-raḥīmu
الرَّحِيمُ
the Most Merciful

163

163.

And your god is one God. There is no deity [worthy of worship] except Him, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

163

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
fī
فِي
in
khalqi
خَلْقِ
(the) creation
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
(of) the heavens
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth
wa-ikh'tilāfi
وَاخْتِلَافِ
and alternation
al-layli
اللَّيْلِ
of the night
wal-nahāri
وَالنَّهَارِ
and the day
wal-ful'ki
وَالْفُلْكِ
and the ships
allatī
الَّتِي
which
tajrī
تَجْرِي
sail
fī
فِي
in
l-baḥri
الْبَحْرِ
the sea
bimā
بِمَا
with what
yanfaʿu
يَنْفَعُ
benefits
l-nāsa
النَّاسَ
[the] people
wamā
وَمَا
and what
anzala
أَنْزَلَ
(has) sent down
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
mina
مِنَ
from
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the sky
min
مِنْ
[of]
māin
مَاءٍ
water
fa-aḥyā
فَأَحْيَا
giving life
bihi
بِهِ
thereby
l-arḍa
الْأَرْضَ
(to) the earth
baʿda
بَعْدَ
after
mawtihā
مَوْتِهَا
its death
wabatha
وَبَثَّ
and dispersing
fīhā
فِيهَا
therein
min
مِنْ
[of]
kulli
كُلِّ
every
dābbatin
دَابَّةٍ
moving creature
wataṣrīfi
وَتَصْرِيفِ
and directing
l-riyāḥi
الرِّيَاحِ
(of) the winds
wal-saḥābi
وَالسَّحَابِ
and the clouds
l-musakhari
الْمُسَخَّرِ
[the] controlled
bayna
بَيْنَ
between
l-samāi
السَّمَاءِ
the sky
wal-arḍi
وَالْأَرْضِ
and the earth
laāyātin
لَءَايَاتٍ
surely (are) Signs
liqawmin
لِقَوْمٍ
for a people
yaʿqilūna
يَعْقِلُونَ
who use their intellect

164

164.

Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, and the [great] ships which sail through the sea with that which benefits people, and what Allah has sent down from the heavens of rain, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and dispersing therein every [kind of] moving creature, and [His] directing of the winds and the clouds controlled between the heaven and the earth are signs for a people who use reason.

164

wamina
وَمِنَ
And among
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the mankind
man
مَنْ
who
yattakhidhu
يَتَّخِذُ
takes
min
مِنْ
from
dūni
دُونِ
besides
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
andādan
أَنْدَادًا
equals
yuḥibbūnahum
يُحِبُّونَهُمْ
They love them
kaḥubbi
كَحُبِّ
as (they should) love
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
ashaddu
أَشَدُّ
(are) stronger
ḥubban
حُبًّا
(in) love
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
for Allah
walaw
وَلَوْ
And if
yarā
يَرَى
would see
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ẓalamū
ظَلَمُوا
wronged
idh
إِذْ
when
yarawna
يَرَوْنَ
they will see
l-ʿadhāba
الْعَذَابَ
the punishment
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-quwata
الْقُوَّةَ
the power
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
(belongs) to Allah
jamīʿan
جَمِيعًا
all
wa-anna
وَأَنَّ
and [that]
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
shadīdu
شَدِيدُ
(is) severe
l-ʿadhābi
الْعَذَابِ
(in) [the] punishment

165

165.

And [yet], among the people are those who take other than Allah as equals [to Him]. They love them as they [should] love Allah. But those who believe are stronger in love for Allah. And if only they who have wronged would consider [that] when they see the punishment, [they will be certain] that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is severe in punishment.

165

idh
إِذْ
When
tabarra-a
تَبَرَّأَ
will disown
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ittubiʿū
اتُّبِعُوا
were followed
mina
مِنَ
[from]
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ittabaʿū
اتَّبَعُوا
followed
wara-awū
وَرَأَوُا
and they will see
l-ʿadhāba
الْعَذَابَ
the punishment
wataqaṭṭaʿat
وَتَقَطَّعَتْ
[and] will be cut off
bihimu
بِهِمُ
for them
l-asbābu
الْأَسْبَابُ
the relations

166

166.

[And they should consider that] when those who have been followed disassociate themselves from those who followed [them], and they [all] see the punishment, and cut off from them are the ties [of relationship],

166

waqāla
وَقَالَ
And said
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ittabaʿū
اتَّبَعُوا
followed
law
لَوْ
(Only) if
anna
أَنَّ
[that]
lanā
لَنَا
for us
karratan
كَرَّةً
a return
fanatabarra-a
فَنَتَبَرَّأَ
then we will disown
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
[from] them
kamā
كَمَا
as
tabarraū
تَبَرَّءُوا
they disown
minnā
مِنَّا
[from] us
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Thus
yurīhimu
يُرِيهِمُ
will show them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
aʿmālahum
أَعْمَالَهُمْ
their deeds
ḥasarātin
حَسَرَاتٍ
(as) regrets
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
for them
wamā
وَمَا
And not
hum
هُمْ
they
bikhārijīna
بِخَارِجِينَ
will come out
mina
مِنَ
from
l-nāri
النَّارِ
the Fire

167

167.

Those who followed will say, "If only we had another turn [at worldly life] so we could disassociate ourselves from them as they have disassociated themselves from us." Thus will Allah show them their deeds as regrets upon them. And they are never to emerge from the Fire.

167

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
mankind
kulū
كُلُوا
Eat
mimmā
مِمَّا
of what
fī
فِي
(is) in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
ḥalālan
حَلَالًا
lawful
ṭayyiban
طَيِّبًا
(and) good
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tattabiʿū
تَتَّبِعُوا
follow
khuṭuwāti
خُطُوَاتِ
(the) footsteps (of)
l-shayṭāni
الشَّيْطَانِ
the Shaitaan
innahu
إِنَّهُ
Indeed, he
lakum
لَكُمْ
(is) to you
ʿaduwwun
عَدُوٌّ
an enemy
mubīnun
مُبِينٌ
clear

168

168.

O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth [that is] lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

168

innamā
إِنَّمَا
Only
yamurukum
يَأْمُرُكُمْ
he commands you
bil-sūi
بِالسُّوءِ
to (do) the evil
wal-faḥshāi
وَالْفَحْشَاءِ
and the shameful
wa-an
وَأَنْ
and that
taqūlū
تَقُولُوا
you say
ʿalā
عَلَى
about
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
mā
مَا
what
lā
لَا
not
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
you know

169

169.

He only orders you to evil and immorality and to say about Allah what you do not know.

169

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qīla
قِيلَ
it is said
lahumu
لَهُمُ
to them
ittabiʿū
اتَّبِعُوا
Follow
mā
مَا
what
anzala
أَنْزَلَ
has revealed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
qālū
قَالُوا
they said
bal
بَلْ
Nay
nattabiʿu
نَتَّبِعُ
we follow
mā
مَا
what
alfaynā
أَلْفَيْنَا
we found
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
[on it]
ābāanā
ءَابَاءَنَا
our forefathers (following)
awalaw
أَوَلَوْ
Even though
kāna
كَانَ
[were]
ābāuhum
ءَابَاؤُهُمْ
their forefathers
lā
لَا
(did) not
yaʿqilūna
يَعْقِلُونَ
understand
shayan
شَيْئًا
anything
walā
وَلَا
and not
yahtadūna
يَهْتَدُونَ
were they guided

170

170.

And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that which we found our fathers doing." Even though their fathers understood nothing, nor were they guided?

170

wamathalu
وَمَثَلُ
And (the) example
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(of) those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieve[d]
kamathali
كَمَثَلِ
(is) like (the) example
alladhī
الَّذِي
(of) the one who
yanʿiqu
يَنْعِقُ
shouts
bimā
بِمَا
at what
lā
لَا
not
yasmaʿu
يَسْمَعُ
(does) hear
illā
إِلَّا
except
duʿāan
دُعَاءً
calls
wanidāan
وَنِدَاءً
and cries
ṣummun
صُمٌّ
deaf
buk'mun
بُكْمٌ
dumb
ʿum'yun
عُمْيٌ
(and) blind
fahum
فَهُمْ
[so] they
lā
لَا
(do) not
yaʿqilūna
يَعْقِلُونَ
understand

171

171.

The example of those who disbelieve is like that of one who shouts at what hears nothing but calls and cries cattle or sheep - deaf, dumb and blind, so they do not understand.

171

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
kulū
كُلُوا
Eat
min
مِنْ
from
ṭayyibāti
طَيِّبَاتِ
(the) good
mā
مَا
what
razaqnākum
رَزَقْنَاكُمْ
We have provided you
wa-ush'kurū
وَاشْكُرُوا
and be grateful
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
to Allah
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you
iyyāhu
إِيَّاهُ
alone
taʿbudūna
تَعْبُدُونَ
worship Him

172

172.

O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

172

innamā
إِنَّمَا
Only
ḥarrama
حَرَّمَ
He has forbidden
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
to you
l-maytata
الْمَيْتَةَ
the dead animals
wal-dama
وَالدَّمَ
and [the] blood
walaḥma
وَلَحْمَ
and flesh
l-khinzīri
الْخِنْزِيرِ
(of) swine
wamā
وَمَا
and what
uhilla
أُهِلَّ
has been dedicated
bihi
بِهِ
[with it]
lighayri
لِغَيْرِ
to other than
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
famani
فَمَنِ
So whoever
uḍ'ṭurra
اضْطُرَّ
(is) forced by necessity
ghayra
غَيْرَ
without
bāghin
بَاغٍ
(being) disobedient
walā
وَلَا
and not
ʿādin
عَادٍ
transgressor
falā
فَلَا
then no
ith'ma
إِثْمَ
sin
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on him
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
Most Merciful

173

173.

He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

173

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
yaktumūna
يَكْتُمُونَ
conceal
mā
مَا
what
anzala
أَنْزَلَ
(has) revealed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah (has)
mina
مِنَ
of
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
the Book
wayashtarūna
وَيَشْتَرُونَ
and they purchase
bihi
بِهِ
there with
thamanan
ثَمَنًا
a gain
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
little
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
mā
مَا
not
yakulūna
يَأْكُلُونَ
they eat
fī
فِي
in
buṭūnihim
بُطُونِهِمْ
their bellies
illā
إِلَّا
except
l-nāra
النَّارَ
the Fire
walā
وَلَا
And not
yukallimuhumu
يُكَلِّمُهُمُ
will speak to them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
yawma
يَوْمَ
(on the) Day
l-qiyāmati
الْقِيَامَةِ
(of) [the] Judgment
walā
وَلَا
and not
yuzakkīhim
يُزَكِّيهِمْ
will He purify them
walahum
وَلَهُمْ
and for them
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
alīmun
أَلِيمٌ
painful

174

174.

Indeed, they who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those consume not into their bellies except the Fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment.

174

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(are) they who
ish'tarawū
اشْتَرَوُا
purchase[d]
l-ḍalālata
الضَّلَالَةَ
[the] astraying
bil-hudā
بِالْهُدَى
for [the] Guidance
wal-ʿadhāba
وَالْعَذَابَ
and [the] punishment
bil-maghfirati
بِالْمَغْفِرَةِ
for [the] forgiveness
famā
فَمَا
So what (is)
aṣbarahum
أَصْبَرَهُمْ
their endurance
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
l-nāri
النَّارِ
the Fire!

175

175.

Those are the ones who have exchanged guidance for error and forgiveness for punishment. How patient they are in pursuit of the Fire!

175

dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
bi-anna
بِأَنَّ
(is) because
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
nazzala
نَزَّلَ
revealed
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
bil-ḥaqi
بِالْحَقِّ
with [the] Truth
wa-inna
وَإِنَّ
And indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those
ikh'talafū
اخْتَلَفُوا
who differed
fī
فِي
in
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
the Book
lafī
لَفِي
(are) surely in
shiqāqin
شِقَاقٍ
schism
baʿīdin
بَعِيدٍ
far

176

176.

That is [deserved by them] because Allah has sent down the Book in truth. And indeed, those who differ over the Book are in extreme dissension.

176

laysa
لَيْسَ
It is not
l-bira
الْبِرَّ
[the] righteousness
an
أَنْ
that
tuwallū
تُوَلُّوا
you turn
wujūhakum
وُجُوهَكُمْ
your faces
qibala
قِبَلَ
towards
l-mashriqi
الْمَشْرِقِ
the east
wal-maghribi
وَالْمَغْرِبِ
and the west
walākinna
وَلَكِنَّ
[and] but
l-bira
الْبِرَّ
the righteous[ness]
man
مَنْ
(is he) who
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believes
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
wal-malāikati
وَالْمَلَائِكَةِ
and the Angels
wal-kitābi
وَالْكِتَابِ
and the Book
wal-nabiyīna
وَالنَّبِيِّينَ
and the Prophets
waātā
وَءَاتَى
and gives
l-māla
الْمَالَ
the wealth
ʿalā
عَلَى
in
ḥubbihi
حُبِّهِ
spite of his love (for it)
dhawī
ذَوِي
(to) those
l-qur'bā
الْقُرْبَى
(of) the near relatives
wal-yatāmā
وَالْيَتَامَى
and the orphans
wal-masākīna
وَالْمَسَاكِينَ
and the needy
wa-ib'na
وَابْنَ
and (of)
l-sabīli
السَّبِيلِ
the wayfarer
wal-sāilīna
وَالسَّائِلِينَ
and those who ask
wafī
وَفِي
and in
l-riqābi
الرِّقَابِ
freeing the necks (slaves)
wa-aqāma
وَأَقَامَ
and (who) establish
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
waātā
وَءَاتَى
and give
l-zakata
الزَّكَوةَ
the zakah
wal-mūfūna
وَالْمُوفُونَ
and those who fulfill
biʿahdihim
بِعَهْدِهِمْ
their covenant
idhā
إِذَا
when
ʿāhadū
عَاهَدُوا
they make it
wal-ṣābirīna
وَالصَّابِرِينَ
and those who are patient
fī
فِي
in
l-basāi
الْبَأْسَاءِ
[the] suffering
wal-ḍarāi
وَالضَّرَّاءِ
and [the] hardship
waḥīna
وَحِينَ
at (the) time
l-basi
الْبَأْسِ
(of) [the] stress
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(are) the ones who
ṣadaqū
صَدَقُوا
are true
wa-ulāika
وَأُولَئِكَ
and those
humu
هُمُ
[they]
l-mutaqūna
الْمُتَّقُونَ
(are) the righteous

177

177.

Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask [for help], and for freeing slaves; [and who] establishes prayer and gives zakah; [those who] fulfill their promise when they promise; and [those who] are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous.

177

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
kutiba
كُتِبَ
Prescribed
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
for you
l-qiṣāṣu
الْقِصَاصُ
(is) the legal retribution
fī
فِي
in
l-qatlā
الْقَتْلَى
(the matter of) the murdered
l-ḥuru
الْحُرُّ
the freeman
bil-ḥuri
بِالْحُرِّ
for the freeman
wal-ʿabdu
وَالْعَبْدُ
and the slave
bil-ʿabdi
بِالْعَبْدِ
for the slave
wal-unthā
وَالْأُنْثَى
and the female
bil-unthā
بِالْأُنْثَى
for the female
faman
فَمَنْ
But whoever
ʿufiya
عُفِيَ
is pardoned
lahu
لَهُ
[for it]
min
مِنْ
from
akhīhi
أَخِيهِ
his brother
shayon
شَيْءٌ
anything
fa-ittibāʿun
فَاتِّبَاعٌ
then follows up
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
with suitable
wa-adāon
وَأَدَاءٌ
[and] payment
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
to him
bi-iḥ'sānin
بِإِحْسَانٍ
with kindness
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That (is)
takhfīfun
تَخْفِيفٌ
a concession
min
مِنْ
from
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
waraḥmatun
وَرَحْمَةٌ
and mercy
famani
فَمَنِ
Then whoever
iʿ'tadā
اعْتَدَى
transgresses
baʿda
بَعْدَ
after
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
falahu
فَلَهُ
then for him
ʿadhābun
عَذَابٌ
(is) a punishment
alīmun
أَلِيمٌ
painful

178

178.

O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever overlooks from his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment.

178

walakum
وَلَكُمْ
And for you
fī
فِي
in
l-qiṣāṣi
الْقِصَاصِ
the legal retribution
ḥayatun
حَيَوةٌ
(is) life
yāulī
يَاأُولِي
O men
l-albābi
الْأَلْبَابِ
(of) understanding
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
So that you may
tattaqūna
تَتَّقُونَ
(become) righteous

179

179.

And there is for you in legal retribution [saving of] life, O you [people] of understanding, that you may become righteous.

179

kutiba
كُتِبَ
Prescribed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
for you
idhā
إِذَا
when
ḥaḍara
حَضَرَ
approaches
aḥadakumu
أَحَدَكُمُ
any of you
l-mawtu
الْمَوْتُ
[the] death
in
إِنْ
if
taraka
تَرَكَ
he leaves
khayran
خَيْرًا
good
l-waṣiyatu
الْوَصِيَّةُ
(making) the will
lil'wālidayni
لِلْوَالِدَيْنِ
for the parents
wal-aqrabīna
وَالْأَقْرَبِينَ
and the near relatives
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
with due fairness
ḥaqqan
حَقًّا
a duty
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
l-mutaqīna
الْمُتَّقِينَ
the righteous ones

180

180.

Prescribed for you when death approaches [any] one of you if he leaves wealth [is that he should make] a bequest for the parents and near relatives according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.

180

faman
فَمَنْ
Then whoever
baddalahu
بَدَّلَهُ
changes it
baʿdamā
بَعْدَمَا
after what
samiʿahu
سَمِعَهُ
he (has) heard [it]
fa-innamā
فَإِنَّمَا
so only
ith'muhu
إِثْمُهُ
its sin
ʿalā
عَلَى
(would be) on
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
yubaddilūnahu
يُبَدِّلُونَهُ
alter it
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
samīʿun
سَمِيعٌ
(is) All-Hearing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

181

181.

Then whoever alters the bequest after he has heard it - the sin is only upon those who have altered it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

181

faman
فَمَنْ
But whoever
khāfa
خَافَ
fears
min
مِنْ
from
mūṣin
مُوصٍ
(the) testator
janafan
جَنَفًا
(any) error
aw
أَوْ
or
ith'man
إِثْمًا
sin
fa-aṣlaḥa
فَأَصْلَحَ
then reconciles
baynahum
بَيْنَهُمْ
between them
falā
فَلَا
then (there is) no
ith'ma
إِثْمَ
sin
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on him
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
All-Merciful

182

182.

But if one fears from the bequeather [some] error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

182

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
kutiba
كُتِبَ
Is prescribed
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
for you
l-ṣiyāmu
الصِّيَامُ
[the] fasting
kamā
كَمَا
as
kutiba
كُتِبَ
was prescribed
ʿalā
عَلَى
to
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those
min
مِنْ
from
qablikum
قَبْلِكُمْ
before you
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tattaqūna
تَتَّقُونَ
(become) righteous

183

183.

O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous -

183

ayyāman
أَيَّامًا
(Fasting for) days
maʿdūdātin
مَعْدُودَاتٍ
numbered
faman
فَمَنْ
So whoever
kāna
كَانَ
is
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
marīḍan
مَرِيضًا
sick
aw
أَوْ
or
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
safarin
سَفَرٍ
a journey
faʿiddatun
فَعِدَّةٌ
then a prescribed number
min
مِنْ
of
ayyāmin
أَيَّامٍ
days
ukhara
أُخَرَ
other
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
And on
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
yuṭīqūnahu
يُطِيقُونَهُ
can afford it
fid'yatun
فِدْيَةٌ
a ransom
ṭaʿāmu
طَعَامُ
(of) feeding
mis'kīnin
مِسْكِينٍ
a poor
faman
فَمَنْ
And whoever
taṭawwaʿa
تَطَوَّعَ
volunteers
khayran
خَيْرًا
good
fahuwa
فَهُوَ
then it
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) better
lahu
لَهُ
for him
wa-an
وَأَنْ
And to
taṣūmū
تَصُومُوا
fast
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) better
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
know

184

184.

[Fasting for] a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but with hardship] - a ransom [as substitute] of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew.

184

shahru
شَهْرُ
Month
ramaḍāna
رَمَضَانَ
(of) Ramadhaan
alladhī
الَّذِي
(is) that
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
was revealed
fīhi
فِيهِ
therein
l-qur'ānu
الْقُرْءَانُ
the Quran
hudan
هُدًى
a Guidance
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for mankind
wabayyinātin
وَبَيِّنَاتٍ
and clear proofs
mina
مِنَ
of
l-hudā
الْهُدَى
[the] Guidance
wal-fur'qāni
وَالْفُرْقَانِ
and the Criterion
faman
فَمَنْ
So whoever
shahida
شَهِدَ
witnesses
minkumu
مِنْكُمُ
among you
l-shahra
الشَّهْرَ
the month
falyaṣum'hu
فَلْيَصُمْهُ
then he should fast in it
waman
وَمَنْ
and whoever
kāna
كَانَ
is
marīḍan
مَرِيضًا
sick
aw
أَوْ
or
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
safarin
سَفَرٍ
a journey
faʿiddatun
فَعِدَّةٌ
then prescribed number (should be made up)
min
مِنْ
from
ayyāmin
أَيَّامٍ
days
ukhara
أُخَرَ
other
yurīdu
يُرِيدُ
Intends
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bikumu
بِكُمُ
for you
l-yus'ra
الْيُسْرَ
[the] ease
walā
وَلَا
and not
yurīdu
يُرِيدُ
intends
bikumu
بِكُمُ
for you
l-ʿus'ra
الْعُسْرَ
[the] hardship
walituk'milū
وَلِتُكْمِلُوا
so that you complete
l-ʿidata
الْعِدَّةَ
the prescribed period
walitukabbirū
وَلِتُكَبِّرُوا
and that you magnify
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
for
mā
مَا
[what]
hadākum
هَدَاكُمْ
He guided you
walaʿallakum
وَلَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tashkurūna
تَشْكُرُونَ
(be) grateful

185

185.

The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.

185

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
sa-alaka
سَأَلَكَ
ask you
ʿibādī
عِبَادِي
My servants
ʿannī
عَنِّي
about Me
fa-innī
فَإِنِّي
then indeed I am
qarībun
قَرِيبٌ
near
ujību
أُجِيبُ
I respond
daʿwata
دَعْوَةَ
(to the) invocation
l-dāʿi
الدَّاعِ
(of) the supplicant
idhā
إِذَا
when
daʿāni
دَعَانِ
he calls Me
falyastajībū
فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا
So let them respond
lī
لِي
to Me
walyu'minū
وَلْيُؤْمِنُوا
and let them believe
bī
بِي
in Me
laʿallahum
لَعَلَّهُمْ
so that they may
yarshudūna
يَرْشُدُونَ
(be) led aright

186

186.

And when My servants ask you, [O Muhammad], concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.

186

uḥilla
أُحِلَّ
Permitted
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
laylata
لَيْلَةَ
(in the) nights
l-ṣiyāmi
الصِّيَامِ
(of) fasting
l-rafathu
الرَّفَثُ
(is) the approach
ilā
إِلَى
to
nisāikum
نِسَائِكُمْ
your wives
hunna
هُنَّ
They
libāsun
لِبَاسٌ
(are) garments
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you
libāsun
لِبَاسٌ
(are) garments
lahunna
لَهُنَّ
for them
ʿalima
عَلِمَ
Knows
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
annakum
أَنَّكُمْ
that you
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
used to
takhtānūna
تَخْتَانُونَ
deceive
anfusakum
أَنْفُسَكُمْ
yourselves
fatāba
فَتَابَ
so He turned
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
towards you
waʿafā
وَعَفَا
and He forgave
ʿankum
عَنْكُمْ
[on] you
fal-āna
فَالْءَانَ
So now
bāshirūhunna
بَاشِرُوهُنَّ
have relations with them
wa-ib'taghū
وَابْتَغُوا
and seek
mā
مَا
what
kataba
كَتَبَ
has ordained
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
wakulū
وَكُلُوا
And eat
wa-ish'rabū
وَاشْرَبُوا
and drink
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yatabayyana
يَتَبَيَّنَ
becomes distinct
lakumu
لَكُمُ
to you
l-khayṭu
الْخَيْطُ
the thread
l-abyaḍu
الْأَبْيَضُ
[the] white
mina
مِنَ
from
l-khayṭi
الْخَيْطِ
the thread
l-aswadi
الْأَسْوَدِ
[the] black
mina
مِنَ
of
l-fajri
الْفَجْرِ
[the] dawn
thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
atimmū
أَتِمُّوا
complete
l-ṣiyāma
الصِّيَامَ
the fast
ilā
إِلَى
till
al-layli
اللَّيْلِ
the night
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tubāshirūhunna
تُبَاشِرُوهُنَّ
have relations with them
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
ʿākifūna
عَاكِفُونَ
(are) secluded
fī
فِي
in
l-masājidi
الْمَسَاجِدِ
the masajid
til'ka
تِلْكَ
These
ḥudūdu
حُدُودُ
(are the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(set by) Allah
falā
فَلَا
so (do) not
taqrabūhā
تَقْرَبُوهَا
approach them
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Thus
yubayyinu
يُبَيِّنُ
makes clear
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
āyātihi
ءَايَاتِهِ
His verses
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for [the] people
laʿallahum
لَعَلَّهُمْ
so that they may
yattaqūna
يَتَّقُونَ
(become) righteous

187

187.

It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives [for sexual relations]. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits [set by] Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous.

187

walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
takulū
تَأْكُلُوا
eat
amwālakum
أَمْوَالَكُمْ
your properties
baynakum
بَيْنَكُمْ
among yourselves
bil-bāṭili
بِالْبَاطِلِ
wrongfully
watud'lū
وَتُدْلُوا
and present
bihā
بِهَا
[with] it
ilā
إِلَى
to
l-ḥukāmi
الْحُكَّامِ
the authorities
litakulū
لِتَأْكُلُوا
so that you may eat
farīqan
فَرِيقًا
a portion
min
مِنْ
from
amwāli
أَمْوَالِ
(the) wealth
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
(of) the people
bil-ith'mi
بِالْإِثْمِ
sinfully
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
know

188

188.

And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].

188

yasalūnaka
يَسْءَلُونَكَ
They ask you
ʿani
عَنِ
about
l-ahilati
الْأَهِلَّةِ
the new moons
qul
قُلْ
Say
hiya
هِيَ
They
mawāqītu
مَوَاقِيتُ
(are) indicators of periods
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for the people
wal-ḥaji
وَالْحَجِّ
and (for) the Hajj
walaysa
وَلَيْسَ
And it is not
l-biru
الْبِرُّ
[the] righteousness
bi-an
بِأَنْ
that
tatū
تَأْتُوا
you come
l-buyūta
الْبُيُوتَ
(to) the houses
min
مِنْ
from
ẓuhūrihā
ظُهُورِهَا
their backs
walākinna
وَلَكِنَّ
[and] but
l-bira
الْبِرَّ
[the] righteous
mani
مَنِ
(is one) who
ittaqā
اتَّقَى
fears (Allah)
watū
وَأْتُوا
And come
l-buyūta
الْبُيُوتَ
(to) the houses
min
مِنْ
from
abwābihā
أَبْوَابِهَا
their doors
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tuf'liḥūna
تُفْلِحُونَ
(be) successful

189

189.

They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.

189

waqātilū
وَقَاتِلُوا
And fight
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
yuqātilūnakum
يُقَاتِلُونَكُمْ
fight you
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
taʿtadū
تَعْتَدُوا
transgress
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
lā
لَا
(does) not
yuḥibbu
يُحِبُّ
like
l-muʿ'tadīna
الْمُعْتَدِينَ
the transgressors

190

190.

Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors.

190

wa-uq'tulūhum
وَاقْتُلُوهُمْ
And kill them
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
wherever
thaqif'tumūhum
ثَقِفْتُمُوهُمْ
you find them
wa-akhrijūhum
وَأَخْرِجُوهُمْ
and drive them out
min
مِنْ
from
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
wherever
akhrajūkum
أَخْرَجُوكُمْ
they drove you out
wal-fit'natu
وَالْفِتْنَةُ
and [the] oppression
ashaddu
أَشَدُّ
(is) worse
mina
مِنَ
than
l-qatli
الْقَتْلِ
[the] killing
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tuqātilūhum
تُقَاتِلُوهُمْ
fight them
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
near
l-masjidi
الْمَسْجِدِ
Al-Masjid
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
Al-Haraam
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yuqātilūkum
يُقَاتِلُوكُمْ
they fight you
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
qātalūkum
قَاتَلُوكُمْ
they fight you
fa-uq'tulūhum
فَاقْتُلُوهُمْ
then kill them
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Such
jazāu
جَزَاءُ
(is the) reward
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
(of) the disbelievers

191

191.

And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.

191

fa-ini
فَإِنِ
Then if
intahaw
انْتَهَوْا
they cease
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
Most Merciful

192

192.

And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

192

waqātilūhum
وَقَاتِلُوهُمْ
And fight (against) them
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
lā
لَا
not
takūna
تَكُونَ
(there) is
fit'natun
فِتْنَةٌ
oppression
wayakūna
وَيَكُونَ
and becomes
l-dīnu
الدِّينُ
the religion
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
for Allah
fa-ini
فَإِنِ
Then if
intahaw
انْتَهَوْا
they cease
falā
فَلَا
then (let there be) no
ʿud'wāna
عُدْوَانَ
hostility
illā
إِلَّا
except
ʿalā
عَلَى
against
l-ẓālimīna
الظَّالِمِينَ
the oppressors

193

193.

Fight them until there is no [more] fitnah and [until] worship is [acknowledged to be] for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.

193

al-shahru
الشَّهْرُ
The month
l-ḥarāmu
الْحَرَامُ
[the] sacred
bil-shahri
بِالشَّهْرِ
(is) for the month
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
[the] sacred
wal-ḥurumātu
وَالْحُرُمَاتُ
and for all the violations
qiṣāṣun
قِصَاصٌ
(is) legal retribution
famani
فَمَنِ
Then whoever
iʿ'tadā
اعْتَدَى
transgressed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
fa-iʿ'tadū
فَاعْتَدُوا
then you transgress
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on him
bimith'li
بِمِثْلِ
in (the) same manner
mā
مَا
(as)
iʿ'tadā
اعْتَدَى
he transgressed
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
maʿa
مَعَ
(is) with
l-mutaqīna
الْمُتَّقِينَ
those who fear (Him)

194

194.

[Fighting in] the sacred month is for [aggression committed in] the sacred month, and for [all] violations is legal retribution. So whoever has assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he has assaulted you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is with those who fear Him.

194

wa-anfiqū
وَأَنْفِقُوا
And spend
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
tul'qū
تُلْقُوا
throw (yourselves)
bi-aydīkum
بِأَيْدِيكُمْ
[with your hands]
ilā
إِلَى
into
l-tahlukati
التَّهْلُكَةِ
[the] destruction
wa-aḥsinū
وَأَحْسِنُوا
And do good
inna
إِنَّ
indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yuḥibbu
يُحِبُّ
loves
l-muḥ'sinīna
الْمُحْسِنِينَ
the good-doers

195

195.

And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction [by refraining]. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.

195

wa-atimmū
وَأَتِمُّوا
And complete
l-ḥaja
الْحَجَّ
the Hajj
wal-ʿum'rata
وَالْعُمْرَةَ
and the Umrah
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
for Allah
fa-in
فَإِنْ
And if
uḥ'ṣir'tum
أُحْصِرْتُمْ
you are held back
famā
فَمَا
then (offer) whatever
is'taysara
اسْتَيْسَرَ
(can be) obtained with ease
mina
مِنَ
of
l-hadyi
الْهَدْيِ
the sacrificial animal
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
taḥliqū
تَحْلِقُوا
shave
ruūsakum
رُءُوسَكُمْ
your heads
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yablugha
يَبْلُغَ
reaches
l-hadyu
الْهَدْيُ
the sacrificial animal
maḥillahu
مَحِلَّهُ
(to) its destination
faman
فَمَنْ
Then whoever
kāna
كَانَ
is
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
marīḍan
مَرِيضًا
ill
aw
أَوْ
or
bihi
بِهِ
he (has)
adhan
أَذًى
an ailment
min
مِنْ
of
rasihi
رَأْسِهِ
his head
fafid'yatun
فَفِدْيَةٌ
then a ransom
min
مِنْ
of
ṣiyāmin
صِيَامٍ
fasting
aw
أَوْ
or
ṣadaqatin
صَدَقَةٍ
charity
aw
أَوْ
or
nusukin
نُسُكٍ
sacrifice
fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
Then when
amintum
أَمِنْتُمْ
you are secure
faman
فَمَنْ
then whoever
tamattaʿa
تَمَتَّعَ
took advantage
bil-ʿum'rati
بِالْعُمْرَةِ
of the Umrah
ilā
إِلَى
followed
l-ḥaji
الْحَجِّ
(by) the Hajj
famā
فَمَا
then (offer) whatever
is'taysara
اسْتَيْسَرَ
(can be) obtained with ease
mina
مِنَ
of
l-hadyi
الْهَدْيِ
the sacrificial animal
faman
فَمَنْ
But whoever
lam
لَمْ
(can) not
yajid
يَجِدْ
find
faṣiyāmu
فَصِيَامُ
then a fast
thalāthati
ثَلَاثَةِ
(of) three
ayyāmin
أَيَّامٍ
days
fī
فِي
during
l-ḥaji
الْحَجِّ
the Hajj
wasabʿatin
وَسَبْعَةٍ
and seven (days)
idhā
إِذَا
when
rajaʿtum
رَجَعْتُمْ
you return
til'ka
تِلْكَ
This
ʿasharatun
عَشَرَةٌ
(is) ten (days)
kāmilatun
كَامِلَةٌ
in all
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
liman
لِمَنْ
(is) for (the one) whose
lam
لَمْ
not
yakun
يَكُنْ
is
ahluhu
أَهْلُهُ
his family
ḥāḍirī
حَاضِرِي
present
l-masjidi
الْمَسْجِدِ
(near) Al-Masjid
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
Al-Haraam
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
shadīdu
شَدِيدُ
(is) severe
l-ʿiqābi
الْعِقَابِ
(in) retribution

196

196.

And complete the Hajj and 'umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head [making shaving necessary must offer] a ransom of fasting [three days] or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'umrah [during the Hajj months] followed by Hajj [offers] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find [or afford such an animal] - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned [home]. Those are ten complete [days]. This is for those whose family is not in the area of al-Masjid al-Haram. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty.

196

al-ḥaju
الْحَجُّ
(For) the Hajj
ashhurun
أَشْهُرٌ
(are) months
maʿlūmātun
مَعْلُومَاتٌ
well known
faman
فَمَنْ
then whoever
faraḍa
فَرَضَ
undertakes
fīhinna
فِيهِنَّ
therein
l-ḥaja
الْحَجَّ
the Hajj
falā
فَلَا
then no
rafatha
رَفَثَ
sexual relations
walā
وَلَا
and no
fusūqa
فُسُوقَ
wickedness
walā
وَلَا
and no
jidāla
جِدَالَ
quarrelling
fī
فِي
during
l-ḥaji
الْحَجِّ
the Hajj
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
you do
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
yaʿlamhu
يَعْلَمْهُ
knows it
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
watazawwadū
وَتَزَوَّدُوا
And take provision
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
(but) indeed
khayra
خَيْرَ
(the) best
l-zādi
الزَّادِ
provision
l-taqwā
التَّقْوَى
(is) righteousness
wa-ittaqūni
وَاتَّقُونِ
And fear Me
yāulī
يَاأُولِي
O men
l-albābi
الْأَلْبَابِ
(of) understanding

197

197.

Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.

197

laysa
لَيْسَ
Not is
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
on you
junāḥun
جُنَاحٌ
any sin
an
أَنْ
that
tabtaghū
تَبْتَغُوا
you seek
faḍlan
فَضْلًا
bounty
min
مِنْ
from
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
And when
afaḍtum
أَفَضْتُمْ
you depart
min
مِنْ
from
ʿarafātin
عَرَفَاتٍ
(Mount) Arafat
fa-udh'kurū
فَاذْكُرُوا
then remember
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
near
l-mashʿari
الْمَشْعَرِ
the Monument
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
[the] Sacred
wa-udh'kurūhu
وَاذْكُرُوهُ
And remember Him
kamā
كَمَا
as
hadākum
هَدَاكُمْ
He (has) guided you
wa-in
وَإِنْ
[and] though
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you were
min
مِنْ
[from]
qablihi
قَبْلِهِ
before [it]
lamina
لَمِنَ
surely among
l-ḍālīna
الضَّالِّينَ
those who went astray

198

198.

There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord [during Hajj]. But when you depart from 'Arafat, remember Allah at al- Mash'ar al-Haram. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were before that among those astray.

198

thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
afīḍū
أَفِيضُوا
depart
min
مِنْ
from
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
wherever
afāḍa
أَفَاضَ
depart
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
the people
wa-is'taghfirū
وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا
and ask forgiveness
l-laha
اللَّهَ
(of) Allah
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
All-Merciful

199

199.

Then depart from the place from where [all] the people depart and ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

199

fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
Then when
qaḍaytum
قَضَيْتُمْ
you complete[d]
manāsikakum
مَنَاسِكَكُمْ
your acts of worship
fa-udh'kurū
فَاذْكُرُوا
then remember
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
kadhik'rikum
كَذِكْرِكُمْ
as you remember
ābāakum
ءَابَاءَكُمْ
your forefathers
aw
أَوْ
or
ashadda
أَشَدَّ
(with) greater
dhik'ran
ذِكْرًا
remembrance
famina
فَمِنَ
And from
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the people
man
مَنْ
who
yaqūlu
يَقُولُ
say
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord!
ātinā
ءَاتِنَا
Grant us
fī
فِي
in
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
wamā
وَمَا
And not
lahu
لَهُ
for him
fī
فِي
in
l-ākhirati
الْءَاخِرَةِ
the Hereafter
min
مِنْ
[of]
khalāqin
خَلَاقٍ
any share

200

200.

And when you have completed your rites, remember Allah like your [previous] remembrance of your fathers or with [much] greater remembrance. And among the people is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world," and he will have in the Hereafter no share.

200

wamin'hum
وَمِنْهُمْ
And from those
man
مَنْ
who
yaqūlu
يَقُولُ
say
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord!
ātinā
ءَاتِنَا
Grant us
fī
فِي
in
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
ḥasanatan
حَسَنَةً
good
wafī
وَفِي
and in
l-ākhirati
الْءَاخِرَةِ
the Hereafter
ḥasanatan
حَسَنَةً
good
waqinā
وَقِنَا
and save us
ʿadhāba
عَذَابَ
(from the) punishment
l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire

201

201.

But among them is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire."

201

ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
naṣībun
نَصِيبٌ
(is) a share
mimmā
مِمَّا
of what
kasabū
كَسَبُوا
they earned
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
and Allah
sarīʿu
سَرِيعُ
(is) swift
l-ḥisābi
الْحِسَابِ
(in taking) account

202

202.

Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in account.

202

wa-udh'kurū
وَاذْكُرُوا
And remember
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
fī
فِي
during
ayyāmin
أَيَّامٍ

maʿdūdātin
مَعْدُودَاتٍ
numbered
faman
فَمَنْ
Then (he) who
taʿajjala
تَعَجَّلَ
hurries
fī
فِي
in
yawmayni
يَوْمَيْنِ
two days
falā
فَلَا
then no
ith'ma
إِثْمَ
sin
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
upon him
waman

and whoever

falā
فَلَا
then no
ith'ma
إِثْمَ
sin
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
upon him
limani
لِمَنِ
for (the one) who
ittaqā
اتَّقَى
fears
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
annakum
أَنَّكُمْ
that you
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
unto Him
tuḥ'sharūna
تُحْشَرُونَ
will be gathered

203

203.

And remember Allah during [specific] numbered days. Then whoever hastens [his departure] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays [until the third] - there is no sin upon him - for him who fears Allah. And fear Allah and know that unto Him you will be gathered.

203

wamina
وَمِنَ
And of
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the people
man
مَنْ
(is the one) who
yuʿ'jibuka
يُعْجِبُكَ
pleases you
qawluhu
قَوْلُهُ
(with) his speech
fī
فِي
in
l-ḥayati
الْحَيَوةِ
the life
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
(of) the world
wayush'hidu
وَيُشْهِدُ
and he calls to witness
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
mā
مَا
what
fī
فِي
(is) in
qalbihi
قَلْبِهِ
his heart
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
and he
aladdu
أَلَدُّ
(is) the most quarrelsome
l-khiṣāmi
الْخِصَامِ
(of) opponents

204

204.

And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah to witness as to what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents.

204

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
tawallā
تَوَلَّى
he turns away
saʿā
سَعَى
he strives
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
liyuf'sida
لِيُفْسِدَ
to spread corruption
fīhā
فِيهَا
[in it]
wayuh'lika
وَيُهْلِكَ
and destroys
l-ḥartha
الْحَرْثَ
the crops
wal-nasla
وَالنَّسْلَ
and progeny
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
lā
لَا
(does) not
yuḥibbu
يُحِبُّ
love
l-fasāda
الْفَسَادَ
[the] corruption

205

205.

And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption.

205

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
qīla
قِيلَ
it is said
lahu
لَهُ
to him
ittaqi
اتَّقِ
Fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
akhadhathu
أَخَذَتْهُ
takes him
l-ʿizatu
الْعِزَّةُ
(his) pride
bil-ith'mi
بِالْإِثْمِ
to [the] sins
faḥasbuhu
فَحَسْبُهُ
Then enough for him
jahannamu
جَهَنَّمُ
(is) Hell
walabi'sa
وَلَبِئْسَ
[and] surely an evil
l-mihādu
الْمِهَادُ
[the] resting-place

206

206.

And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and how wretched is the resting place.

206

wamina
وَمِنَ
And of
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
the people
man
مَنْ
(is the one) who
yashrī
يَشْرِي
sells
nafsahu
نَفْسَهُ
his own self
ib'tighāa
ابْتِغَاءَ
seeking
marḍāti
مَرْضَاتِ
pleasure
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
raūfun
رَءُوفٌ
(is) full of Kindness
bil-ʿibādi
بِالْعِبَادِ
to His servants

207

207.

And of the people is he who sells himself, seeking means to the approval of Allah. And Allah is kind to [His] servants.

207

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
ud'khulū
ادْخُلُوا
Enter
fī
فِي
in
l-sil'mi
السِّلْمِ
Islam
kāffatan
كَافَّةً
completely
walā
وَلَا
and (do) not
tattabiʿū
تَتَّبِعُوا
follow
khuṭuwāti
خُطُوَاتِ
footsteps
l-shayṭāni
الشَّيْطَانِ
(of) the Shaitaan
innahu
إِنَّهُ
Indeed he
lakum
لَكُمْ
(is) for you
ʿaduwwun
عَدُوٌّ
an enemy
mubīnun
مُبِينٌ
open

208

208.

O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

208

fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
zalaltum
زَلَلْتُمْ
you slip
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
jāatkumu
جَاءَتْكُمُ
came to you
l-bayinātu
الْبَيِّنَاتُ
(from) the clear proofs
fa-iʿ'lamū
فَاعْلَمُوا
then know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿazīzun
عَزِيزٌ
(is) All-Mighty
ḥakīmun
حَكِيمٌ
All-Wise

209

209.

But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

209

hal
هَلْ
Are

they waiting
illā
إِلَّا
[except]
an

that

comes to them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
fī
فِي
in
ẓulalin

(the) shadows
mina
مِنَ
of
l-ghamāmi
الْغَمَامِ
[the] clouds
wal-malāikatu
وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ
and the Angels
waquḍiya
وَقُضِيَ
and is decreed
l-amru
الْأَمْرُ
the matter
wa-ilā
وَإِلَى
And to
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
tur'jaʿu
تُرْجَعُ
return
l-umūru
الْأُمُورُ
(all) the matters

210

210.

Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds and the angels [as well] and the matter is [then] decided? And to Allah [all] matters are returned.

210

sal
سَلْ
Ask
banī
بَنِي
(the) Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel
kam
كَمْ
how many
ātaynāhum
ءَاتَيْنَاهُمْ
We gave them
min
مِنْ
of
āyatin
ءَايَةٍ
(the) Sign(s)
bayyinatin
بَيِّنَةٍ
clear
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
yubaddil
يُبَدِّلْ
changes
niʿ'mata
نِعْمَةَ
Favor
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
jāathu
جَاءَتْهُ
it (has) come to him
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
shadīdu
شَدِيدُ
(is) severe
l-ʿiqābi
الْعِقَابِ
in [the] chastising

211

211.

Ask the Children of Israel how many a sign of evidence We have given them. And whoever exchanges the favor of Allah [for disbelief] after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

211

zuyyina
زُيِّنَ
Beautified
lilladhīna
لِلَّذِينَ
for those who
kafarū
كَفَرُوا
disbelieve[d]
l-ḥayatu
الْحَيَوةُ
(is) the life
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
(of) the world
wayaskharūna
وَيَسْخَرُونَ
and they ridicule
mina
مِنَ
[of]
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those who
ittaqaw
اتَّقَوْا
fear (Allah)
fawqahum
فَوْقَهُمْ
(they will be) above them
yawma
يَوْمَ
(on the) Day
l-qiyāmati
الْقِيَامَةِ
(of) Resurrection
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yarzuqu
يَرْزُقُ
provides
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
bighayri
بِغَيْرِ
without
ḥisābin
حِسَابٍ
measure

212

212.

Beautified for those who disbelieve is the life of this world, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

212

kāna
كَانَ
Was
l-nāsu
النَّاسُ
mankind
ummatan
أُمَّةً
a community
wāḥidatan
وَاحِدَةً
single
fabaʿatha
فَبَعَثَ
then raised up
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
l-nabiyīna
النَّبِيِّينَ
[the] Prophets
mubashirīna
مُبَشِّرِينَ
(as) bearers of glad tidings
wamundhirīna
وَمُنْذِرِينَ
and (as) warners
wa-anzala
وَأَنْزَلَ
and sent down
maʿahumu
مَعَهُمُ
with them
l-kitāba
الْكِتَابَ
the Book
bil-ḥaqi
بِالْحَقِّ
in [the] truth
liyaḥkuma
لِيَحْكُمَ
to judge
bayna
بَيْنَ
between
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
[the] people

in what
ikh'talafū
اخْتَلَفُوا
they differed
fīhi
فِيهِ
[in it]
wamā
وَمَا
And (did) not
ikh'talafa
اخْتَلَفَ
differ[ed]
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
illā
إِلَّا
except
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
ūtūhu
أُوتُوهُ
were given it
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mā
مَا
[what]
jāathumu
جَاءَتْهُمُ
came to them
l-bayinātu
الْبَيِّنَاتُ
the clear proofs
baghyan
بَغْيًا
(out of) jealousy
baynahum
بَيْنَهُمْ
among themselves
fahadā
فَهَدَى
And guided
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
limā
لِمَا
regarding what
ikh'talafū
اخْتَلَفُوا
they differed
fīhi
فِيهِ
[in it]
mina
مِنَ
of
l-ḥaqi
الْحَقِّ
the Truth
bi-idh'nihi
بِإِذْنِهِ
with His permission
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yahdī
يَهْدِي
guides
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
ilā
إِلَى
to
ṣirāṭin
صِرَاطٍ
a path
mus'taqīmin
مُسْتَقِيمٍ
straight

213

213.

Mankind was [of] one religion [before their deviation]; then Allah sent the prophets as bringers of good tidings and warners and sent down with them the Scripture in truth to judge between the people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over the Scripture except those who were given it - after the clear proofs came to them - out of jealous animosity among themselves. And Allah guided those who believed to the truth concerning that over which they had differed, by His permission. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

213

am
أَمْ
Or
ḥasib'tum
حَسِبْتُمْ
(do) you think
an
أَنْ
that
tadkhulū
تَدْخُلُوا
you will enter
l-janata
الْجَنَّةَ
Paradise
walammā
وَلَمَّا
while not
yatikum
يَأْتِكُمْ
(has) come to you
mathalu
مَثَلُ
like (came to)
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
khalaw
خَلَوْا
passed away
min
مِنْ
from
qablikum
قَبْلِكُمْ
before you
massathumu
مَسَّتْهُمُ
Touched them
l-basāu
الْبَأْسَاءُ
[the] adversity
wal-ḍarāu
وَالضَّرَّاءُ
and [the] hardship
wazul'zilū
وَزُلْزِلُوا
and they were shaken
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yaqūla
يَقُولَ
said
l-rasūlu
الرَّسُولُ
the Messenger
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
and those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believed
maʿahu
مَعَهُ
with him
matā
مَتَى
When
naṣru
نَصْرُ
[will] (the) help
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah (come)
alā
أَلَا
Unquestionably
inna
إِنَّ
[Indeed]
naṣra
نَصْرَ
help
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
qarībun
قَرِيبٌ
(is) near

214

214.

Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trial] has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even their] messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.

214

yasalūnaka
يَسْءَلُونَكَ
They ask you
mādhā
مَاذَا
what
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
they (should) spend
qul
قُلْ
Say
mā
مَا
Whatever
anfaqtum
أَنْفَقْتُمْ
you spend
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
falil'wālidayni
فَلِلْوَالِدَيْنِ
(is) for parents
wal-aqrabīna
وَالْأَقْرَبِينَ
and the relatives
wal-yatāmā
وَالْيَتَامَى
and the orphans
wal-masākīni
وَالْمَسَاكِينِ
and the needy
wa-ib'ni
وَابْنِ
and (of)
l-sabīli
السَّبِيلِ
the wayfarer
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
you do
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
So indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bihi
بِهِ
of it
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Aware

215

215.

They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."

215

kutiba
كُتِبَ
Is prescribed
ʿalaykumu
عَلَيْكُمُ
upon you
l-qitālu
الْقِتَالُ
[the] fighting
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
while it
kur'hun
كُرْهٌ
(is) hateful
lakum
لَكُمْ
to you
waʿasā
وَعَسَى
But perhaps
an
أَنْ
[that]
takrahū
تَكْرَهُوا
you dislike
shayan
شَيْئًا
a thing
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
and it
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) good
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
waʿasā
وَعَسَى
and perhaps
an
أَنْ
[that]
tuḥibbū
تُحِبُّوا
you love
shayan
شَيْئًا
a thing
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
and it
sharrun
شَرٌّ
(is) bad
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yaʿlamu
يَعْلَمُ
knows
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
while you
lā
لَا
(do) not
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
know

216

216.

Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not.

216

yasalūnaka
يَسْءَلُونَكَ
They ask you
ʿani
عَنِ
about
l-shahri
الشَّهْرِ
the month
l-ḥarāmi
الْحَرَامِ
[the] sacred
qitālin

(concerning) fighting
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
qul

qitālun

therein
kabīrun

ini

if
is'taṭāʿū
اسْتَطَاعُوا
they are able
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever

turns away

مِنْكُمْ
among you
ʿan

from

wahuwa
