fī
فِي
in
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
wal-ākhirati
وَالْءَاخِرَةِ
and the Hereafter
wa-ulāika
وَأُولَئِكَ
And those
aṣḥābu
أَصْحَابُ
(are) companions
l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire
hum
هُمْ
they
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
(will) abide forever

217

217.

They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is great [sin], but averting [people] from the way of Allah and disbelief in Him and [preventing access to] al-Masjid al-Haram and the expulsion of its people therefrom are greater [evil] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is greater than killing." And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they are able. And whoever of you reverts from his religion [to disbelief] and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein eternally.

217

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believed
wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
and those who
hājarū
هَاجَرُوا
emigrated
wajāhadū
وَجَاهَدُوا
and strove
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
those
yarjūna
يَرْجُونَ
they hope
raḥmata
رَحْمَتَ
(for) Mercy
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
All-Merciful

218

218.

Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

218

yasalūnaka
يَسْءَلُونَكَ
They ask you
ʿani
عَنِ
about
l-khamri
الْخَمْرِ
[the] intoxicants
wal-maysiri
وَالْمَيْسِرِ
and [the] games of chance
qul
قُلْ
Say
fīhimā
فِيهِمَا
In both of them
ith'mun
إِثْمٌ
(is) a sin
kabīrun
كَبِيرٌ
great
wamanāfiʿu
وَمَنَافِعُ
and (some) benefits
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for [the] people
wa-ith'muhumā
وَإِثْمُهُمَا
But sin of both of them
akbaru
أَكْبَرُ
(is) greater
min
مِنْ
than
nafʿihimā
نَفْعِهِمَا
(the) benefit of (the) two
wayasalūnaka
وَيَسْءَلُونَكَ
And they ask you
mādhā
مَاذَا
what
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
they (should) spend
quli
قُلِ
Say
l-ʿafwa
الْعَفْوَ
The surplus
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Thus
yubayyinu
يُبَيِّنُ
makes clear
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lakumu
لَكُمُ
to you
l-āyāti
الْءَايَاتِ
[the] Verses
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tatafakkarūna
تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
ponder

219

219.

They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, "In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.

219

fī
فِي
Concerning
l-dun'yā
الدُّنْيَا
the world
wal-ākhirati
وَالْءَاخِرَةِ
and the Hereafter
wayasalūnaka
وَيَسْءَلُونَكَ
They ask you
ʿani
عَنِ
about
l-yatāmā
الْيَتَامَى
the orphans
qul
قُلْ
Say
iṣ'lāḥun
إِصْلَاحٌ
Setting right (their affairs)
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) best
wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
tukhāliṭūhum
تُخَالِطُوهُمْ
you associate with them
fa-ikh'wānukum
فَإِخْوَانُكُمْ
then they (are) your brothers
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yaʿlamu
يَعْلَمُ
knows
l-muf'sida
الْمُفْسِدَ
the corrupter
mina
مِنَ
from
l-muṣ'liḥi
الْمُصْلِحِ
the amender
walaw
وَلَوْ
And if
shāa
شَاءَ
(had) willed
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
la-aʿnatakum
لَأَعْنَتَكُمْ
surely He (could have) put you in difficulties
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿazīzun
عَزِيزٌ
(is) All-Mighty
ḥakīmun
حَكِيمٌ
All-Wise

220

220.

To this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say, "Improvement for them is best. And if you mix your affairs with theirs - they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the amender. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

220

walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tankiḥū
تَنْكِحُوا
[you] marry
l-mush'rikāti
الْمُشْرِكَاتِ
[the] polytheistic women
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yu'minna
يُؤْمِنَّ
they believe

mu'minatun

(who is) believing

than

walā

until

than

he pleases you
ulāika

الْجَنَّةِ

wal-maghfirati
وَالْمَغْفِرَةِ
and [the] forgiveness
bi-idh'nihi

by His permission
wayubayyinu
وَيُبَيِّنُ
And He makes clear

His Verses

لِلنَّاسِ
for the people

لَعَلَّهُمْ
so that they may
yatadhakkarūna
يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
take heed

221

221.

And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not marry polytheistic men [to your women] until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite [you] to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.

221

wayasalūnaka
وَيَسْءَلُونَكَ
And they ask you
ʿani
عَنِ
about
l-maḥīḍi
الْمَحِيضِ
[the] menstruation
qul
قُلْ
Say
huwa
هُوَ
It
adhan
أَذًى
(is) a hurt
fa-iʿ'tazilū
فَاعْتَزِلُوا
so keep away (from)
l-nisāa
النِّسَاءَ
[the] women
fī
فِي
during
l-maḥīḍi
الْمَحِيضِ
(their) [the] menstruation
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
taqrabūhunna
تَقْرَبُوهُنَّ
approach them
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yaṭhur'na
يَطْهُرْنَ
they are cleansed
fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
Then when
taṭahharna
تَطَهَّرْنَ
they are purified
fatūhunna
فَأْتُوهُنَّ
then come to them
min
مِنْ
from
ḥaythu
حَيْثُ
where
amarakumu
أَمَرَكُمُ
has ordered you
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yuḥibbu
يُحِبُّ
loves
l-tawābīna
التَّوَّابِينَ
those who turn in repentance
wayuḥibbu
وَيُحِبُّ
and loves
l-mutaṭahirīna
الْمُتَطَهِّرِينَ
those who purify themselves

222

222.

And they ask you about menstruation. Say, "It is harm, so keep away from wives during menstruation. And do not approach them until they are pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allah has ordained for you. Indeed, Allah loves those who are constantly repentant and loves those who purify themselves."

222

nisāukum
نِسَاؤُكُمْ
Your wives
ḥarthun
حَرْثٌ
(are) a tilth
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
fatū
فَأْتُوا
so come
ḥarthakum
حَرْثَكُمْ
(to) your tilth
annā
أَنَّى
when
shi'tum
شِئْتُمْ
you wish
waqaddimū
وَقَدِّمُوا
and send forth (good deeds)
li-anfusikum
لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ
for yourselves
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And be conscious
l-laha
اللَّهَ
(of) Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
annakum
أَنَّكُمْ
that you
mulāqūhu
مُلَاقُوهُ
(will) meet Him
wabashiri
وَبَشِّرِ
And give glad tidings
l-mu'minīna
الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
(to) the believers

223

223.

Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish and put forth [righteousness] for yourselves. And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And give good tidings to the believers.

223

walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tajʿalū
تَجْعَلُوا
make
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allahs (name)
ʿur'ḍatan
عُرْضَةً
an excuse
li-aymānikum
لِأَيْمَانِكُمْ
in your oaths
an
أَنْ
that
tabarrū
تَبَرُّوا
you do good
watattaqū
وَتَتَّقُوا
and be righteous
watuṣ'liḥū
وَتُصْلِحُوا
and make peace
bayna
بَيْنَ
between
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
[the] people
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
samīʿun
سَمِيعٌ
(is) All-Hearing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

224

224.

And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing Allah and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

224

lā
لَا
Not
yuākhidhukumu
يُؤَاخِذُكُمُ
will take you to task
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
bil-laghwi
بِاللَّغْوِ
for (what is) unintentional
fī
فِي
in
aymānikum
أَيْمَانِكُمْ
your oaths
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
yuākhidhukum
يُؤَاخِذُكُمْ
He takes you to task
bimā
بِمَا
for what
kasabat
كَسَبَتْ
(have) earned
qulūbukum
قُلُوبُكُمْ
your hearts
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
ḥalīmun
حَلِيمٌ
Most Forbearing

225

225.

Allah does not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He imposes blame upon you for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

225

lilladhīna
لِلَّذِينَ
For those who
yu'lūna
يُؤْلُونَ
swear (off)
min
مِنْ
from
nisāihim
نِسَائِهِمْ
their wives
tarabbuṣu
تَرَبُّصُ
(is a) waiting (of)
arbaʿati
أَرْبَعَةِ
four
ashhurin
أَشْهُرٍ
months
fa-in
فَإِنْ
then if
fāū
فَاءُو
they return
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft- Forgiving
raḥīmun
رَحِيمٌ
Most Merciful

226

226.

For those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives is a waiting time of four months, but if they return [to normal relations] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

226

wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
ʿazamū
عَزَمُوا
they resolve
l-ṭalāqa
الطَّلَاقَ
(on) [the] divorce
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
samīʿun
سَمِيعٌ
(is) All-Hearing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

227

227.

And if they decide on divorce - then indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

227

wal-muṭalaqātu
وَالْمُطَلَّقَاتُ
And the women who are divorced
yatarabbaṣna
يَتَرَبَّصْنَ
shall wait
bi-anfusihinna
بِأَنْفُسِهِنَّ
concerning themselves
thalāthata
ثَلَاثَةَ
(for) three
qurūin
قُرُوءٍ
monthly periods
walā
وَلَا
And (it is) not
yaḥillu
يَحِلُّ
lawful
lahunna
لَهُنَّ
for them
an
أَنْ
that
yaktum'na
يَكْتُمْنَ
they conceal
mā
مَا
what
khalaqa
خَلَقَ
(has been) created
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(by) Allah
fī
فِي
in
arḥāmihinna
أَرْحَامِهِنَّ
their wombs
in
إِنْ
if
kunna
كُنَّ
they
yu'minna
يُؤْمِنَّ
believe
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
wabuʿūlatuhunna
وَبُعُولَتُهُنَّ
And their husbands
aḥaqqu
أَحَقُّ
(have) better right
biraddihinna
بِرَدِّهِنَّ
to take them back
fī
فِي
in
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that (period)
in
إِنْ
if
arādū
أَرَادُوا
they wish
iṣ'lāḥan
إِصْلَاحًا
(for) reconciliation
walahunna
وَلَهُنَّ
And for them (wives)
mith'lu
مِثْلُ
(is the) like
alladhī
الَّذِي
(of) that which
ʿalayhinna
عَلَيْهِنَّ
(is) on them
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a reasonable manner
walilrrijāli
وَلِلرِّجَالِ
and for the men
ʿalayhinna
عَلَيْهِنَّ
over them (wives)
darajatun
دَرَجَةٌ
(is) a degree
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ʿazīzun
عَزِيزٌ
(is) All-Mighty
ḥakīmun
حَكِيمٌ
All-Wise

228

228.

Divorced women remain in waiting for three periods, and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have more right to take them back in this [period] if they want reconciliation. And due to the wives is similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them [in responsibility and authority]. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

228

al-ṭalāqu
الطَّلَاقُ
The divorce
marratāni
مَرَّتَانِ
(is) twice
fa-im'sākun
فَإِمْسَاكٌ
Then to retain
bimaʿrūfin
بِمَعْرُوفٍ
in a reasonable manner
aw
أَوْ
or
tasrīḥun
تَسْرِيحٌ
to release (her)
bi-iḥ'sānin
بِإِحْسَانٍ
with kindness
walā
وَلَا
And (it is) not
yaḥillu
يَحِلُّ
lawful
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
an
أَنْ
that
takhudhū
تَأْخُذُوا
you take (back)
mimmā
مِمَّا
whatever
ātaytumūhunna

you have given them (wives)
shayan

anything
illā

except
an

if

يَخَافَا
both fear
allā
أَلَّا
that not
yuqīmā

they both (can) keep
ḥudūda

(the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
fa-in
فَإِنْ
But if
khif'tum
خِفْتُمْ
you fear
allā
أَلَّا
that not
yuqīmā
يُقِيمَا
they both (can) keep
ḥudūda
حُدُودَ
(the) limits
l-lahi

falā
فَلَا
then (there is) no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
sin
ʿalayhimā
عَلَيْهِمَا
on both of them
fīmā
فِيمَا
in what
if'tadat
افْتَدَتْ
she ransoms
bihi
بِهِ
concerning it
til'ka
تِلْكَ
These
ḥudūdu
حُدُودُ
(are the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
falā
فَلَا
so (do) not
taʿtadūhā
تَعْتَدُوهَا
transgress them
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
yataʿadda
يَتَعَدَّ
transgresses
ḥudūda
حُدُودَ
(the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
fa-ulāika
فَأُولَئِكَ
then those
humu
هُمُ
they
l-ẓālimūna
الظَّالِمُونَ
(are) the wrongdoers

229

229.

Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.

229

fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
ṭallaqahā
طَلَّقَهَا
he divorces her (finally)
falā
فَلَا
then (she is) not
taḥillu
تَحِلُّ
lawful
lahu
لَهُ
for him
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdu
بَعْدُ
after (that)
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
tankiḥa
تَنْكِحَ
she marries
zawjan
زَوْجًا
a spouse
ghayrahu
غَيْرَهُ
other than him
fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
ṭallaqahā
طَلَّقَهَا
he divorces her
falā
فَلَا
then no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
sin
ʿalayhimā
عَلَيْهِمَا
on them
an
أَنْ
if
yatarājaʿā
يَتَرَاجَعَا
they return to each other
in
إِنْ
if
ẓannā
ظَنَّا
they believe
an
أَنْ
that
yuqīmā
يُقِيمَا
they (will be able to) keep
ḥudūda
حُدُودَ
(the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
watil'ka
وَتِلْكَ
And these
ḥudūdu
حُدُودُ
(are the) limits
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
yubayyinuhā
يُبَيِّنُهَا
He makes them clear
liqawmin
لِقَوْمٍ
to a people
yaʿlamūna
يَعْلَمُونَ
who know

230

230.

And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him. And if the latter husband divorces her [or dies], there is no blame upon the woman and her former husband for returning to each other if they think that they can keep [within] the limits of Allah. These are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.

230

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
ṭallaqtumu
طَلَّقْتُمُ
you divorce
l-nisāa
النِّسَاءَ
the women
fabalaghna
فَبَلَغْنَ
and they reach
ajalahunna

their (waiting) term
fa-amsikūhunna

then retain them
bimaʿrūfin

in a fair manner
aw

or

so that you transgress
waman

And whoever
yafʿal

does

that

فَقَدْ
then indeed

he wronged
nafsahu
نَفْسَهُ
himself
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tattakhidhū
تَتَّخِذُوا
take
āyāti
ءَايَاتِ
(the) Verses
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
huzuwan
هُزُوًا
(in) jest
wa-udh'kurū
وَاذْكُرُوا
and remember
niʿ'mata
نِعْمَتَ
(the) Favors
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
wamā
وَمَا
and what
anzala

(is) revealed

to you
mina
مِنَ
of
l-kitābi
الْكِتَابِ
the Book
wal-ḥik'mati
وَالْحِكْمَةِ
and the wisdom
yaʿiẓukum
يَعِظُكُمْ
He instructs you
bihi
بِهِ
with it
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah (is)
bikulli
بِكُلِّ
of every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knower

231

231.

And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.

231

wa-idhā
وَإِذَا
And when
ṭallaqtumu
طَلَّقْتُمُ
you divorce
l-nisāa
النِّسَاءَ
[the] women
fabalaghna
فَبَلَغْنَ
and they reached
ajalahunna
أَجَلَهُنَّ
their (waiting) term
falā
فَلَا
then (do) not
taʿḍulūhunna
تَعْضُلُوهُنَّ
hinder them
an
أَنْ
[that]
yankiḥ'na
يَنْكِحْنَ
(from) marrying
azwājahunna
أَزْوَاجَهُنَّ
their husbands
idhā
إِذَا
when
tarāḍaw
تَرَاضَوْا
they agree
baynahum
بَيْنَهُمْ
between themselves
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
yūʿaẓu
يُوعَظُ
is admonished
bihi
بِهِ
with it
man
مَنْ
whoever
kāna
كَانَ
[is]

مِنْكُمْ
among you
yu'minu
يُؤْمِنُ
believes
bil-lahi

in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
dhālikum
ذَلِكُمْ
that
azkā
أَزْكَى
(is) more virtuous
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
wa-aṭharu
وَأَطْهَرُ
and more purer
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ

yaʿlamu
يَعْلَمُ

wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you
lā
لَا
(do) not
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
know

232

232.

And when you divorce women and they have fulfilled their term, do not prevent them from remarrying their [former] husbands if they agree among themselves on an acceptable basis. That is instructed to whoever of you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is better for you and purer, and Allah knows and you know not.

232

wal-wālidātu
وَالْوَالِدَاتُ
And the mothers
yur'ḍiʿ'na
يُرْضِعْنَ
shall suckle
awlādahunna
أَوْلَادَهُنَّ
their children
ḥawlayni
حَوْلَيْنِ
(for) two years
kāmilayni
كَامِلَيْنِ
complete
liman
لِمَنْ
for whoever
arāda
أَرَادَ
wishes
an
أَنْ
to
yutimma
يُتِمَّ
complete
l-raḍāʿata
الرَّضَاعَةَ
the suckling
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
And upon
l-mawlūdi
الْمَوْلُودِ
the father
lahu
لَهُ
(on) him
riz'quhunna
رِزْقُهُنَّ
(is) their provision
wakis'watuhunna
وَكِسْوَتُهُنَّ
and their clothing
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
lā
لَا
Not
tukallafu
تُكَلَّفُ
is burdened
nafsun
نَفْسٌ
any soul
illā
إِلَّا
except
wus'ʿahā
وُسْعَهَا
its capacity
lā

Not
tuḍārra
تُضَارَّ
made to suffer
wālidatun

(the) mother
biwaladihā
بِوَلَدِهَا
because of her child
walā
وَلَا
and not
mawlūdun
مَوْلُودٌ
(the) father
lahu
لَهُ
(be)

بِوَلَدِهِ
because of his child
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
And on

(is a duty) like

that
fa-in

Then if

they both desire

فِصَالًا
weaning
ʿan

through
tarāḍin

of both of them

and consultation

then no

blame
ʿalayhimā

on both of them
wa-in

And if
aradttum

you want
an

to

تَسْتَرْضِعُوا
ask another women to suckle
awlādakum
أَوْلَادَكُمْ
your child
falā
فَلَا
then (there is) no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
on you
idhā
إِذَا
when
sallamtum
سَلَّمْتُمْ
you pay
mā
مَا
what
ātaytum
ءَاتَيْتُمْ
(is) due (from) you
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
baṣīrun
بَصِيرٌ
(is) All-Seer

233

233.

Mothers may breastfeed their children two complete years for whoever wishes to complete the nursing [period]. Upon the father is the mothers' provision and their clothing according to what is acceptable. No person is charged with more than his capacity. No mother should be harmed through her child, and no father through his child. And upon the [father's] heir is [a duty] like that [of the father]. And if they both desire weaning through mutual consent from both of them and consultation, there is no blame upon either of them. And if you wish to have your children nursed by a substitute, there is no blame upon you as long as you give payment according to what is acceptable. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Seeing of what you do.

233

wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those who
yutawaffawna
يُتَوَفَّوْنَ
pass away
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
wayadharūna
وَيَذَرُونَ
and leave behind
azwājan
أَزْوَاجًا
wives
yatarabbaṣna
يَتَرَبَّصْنَ
(the widows) should wait
bi-anfusihinna
بِأَنْفُسِهِنَّ
for themselves
arbaʿata
أَرْبَعَةَ
(for) four
ashhurin
أَشْهُرٍ
months
waʿashran
وَعَشْرًا
and ten (days)
fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
Then when
balaghna
بَلَغْنَ
they reach
ajalahunna
أَجَلَهُنَّ
their (specified) term
falā
فَلَا
then (there is) no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
fīmā
فِيمَا
for what
faʿalna
فَعَلْنَ
they do
fī
فِي
concerning
anfusihinna
أَنْفُسِهِنَّ
themselves
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
khabīrun
خَبِيرٌ
(is) All-Aware

234

234.

And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - they, [the wives, shall] wait four months and ten [days]. And when they have fulfilled their term, then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable manner. And Allah is [fully] Acquainted with what you do.

234

walā
وَلَا
And (there is) no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
fīmā
فِيمَا
in what
ʿarraḍtum
عَرَّضْتُمْ
you hint
bihi
بِهِ
[with it]
min
مِنْ
of
khiṭ'bati
خِطْبَةِ
marriage proposal
l-nisāi
النِّسَاءِ
[to] the women
aw
أَوْ
or
aknantum
أَكْنَنْتُمْ
you concealed it
fī
فِي
in
anfusikum
أَنْفُسِكُمْ
yourselves
ʿalima
عَلِمَ
Knows
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
annakum
أَنَّكُمْ
that you
satadhkurūnahunna
سَتَذْكُرُونَهُنَّ
will mention them
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
lā
لَا
(do) not
tuwāʿidūhunna
تُوَاعِدُوهُنَّ
promise them (widows)
sirran
سِرًّا
secretly
illā
إِلَّا
except
an
أَنْ
that
taqūlū
تَقُولُوا
you say
qawlan
قَوْلًا
a saying
maʿrūfan
مَعْرُوفًا
honorable
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
taʿzimū
تَعْزِمُوا
resolve (on)
ʿuq'data
عُقْدَةَ
the knot
l-nikāḥi
النِّكَاحِ
(of) marriage
ḥattā
حَتَّى
until
yablugha
يَبْلُغَ
reaches
l-kitābu
الْكِتَابُ
the prescribed term
ajalahu
أَجَلَهُ
its end
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
And know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yaʿlamu
يَعْلَمُ
knows
mā
مَا
what
fī
فِي
(is) within
anfusikum
أَنْفُسِكُمْ
yourselves
fa-iḥ'dharūhu
فَاحْذَرُوهُ
so beware of Him
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
And know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghafūrun
غَفُورٌ
(is) Oft-Forgiving
ḥalīmun
حَلِيمٌ
Most Forbearing

235

235.

There is no blame upon you for that to which you [indirectly] allude concerning a proposal to women or for what you conceal within yourselves. Allah knows that you will have them in mind. But do not promise them secretly except for saying a proper saying. And do not determine to undertake a marriage contract until the decreed period reaches its end. And know that Allah knows what is within yourselves, so beware of Him. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.

235

lā
لَا
(There is) no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
in
إِنْ
if
ṭallaqtumu
طَلَّقْتُمُ
you divorce
l-nisāa
النِّسَاءَ
[the] women
mā
مَا
whom
lam
لَمْ
not
tamassūhunna
تَمَسُّوهُنَّ
you have touched
aw
أَوْ
nor
tafriḍū
تَفْرِضُوا
you specified
lahunna
لَهُنَّ
for them
farīḍatan
فَرِيضَةً
an obligation (dower)
wamattiʿūhunna
وَمَتِّعُوهُنَّ
And make provision for them
ʿalā
عَلَى
upon
l-mūsiʿi
الْمُوسِعِ
the wealthy
qadaruhu
قَدَرُهُ
according to his means
waʿalā
وَعَلَى
and upon
l-muq'tiri
الْمُقْتِرِ
the poor
qadaruhu
قَدَرُهُ
according to his means
matāʿan
مَتَاعًا
a provision
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
ḥaqqan
حَقًّا
a duty
ʿalā
عَلَى
upon
l-muḥ'sinīna
الْمُحْسِنِينَ
the good-doers

236

236.

There is no blame upon you if you divorce women you have not touched nor specified for them an obligation. But give them [a gift of] compensation - the wealthy according to his capability and the poor according to his capability - a provision according to what is acceptable, a duty upon the doers of good.

236

wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
ṭallaqtumūhunna
طَلَّقْتُمُوهُنَّ
you divorce them
min
مِنْ
from
qabli
قَبْلِ
before
an
أَنْ
[that]
tamassūhunna
تَمَسُّوهُنَّ
you (have) touched them
waqad
وَقَدْ
while already
faraḍtum
فَرَضْتُمْ
you have specified
lahunna
لَهُنَّ
for them
farīḍatan
فَرِيضَةً
an obligation (dower)
faniṣ'fu
فَنِصْفُ
then (give) half
mā
مَا
(of) what
faraḍtum
فَرَضْتُمْ
you have specified
illā
إِلَّا
unless
an
أَنْ
[that]
yaʿfūna
يَعْفُونَ
they (women) forgo (it)
aw
أَوْ
or
yaʿfuwā
يَعْفُوَا
forgoes
alladhī
الَّذِي
the one
biyadihi
بِيَدِهِ
in whose hands
ʿuq'datu
عُقْدَةُ
(is the) knot
l-nikāḥi
النِّكَاحِ
(of) the marriage
wa-an
وَأَنْ
And that
taʿfū
تَعْفُوا
you forgo
aqrabu
أَقْرَبُ
(is) nearer
lilttaqwā
لِلتَّقْوَى
to [the] righteousness
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tansawū
تَنْسَوُا
forget
l-faḍla
الْفَضْلَ
the graciousness
baynakum
بَيْنَكُمْ
among you
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
baṣīrun
بَصِيرٌ
(is) All-Seer

237

237.

And if you divorce them before you have touched them and you have already specified for them an obligation, then [give] half of what you specified - unless they forego the right or the one in whose hand is the marriage contract foregoes it. And to forego it is nearer to righteousness. And do not forget graciousness between you. Indeed Allah, of whatever you do, is Seeing.

237

ḥāfiẓū
حَافِظُوا
Guard strictly
ʿalā
عَلَى
[on]
l-ṣalawāti
الصَّلَوَاتِ
the prayers
wal-ṣalati
وَالصَّلَوةِ
and the prayer
l-wus'ṭā
الْوُسْطَى
[the] middle
waqūmū
وَقُومُوا
and stand up
lillahi
لِلَّهِ
for Allah
qānitīna
قَانِتِينَ
devoutly obedient

238

238.

Maintain with care the [obligatory] prayers and [in particular] the middle prayer and stand before Allah, devoutly obedient.

238

fa-in
فَإِنْ
And if
khif'tum
خِفْتُمْ
you fear
farijālan
فَرِجَالًا
then (pray) on foot
aw
أَوْ
or
ruk'bānan
رُكْبَانًا
riding
fa-idhā
فَإِذَا
Then when
amintum
أَمِنْتُمْ
you are secure
fa-udh'kurū
فَاذْكُرُوا
then remember
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
kamā
كَمَا
as
ʿallamakum
عَلَّمَكُمْ
He (has) taught you
mā
مَا
what
lam
لَمْ
not
takūnū
تَكُونُوا
you were
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
knowing

239

239.

And if you fear [an enemy, then pray] on foot or riding. But when you are secure, then remember Allah [in prayer], as He has taught you that which you did not [previously] know.

239

wa-alladhīna
وَالَّذِينَ
And those who
yutawaffawna
يُتَوَفَّوْنَ
they die
minkum
مِنْكُمْ
among you
wayadharūna
وَيَذَرُونَ
and leave behind
azwājan
أَزْوَاجًا
(their) wives
waṣiyyatan
وَصِيَّةً
(should make) a will
li-azwājihim
لِأَزْوَاجِهِمْ
for their wives
matāʿan
مَتَاعًا
provision
ilā
إِلَى
for
l-ḥawli
الْحَوْلِ
the year
ghayra
غَيْرَ
without
ikh'rājin
إِخْرَاجٍ
driving (them) out
fa-in
فَإِنْ
But if
kharajna
خَرَجْنَ
they leave
falā
فَلَا
then no
junāḥa
جُنَاحَ
blame
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
upon you
fī
فِي
in
mā
مَا
what
faʿalna
فَعَلْنَ
they do
fī
فِي
concerning
anfusihinna
أَنْفُسِهِنَّ
themselves
min
مِنْ
[of]
maʿrūfin
مَعْرُوفٍ
honorably
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ʿazīzun
عَزِيزٌ
(is) All-Mighty
ḥakīmun
حَكِيمٌ
All-Wise

240

240.

And those who are taken in death among you and leave wives behind - for their wives is a bequest: maintenance for one year without turning [them] out. But if they leave [of their own accord], then there is no blame upon you for what they do with themselves in an acceptable way. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

240

walil'muṭallaqāti
وَلِلْمُطَلَّقَاتِ
And for the divorced women
matāʿun
مَتَاعٌ
(is) a provision
bil-maʿrūfi
بِالْمَعْرُوفِ
in a fair manner
ḥaqqan
حَقًّا
a duty
ʿalā
عَلَى
upon
l-mutaqīna
الْمُتَّقِينَ
the righteous

241

241.

And for divorced women is a provision according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.

241

kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Thus
yubayyinu
يُبَيِّنُ
makes clear
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
āyātihi
ءَايَاتِهِ
His Verses
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
taʿqilūna
تَعْقِلُونَ
use your intellect

242

242.

Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you might use reason.

242

alam
أَلَمْ
Did not
tara
تَرَ
you see
ilā
إِلَى
[to]
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
kharajū
خَرَجُوا
went out
min
مِنْ
from
diyārihim
دِيَارِهِمْ
their homes
wahum
وَهُمْ
and they
ulūfun
أُلُوفٌ
(were in) thousands
ḥadhara
حَذَرَ
(in) fear
l-mawti
الْمَوْتِ
(of) [the] death
faqāla
فَقَالَ
Then said
lahumu
لَهُمُ
to them
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
mūtū
مُوتُوا
Die
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
aḥyāhum
أَحْيَاهُمْ
He restored them to life
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ladhū
لَذُو
(is) surely Possessor
faḍlin
فَضْلٍ
(of) bounty
ʿalā
عَلَى
for
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
[the] mankind
walākinna
وَلَكِنَّ
[and] but
akthara
أَكْثَرَ
most
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
(of) the people
lā
لَا
(are) not
yashkurūna
يَشْكُرُونَ
grateful

243

243.

Have you not considered those who left their homes in many thousands, fearing death? Allah said to them, "Die"; then He restored them to life. And Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people do not show gratitude.

243

waqātilū
وَقَاتِلُوا
And fight
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
samīʿun
سَمِيعٌ
(is) All-Hearing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

244

244.

And fight in the cause of Allah and know that Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

244

man
مَنْ
Who
dhā
ذَا
(is) the one
alladhī
الَّذِي
who
yuq'riḍu
يُقْرِضُ
will lend
l-laha
اللَّهَ
(to) Allah
qarḍan
قَرْضًا
a loan
ḥasanan
حَسَنًا
good
fayuḍāʿifahu
فَيُضَاعِفَهُ
so (that) He multiplies it
lahu
لَهُ
for him
aḍʿāfan
أَضْعَافًا
manifolds
kathīratan
كَثِيرَةً
many
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yaqbiḍu
يَقْبِضُ
withholds
wayabṣuṭu
وَيَبْصُطُ
and grants abundance
wa-ilayhi
وَإِلَيْهِ
and to Him
tur'jaʿūna
تُرْجَعُونَ
you will be returned

245

245.

Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He may multiply it for him many times over? And it is Allah who withholds and grants abundance, and to Him you will be returned.

245

alam
أَلَمْ
Did not
tara
تَرَ
you see
ilā
إِلَى
[towards]
l-mala-i
الْمَلَإِ
the chiefs
min
مِنْ
of
banī
بَنِي
(the) Children
is'rāīla
إِسْرَاءِيلَ
(of) Israel
min
مِنْ
from
baʿdi
بَعْدِ
after
mūsā
مُوسَى
Musa
idh
إِذْ
when
qālū
قَالُوا
they said
linabiyyin
لِنَبِيٍّ
to a Prophet
lahumu
لَهُمُ
of theirs
ib'ʿath

for us

in

[the] fighting
allā

that not

qālū

They said
wamā

And what
lanā
لَنَا
for us

that not
nuqātila

we fight
fī

in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
waqad
وَقَدْ

ukh'rij'nā
أُخْرِجْنَا
we have been driven out
min
مِنْ
from
diyārinā
دِيَارِنَا

wa-abnāinā

falammā
فَلَمَّا
Yet, when
kutiba
كُتِبَ
was prescribed
ʿalayhimu
عَلَيْهِمُ
upon them
l-qitālu
الْقِتَالُ
the fighting
tawallaw
تَوَلَّوْا
they turned away
illā
إِلَّا
except
qalīlan
قَلِيلًا
a few
min'hum
مِنْهُمْ
among them
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knowing
bil-ẓālimīna
بِالظَّالِمِينَ
of the wrongdoers

246

246.

Have you not considered the assembly of the Children of Israel after [the time of] Moses when they said to a prophet of theirs, "Send to us a king, and we will fight in the way of Allah "? He said, "Would you perhaps refrain from fighting if fighting was prescribed for you?" They said, "And why should we not fight in the cause of Allah when we have been driven out from our homes and from our children?" But when fighting was prescribed for them, they turned away, except for a few of them. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

246

waqāla
وَقَالَ
And said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
nabiyyuhum
نَبِيُّهُمْ
their Prophet
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
qad
قَدْ
(has) surely
baʿatha
بَعَثَ
raised
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
ṭālūta
طَالُوتَ
Talut
malikan
مَلِكًا
(as) a king
qālū
قَالُوا
They said
annā
أَنَّى
How
yakūnu
يَكُونُ
can be
lahu
لَهُ
for him
l-mul'ku
الْمُلْكُ
the kingship
ʿalaynā
عَلَيْنَا
over us
wanaḥnu
وَنَحْنُ
while we
aḥaqqu
أَحَقُّ
(are) more entitled
bil-mul'ki
بِالْمُلْكِ
to kingship
min'hu
مِنْهُ
than him
walam
وَلَمْ
and not
yu'ta
يُؤْتَ
he has been given
saʿatan
سَعَةً
abundance
mina
مِنَ
of
l-māli

qāla
قَالَ
He said
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
iṣ'ṭafāhu
اصْطَفَاهُ
has chosen him
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
over you
wazādahu
وَزَادَهُ
and increased him

بَسْطَةً
abundantly
fī
فِي
in
l-ʿil'mi
الْعِلْمِ
[the] knowledge
wal-jis'mi
وَالْجِسْمِ
and [the] physique
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yu'tī
يُؤْتِي
gives
mul'kahu
مُلْكَهُ
His kingdom
man
مَنْ
(to) whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
wāsiʿun
وَاسِعٌ
(is) All-Encompassing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

247

247.

And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, Allah has sent to you Saul as a king." They said, "How can he have kingship over us while we are more worthy of kingship than him and he has not been given any measure of wealth?" He said, "Indeed, Allah has chosen him over you and has increased him abundantly in knowledge and stature. And Allah gives His sovereignty to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing [in favor] and Knowing."

247

waqāla
وَقَالَ
And said
lahum
لَهُمْ
to them
nabiyyuhum
نَبِيُّهُمْ
their Prophet
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
āyata
ءَايَةَ
a sign
mul'kihi
مُلْكِهِ
(of) his kingship
an
أَنْ
(is) that
yatiyakumu
يَأْتِيَكُمُ
will come to you
l-tābūtu
التَّابُوتُ
the ark
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
sakīnatun
سَكِينَةٌ
(is) a tranquility
min
مِنْ
from
rabbikum
رَبِّكُمْ
your Lord
wabaqiyyatun
وَبَقِيَّةٌ
and a remnant
mimmā
مِمَّا
of what
taraka
تَرَكَ
(was) left
ālu
ءَالُ
(by the) family
mūsā
مُوسَى
(of) Musa
waālu
وَءَالُ
and family
hārūna
هَارُونَ
(of) Harun
taḥmiluhu
تَحْمِلُهُ
will carry it
l-malāikatu
الْمَلَائِكَةُ
the Angels
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
fī
فِي
in
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
that
laāyatan
لَءَايَةً
(is) surely a sign
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
mu'minīna
مُؤْمِنِينَ
believers

248

248.

And their prophet said to them, "Indeed, a sign of his kingship is that the chest will come to you in which is assurance from your Lord and a remnant of what the family of Moses and the family of Aaron had left, carried by the angels. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers."

248

falammā
فَلَمَّا
Then when
faṣala
فَصَلَ
set out
ṭālūtu
طَالُوتُ
Talut
bil-junūdi
بِالْجُنُودِ
with the forces
qāla
قَالَ
he said
inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
mub'talīkum
مُبْتَلِيكُمْ
will test you
binaharin
بِنَهَرٍ
with a river
faman
فَمَنْ
So whoever
shariba
شَرِبَ
drinks
min'hu
مِنْهُ
from it
falaysa
فَلَيْسَ
then he is not
minnī
مِنِّي
from me
waman
وَمَنْ
and whoever
lam
لَمْ
(does) not
yaṭʿamhu
يَطْعَمْهُ
taste it
fa-innahu
فَإِنَّهُ
then indeed, he
minnī
مِنِّي
(is) from me
illā
إِلَّا
except
mani
مَنِ
whoever
igh'tarafa
اغْتَرَفَ
takes
ghur'fatan
غُرْفَةً
(in the) hollow
biyadihi
بِيَدِهِ
(of) his hand
fasharibū
فَشَرِبُوا

from it
illā

مِنْهُمْ

فَلَمَّا
Then when

qāla

alladhīna

yaẓunnūna
يَظُنُّونَ

annahum

that they

l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
kam
كَمْ
How many
min
مِنْ
of
fi-atin
فِئَةٍ
a company
qalīlatin
قَلِيلَةٍ
small
ghalabat
غَلَبَتْ
overcame
fi-atan
فِئَةً
a company
kathīratan
كَثِيرَةً
large
bi-idh'ni
بِإِذْنِ
by (the) permission
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
maʿa
مَعَ
(is) with
l-ṣābirīna
الصَّابِرِينَ
the patient ones

249

249.

And when Saul went forth with the soldiers, he said, "Indeed, Allah will be testing you with a river. So whoever drinks from it is not of me, and whoever does not taste it is indeed of me, excepting one who takes [from it] in the hollow of his hand." But they drank from it, except a [very] few of them. Then when he had crossed it along with those who believed with him, they said, "There is no power for us today against Goliath and his soldiers." But those who were certain that they would meet Allah said, "How many a small company has overcome a large company by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the patient."

249

walammā
وَلَمَّا
And when
barazū
بَرَزُوا
they went forth
lijālūta
لِجَالُوتَ
to (face) Jalut
wajunūdihi
وَجُنُودِهِ
and his troops
qālū
قَالُوا
they said
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord
afrigh
أَفْرِغْ
Pour
ʿalaynā
عَلَيْنَا
on us
ṣabran
صَبْرًا
patience
wathabbit
وَثَبِّتْ
and make firm
aqdāmanā
أَقْدَامَنَا
our feet
wa-unṣur'nā
وَانْصُرْنَا
and help us
ʿalā
عَلَى
against
l-qawmi
الْقَوْمِ
the people
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
(who are) disbelieving

250

250.

And when they went forth to [face] Goliath and his soldiers, they said, "Our Lord, pour upon us patience and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."

250

fahazamūhum
فَهَزَمُوهُمْ
So they defeated them
bi-idh'ni

waqatala

l-lahu

waʿallamahu

mimmā

yashāu

l-nāsa

bibaʿḍin

لَفَسَدَتِ

ʿalā

الْعَالَمِينَ
the worlds

251

251.

So they defeated them by permission of Allah, and David killed Goliath, and Allah gave him the kingship and prophethood and taught him from that which He willed. And if it were not for Allah checking [some] people by means of others, the earth would have been corrupted, but Allah is full of bounty to the worlds.

251

til'ka
تِلْكَ
These
āyātu
ءَايَاتُ
(are the) Verses
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
natlūhā
نَتْلُوهَا
We recite them
ʿalayka
عَلَيْكَ
to you
bil-ḥaqi
بِالْحَقِّ
in [the] truth
wa-innaka
وَإِنَّكَ
And indeed you
lamina
لَمِنَ
(are) surely of
l-mur'salīna
الْمُرْسَلِينَ
the Messengers

252

252.

These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you, [O Muhammad], in truth. And indeed, you are from among the messengers.

252

til'ka

yafʿalu

yurīdu

He intends

253

253.

Those messengers - some of them We caused to exceed others. Among them were those to whom Allah spoke, and He raised some of them in degree. And We gave Jesus, the Son of Mary, clear proofs, and We supported him with the Pure Spirit. If Allah had willed, those [generations] succeeding them would not have fought each other after the clear proofs had come to them. But they differed, and some of them believed and some of them disbelieved. And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allah does what He intends.

253

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
anfiqū
أَنْفِقُوا
Spend
mimmā
مِمَّا
of what
razaqnākum
رَزَقْنَاكُمْ
We (have) provided you
min
مِنْ
from
qabli
قَبْلِ
before
an
أَنْ
that
yatiya
يَأْتِيَ
comes
yawmun
يَوْمٌ
a Day
lā
لَا
no
bayʿun
بَيْعٌ
bargaining
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
walā
وَلَا
and no
khullatun
خُلَّةٌ
friendship
walā
وَلَا
and no
shafāʿatun
شَفَاعَةٌ
intercession
wal-kāfirūna
وَالْكَافِرُونَ
And the deniers
humu
هُمُ
they
l-ẓālimūna
الظَّالِمُونَ
(are) the wrongdoers

254

254.

O you who have believed, spend from that which We have provided for you before there comes a Day in which there is no exchange and no friendship and no intercession. And the disbelievers - they are the wrongdoers.

254

al-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lā
لَا
(there is) no
ilāha
إِلَهَ
God
illā
إِلَّا
except
huwa

l-ḥayu
الْحَيُّ
the Ever-Living
l-qayūmu

the Sustainer of all that exists
lā

Not

walā
وَلَا

يُحِيطُونَ
they encompass
bishayin
بِشَيْءٍ
anything
min
مِنْ
of
ʿil'mihi

His Knowledge
illā
إِلَّا
except
bimā
بِمَا
[of] what
shāa

wasiʿa
وَسِعَ
Extends

كُرْسِيُّهُ
His Throne
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
(to) the heavens
wal-arḍa
وَالْأَرْضَ
and the earth
walā
وَلَا
And not
yaūduhu
يَئُودُهُ
tires Him
ḥif'ẓuhumā
حِفْظُهُمَا
(the) guarding of both of them
wahuwa
وَهُوَ
And He
l-ʿaliyu
الْعَلِيُّ
(is) the Most High
l-ʿaẓīmu
الْعَظِيمُ
the Most Great

255

255.

Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

255

lā
لَا
(There is) no
ik'rāha
إِكْرَاهَ
compulsion
fī
فِي
in
l-dīni
الدِّينِ
the religion
qad
قَدْ
Surely
tabayyana
تَبَيَّنَ
has become distinct
l-rush'du
الرُّشْدُ
the right (path)
mina
مِنَ
from
l-ghayi
الْغَيِّ
the wrong
faman
فَمَنْ
Then whoever
yakfur
يَكْفُرْ
disbelieves
bil-ṭāghūti
بِالطَّاغُوتِ
in false deities
wayu'min
وَيُؤْمِنْ
and believes
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
faqadi
فَقَدِ
then surely
is'tamsaka
اسْتَمْسَكَ
he grasped
bil-ʿur'wati
بِالْعُرْوَةِ
the handhold
l-wuth'qā
الْوُثْقَى
[the] firm
lā
لَا
(which) not
infiṣāma
انْفِصَامَ
(will) break
lahā
لَهَا
[for it]
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
samīʿun
سَمِيعٌ
(is) All-Hearing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

256

256.

There shall be no compulsion in [acceptance of] the religion. The right course has become clear from the wrong. So whoever disbelieves in Taghut and believes in Allah has grasped the most trustworthy handhold with no break in it. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

256

al-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
waliyyu
وَلِيُّ
(is the) Protecting Guardian
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(of) those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
yukh'rijuhum
يُخْرِجُهُمْ
He brings them out
mina
مِنَ
from
l-ẓulumāti
الظُّلُمَاتِ
[the] darkness
ilā
إِلَى
towards
l-nūri

[the] light
wa-alladhīna

awliyāuhumu

l-ṭāghūtu
الطَّاغُوتُ

mina

from
l-nūri

the light
ilā
إِلَى
towards
l-ẓulumāti
الظُّلُمَاتِ
the darkness
ulāika
أُولَئِكَ
Those
aṣḥābu
أَصْحَابُ

l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire
hum
هُمْ
they
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
will abide forever

257

257.

Allah is the ally of those who believe. He brings them out from darknesses into the light. And those who disbelieve - their allies are Taghut. They take them out of the light into darknesses. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.

257

alam
أَلَمْ
Did not
tara
تَرَ
you see
ilā

[towards]

l-laha
اللَّهَ

mina

mina
مِنَ
from

fabuhita
فَبُهِتَ
So became dumbfounded

the one who
kafara

wal-lahu

and Allah
lā

الْقَوْمَ
the people
l-ẓālimīna
الظَّالِمِينَ
(who are) [the] wrongdoers

258

258.

Have you not considered the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord [merely] because Allah had given him kingship? When Abraham said, "My Lord is the one who gives life and causes death," he said, "I give life and cause death." Abraham said, "Indeed, Allah brings up the sun from the east, so bring it up from the west." So the disbeliever was overwhelmed [by astonishment], and Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

258

aw
أَوْ
Or
ka-alladhī
كَالَّذِي
like the one who
marra
مَرَّ
passed
ʿalā
عَلَى
by
qaryatin
قَرْيَةٍ
a township
wahiya
وَهِيَ
and it
khāwiyatun
خَاوِيَةٌ
(had) overturned
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
ʿurūshihā
عُرُوشِهَا
its roofs
qāla
قَالَ
He said
annā
أَنَّى
How
yuḥ'yī
يُحْيِي
(will) bring to life
hādhihi
هَذِهِ
this (town)
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
baʿda
بَعْدَ
after
mawtihā
مَوْتِهَا
its death
fa-amātahu
فَأَمَاتَهُ
Then he was made to die
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
(by) Allah
mi-ata
مِائَةَ
(for) a hundred
ʿāmin
عَامٍ
year(s)
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
baʿathahu
بَعَثَهُ
He raised him
qāla
قَالَ
He said
kam
كَمْ
How long
labith'ta
لَبِثْتَ
(have) you remained
qāla
قَالَ
He said
labith'tu
لَبِثْتُ
I remained
yawman
يَوْمًا
(for) a day
aw
أَوْ
or
baʿḍa
بَعْضَ
a part
yawmin
يَوْمٍ
(of) a day
qāla
قَالَ
He said
bal
بَلْ
Nay
labith'ta
لَبِثْتَ
you (have) remained
mi-ata
مِائَةَ
one hundred
ʿāmin
عَامٍ
year(s)
fa-unẓur
فَانْظُرْ
Then look
ilā
إِلَى
at
ṭaʿāmika
طَعَامِكَ
your food
washarābika
وَشَرَابِكَ
and your drink
lam
لَمْ
(they did) not
yatasannah
يَتَسَنَّهْ
change with time
wa-unẓur
وَانْظُرْ
and look
ilā
إِلَى
at
ḥimārika
حِمَارِكَ
your donkey
walinajʿalaka
وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ
and We will make you
āyatan
ءَايَةً
a sign
lilnnāsi
لِلنَّاسِ
for the people
wa-unẓur
وَانْظُرْ
And look
ilā
إِلَى
at
l-ʿiẓāmi
الْعِظَامِ
the bones
kayfa
كَيْفَ
how
nunshizuhā
نُنْشِزُهَا
We raise them
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
naksūhā
نَكْسُوهَا
We cover them
laḥman
لَحْمًا
(with) flesh
falammā
فَلَمَّا
Then when
tabayyana
تَبَيَّنَ
became clear
lahu
لَهُ
to him
qāla
قَالَ
he said
aʿlamu
أَعْلَمُ
I know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿalā
عَلَى
(is) on
kulli
كُلِّ
every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
qadīrun
قَدِيرٌ
All-Powerful

259

259.

Or [consider such an example] as the one who passed by a township which had fallen into ruin. He said, "How will Allah bring this to life after its death?" So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years; then He revived him. He said, "How long have you remained?" The man said, "I have remained a day or part of a day." He said, "Rather, you have remained one hundred years. Look at your food and your drink; it has not changed with time. And look at your donkey; and We will make you a sign for the people. And look at the bones [of this donkey] - how We raise them and then We cover them with flesh." And when it became clear to him, he said, "I know that Allah is over all things competent."

259

wa-idh
وَإِذْ
And when
qāla
قَالَ
said
ib'rāhīmu
إِبْرَاهِيمُ
Ibrahim
rabbi
رَبِّ
My Lord
arinī
أَرِنِي
show me
kayfa
كَيْفَ
how
tuḥ'yī
تُحْيِي
You give life
l-mawtā
الْمَوْتَى
(to) the dead
qāla
قَالَ
He said
awalam
أَوَلَمْ
Have not
tu'min
تُؤْمِنْ
you believed
qāla
قَالَ
He said
balā
بَلَى
Yes
walākin
وَلَكِنْ
[and] but
liyaṭma-inna
لِيَطْمَئِنَّ
to satisfy
qalbī
قَلْبِي
my heart
qāla
قَالَ
He said
fakhudh
فَخُذْ
Then take
arbaʿatan
أَرْبَعَةً
four
mina
مِنَ
of
l-ṭayri
الطَّيْرِ
the birds
faṣur'hunna
فَصُرْهُنَّ
and incline them
ilayka
إِلَيْكَ
towards you
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
ij'ʿal
اجْعَلْ
put
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
kulli
كُلِّ
each
jabalin
جَبَلٍ
hill
min'hunna
مِنْهُنَّ
of them
juz'an
جُزْءًا
a portion
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
ud'ʿuhunna
ادْعُهُنَّ
call them
yatīnaka
يَأْتِينَكَ
they will come to you
saʿyan
سَعْيًا
(in) haste
wa-iʿ'lam
وَاعْلَمْ
And know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ʿazīzun
عَزِيزٌ
(is) All-Mighty
ḥakīmun
حَكِيمٌ
All-Wise

260

260.

And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, show me how You give life to the dead." [Allah] said, "Have you not believed?" He said, "Yes, but [I ask] only that my heart may be satisfied." [Allah] said, "Take four birds and commit them to yourself. Then [after slaughtering them] put on each hill a portion of them; then call them - they will come [flying] to you in haste. And know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise."

260

mathalu
مَثَلُ
Example
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(of) those who
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
spend
amwālahum
أَمْوَالَهُمْ
their wealth
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
kamathali
كَمَثَلِ
(is) like
ḥabbatin
حَبَّةٍ
a grain
anbatat
أَنْبَتَتْ
which grows
sabʿa
سَبْعَ
seven
sanābila
سَنَابِلَ
ears
fī
فِي
in
kulli
كُلِّ
each
sunbulatin
سُنْبُلَةٍ
ear
mi-atu
مِائَةُ
hundred
ḥabbatin
حَبَّةٍ
grain(s)
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
yuḍāʿifu
يُضَاعِفُ
gives manifold
liman
لِمَنْ
to whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
wāsiʿun
وَاسِعٌ
(is) All-Encompassing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

261

261.

The example of those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah is like a seed [of grain] which grows seven spikes; in each spike is a hundred grains. And Allah multiplies [His reward] for whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

261

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
spend
amwālahum
أَمْوَالَهُمْ
their wealth
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
thumma
ثُمَّ
then
lā
لَا
not
yut'biʿūna
يُتْبِعُونَ
they follow
mā
مَا
what
anfaqū
أَنْفَقُوا
they spend
mannan
مَنًّا
(with) reminders of generosity
walā
وَلَا
and not
adhan
أَذًى
hurt
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
ajruhum
أَجْرُهُمْ
their reward
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
(is) with
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
walā
وَلَا
and (there will be) no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
will grieve

262

262.

Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah and then do not follow up what they have spent with reminders [of it] or [other] injury will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

262

qawlun
قَوْلٌ
A word
maʿrūfun
مَعْرُوفٌ
kind
wamaghfiratun
وَمَغْفِرَةٌ
and (seeking) forgiveness
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(are) better
min
مِنْ
than
ṣadaqatin
صَدَقَةٍ
a charity
yatbaʿuhā
يَتْبَعُهَا
followed [it]
adhan
أَذًى
(by) hurt
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
ghaniyyun
غَنِيٌّ
(is) All-Sufficient
ḥalīmun
حَلِيمٌ
All-Forbearing

263

263.

Kind speech and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury. And Allah is Free of need and Forbearing.

263

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
lā
لَا
(Do) not
tub'ṭilū
تُبْطِلُوا
render in vain
ṣadaqātikum
صَدَقَاتِكُمْ
your charities
bil-mani
بِالْمَنِّ
with reminders (of it)
wal-adhā
وَالْأَذَى
or [the] hurt
ka-alladhī
كَالَّذِي
like the one who
yunfiqu
يُنْفِقُ
spends
mālahu
مَالَهُ
his wealth
riāa
رِئَاءَ
(to) be seen
l-nāsi
النَّاسِ
(by) the people
walā
وَلَا
and (does) not
yu'minu
يُؤْمِنُ
believe
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wal-yawmi
وَالْيَوْمِ
and the Day
l-ākhiri
الْءَاخِرِ
[the] Last
famathaluhu
فَمَثَلُهُ
Then his example
kamathali
كَمَثَلِ
(is) like
ṣafwānin
صَفْوَانٍ
(that of a) smooth rock
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
upon it
turābun
تُرَابٌ
(is) dust
fa-aṣābahu
فَأَصَابَهُ
then fell on it
wābilun
وَابِلٌ
heavy rain
fatarakahu
فَتَرَكَهُ
then left it
ṣaldan
صَلْدًا
bare
lā
لَا
Not
yaqdirūna
يَقْدِرُونَ
they have control
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
shayin
شَيْءٍ
anything
mimmā
مِمَّا
of what
kasabū
كَسَبُوا
they (have) earned
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
lā
لَا
(does) not
yahdī
يَهْدِي
guide
l-qawma
الْقَوْمَ
the people
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
[the] disbelieving

264

264.

O you who have believed, do not invalidate your charities with reminders or injury as does one who spends his wealth [only] to be seen by the people and does not believe in Allah and the Last Day. His example is like that of a [large] smooth stone upon which is dust and is hit by a downpour that leaves it bare. They are unable [to keep] anything of what they have earned. And Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

264

wamathalu
وَمَثَلُ
And (the) example
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
(of) those who
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
spend
amwālahumu
أَمْوَالَهُمُ
their wealth
ib'tighāa
ابْتِغَاءَ
seeking
marḍāti
مَرْضَاتِ
(the) pleasure
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
watathbītan
وَتَثْبِيتًا
and certainty
min
مِنْ
from
anfusihim
أَنْفُسِهِمْ
their (inner) souls
kamathali
كَمَثَلِ
(is) like
jannatin
جَنَّةٍ
a garden
birabwatin
بِرَبْوَةٍ
on a height
aṣābahā
أَصَابَهَا
fell on it
wābilun
وَابِلٌ
heavy rain
faātat
فَءَاتَتْ
so it yielded
ukulahā
أُكُلَهَا
its harvest
ḍiʿ'fayni
ضِعْفَيْنِ
double
fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
lam
لَمْ
(does) not
yuṣib'hā
يُصِبْهَا
fall (on) it
wābilun
وَابِلٌ
heavy rain
faṭallun
فَطَلٌّ
then a drizzle
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
baṣīrun
بَصِيرٌ
(is) All-Seer

265

265.

And the example of those who spend their wealth seeking means to the approval of Allah and assuring [reward for] themselves is like a garden on high ground which is hit by a downpour - so it yields its fruits in double. And [even] if it is not hit by a downpour, then a drizzle [is sufficient]. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.

265

ayawaddu
أَيَوَدُّ
Would like
aḥadukum
أَحَدُكُمْ
any of you
an
أَنْ
that
takūna
تَكُونَ
it be
lahu
لَهُ
for him
jannatun
جَنَّةٌ
a garden
min
مِنْ
of
nakhīlin
نَخِيلٍ
date-palms
wa-aʿnābin
وَأَعْنَابٍ
and grapevines
tajrī
تَجْرِي
flowing
min
مِنْ
[from]
taḥtihā
تَحْتِهَا
underneath it
l-anhāru
الْأَنْهَارُ
the rivers
lahu
لَهُ
for him
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
min
مِنْ
of
kulli
كُلِّ
all (kinds)
l-thamarāti
الثَّمَرَاتِ
(of) [the] fruits
wa-aṣābahu
وَأَصَابَهُ
and strikes him
l-kibaru
الْكِبَرُ
[the] old age
walahu
وَلَهُ
and [for] his
dhurriyyatun
ذُرِّيَّةٌ
children
ḍuʿafāu
ضُعَفَاءُ
(are) weak
fa-aṣābahā
فَأَصَابَهَا
then falls on it
iʿ'ṣārun
إِعْصَارٌ
whirlwind
fīhi
فِيهِ
in it
nārun
نَارٌ
(is) fire
fa-iḥ'taraqat
فَاحْتَرَقَتْ
then it is burnt
kadhālika
كَذَلِكَ
Thus
yubayyinu
يُبَيِّنُ
makes clear
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
lakumu
لَكُمُ
for you
l-āyāti
الْءَايَاتِ
(His) Signs
laʿallakum
لَعَلَّكُمْ
so that you may
tatafakkarūna
تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
ponder

266

266.

Would one of you like to have a garden of palm trees and grapevines underneath which rivers flow in which he has from every fruit? But he is afflicted with old age and has weak offspring, and it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire and is burned. Thus does Allah make clear to you [His] verses that you might give thought.

266

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
anfiqū
أَنْفِقُوا
Spend
min
مِنْ
from
ṭayyibāti
طَيِّبَاتِ
(the) good things
mā
مَا
that
kasabtum
كَسَبْتُمْ
you have earned
wamimmā
وَمِمَّا
and whatever
akhrajnā
أَخْرَجْنَا
We brought forth
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
mina
مِنَ
from
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
tayammamū
تَيَمَّمُوا
aim at
l-khabītha
الْخَبِيثَ
the bad
min'hu
مِنْهُ
of it
tunfiqūna
تُنْفِقُونَ
you spend
walastum
وَلَسْتُمْ
while you (would) not
biākhidhīhi
بِءَاخِذِيهِ
take it
illā
إِلَّا
except
an
أَنْ
[that]
tugh'miḍū
تُغْمِضُوا
(with) close(d) eyes
fīhi
فِيهِ
[in it]
wa-iʿ'lamū
وَاعْلَمُوا
and know
anna
أَنَّ
that
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
ghaniyyun
غَنِيٌّ
(is) Self-Sufficient
ḥamīdun
حَمِيدٌ
Praiseworthy

267

267.

O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth. And do not aim toward the defective therefrom, spending [from that] while you would not take it [yourself] except with closed eyes. And know that Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

267

al-shayṭānu
الشَّيْطَانُ
The Shaitaan
yaʿidukumu
يَعِدُكُمُ
promises you
l-faqra
الْفَقْرَ
[the] poverty
wayamurukum
وَيَأْمُرُكُمْ
and orders you
bil-faḥshāi
بِالْفَحْشَاءِ
to immorality
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
while Allah
yaʿidukum
يَعِدُكُمْ
promises you
maghfiratan
مَغْفِرَةً
forgiveness
min'hu
مِنْهُ
from Him
wafaḍlan
وَفَضْلًا
and bounty
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
wāsiʿun
وَاسِعٌ
(is) All-Encompassing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
All-Knowing

268

268.

Satan threatens you with poverty and orders you to immorality, while Allah promises you forgiveness from Him and bounty. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

268

yu'tī
يُؤْتِي
He grants
l-ḥik'mata
الْحِكْمَةَ
[the] wisdom
man
مَنْ
(to) whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
waman
وَمَنْ
and whoever
yu'ta
يُؤْتَ
is granted
l-ḥik'mata
الْحِكْمَةَ
[the] wisdom
faqad
فَقَدْ
then certainly
ūtiya
أُوتِيَ
he is granted
khayran
خَيْرًا
good
kathīran
كَثِيرًا
abundant
wamā
وَمَا
And none
yadhakkaru
يَذَّكَّرُ
remembers
illā
إِلَّا
except
ulū
أُولُوا
those
l-albābi
الْأَلْبَابِ
(of) understanding

269

269.

He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever has been given wisdom has certainly been given much good. And none will remember except those of understanding.

269

wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
anfaqtum
أَنْفَقْتُمْ
you spend
min
مِنْ
(out) of
nafaqatin
نَفَقَةٍ
(your) expenditures
aw
أَوْ
or
nadhartum
نَذَرْتُمْ
you vow
min
مِنْ
of
nadhrin
نَذْرٍ
vow(s)
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yaʿlamuhu
يَعْلَمُهُ
knows it
wamā
وَمَا
and not
lilẓẓālimīna
لِلظَّالِمِينَ
for the wrongdoers
min
مِنْ
any
anṣārin
أَنْصَارٍ
helpers

270

270.

And whatever you spend of expenditures or make of vows - indeed, Allah knows of it. And for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

270

in
إِنْ
If
tub'dū
تُبْدُوا
you disclose
l-ṣadaqāti
الصَّدَقَاتِ
the charities
faniʿimmā
فَنِعِمَّا
then well
hiya
هِيَ
it (is)
wa-in
وَإِنْ
But if
tukh'fūhā
تُخْفُوهَا
you keep it secret
watu'tūhā
وَتُؤْتُوهَا
and give it
l-fuqarāa
الْفُقَرَاءَ
(to) the poor
fahuwa
فَهُوَ
then it
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(is) better
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
wayukaffiru
وَيُكَفِّرُ
And He will remove
ʿankum
عَنْكُمْ
from you
min
مِنْ
[of]
sayyiātikum
سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ
your evil deeds
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
bimā
بِمَا
with what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
khabīrun
خَبِيرٌ
(is) All-Aware

271

271.

If you disclose your charitable expenditures, they are good; but if you conceal them and give them to the poor, it is better for you, and He will remove from you some of your misdeeds [thereby]. And Allah, with what you do, is [fully] Acquainted.

271

laysa
لَيْسَ
Not
ʿalayka
عَلَيْكَ
on you
hudāhum
هُدَاهُمْ
(is) their guidance
walākinna
وَلَكِنَّ
[and] but
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
yahdī
يَهْدِي
guides
man
مَنْ
whom
yashāu
يَشَاءُ
He wills
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tunfiqū
تُنْفِقُوا
you spend
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
fali-anfusikum
فَلِأَنْفُسِكُمْ
then it is for yourself
wamā
وَمَا
and not
tunfiqūna
تُنْفِقُونَ
you spend
illā
إِلَّا
except
ib'tighāa
ابْتِغَاءَ
seeking
wajhi
وَجْهِ
(the) face
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tunfiqū
تُنْفِقُوا
you spend
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
yuwaffa
يُوَفَّ
will be repaid in full
ilaykum
إِلَيْكُمْ
to you
wa-antum
وَأَنْتُمْ
and you
lā
لَا
(will) not
tuẓ'lamūna
تُظْلَمُونَ
be wronged

272

272.

Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever good you [believers] spend is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever you spend of good - it will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.

272

lil'fuqarāi
لِلْفُقَرَاءِ
For the poor
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
uḥ'ṣirū
أُحْصِرُوا
are wrapped up
fī
فِي
in
sabīli
سَبِيلِ
(the) way
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
(of) Allah
lā
لَا
not
yastaṭīʿūna
يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
they are able
ḍarban
ضَرْبًا
(to) move about
fī
فِي
in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
yaḥsabuhumu
يَحْسَبُهُمُ
Think (about) them
l-jāhilu
الْجَاهِلُ
the ignorant one
aghniyāa
أَغْنِيَاءَ
(that they are) self-sufficient
mina
مِنَ
(because) of
l-taʿafufi
التَّعَفُّفِ
(their) restraint
taʿrifuhum
تَعْرِفُهُمْ
you recognize them
bisīmāhum
بِسِيمَاهُمْ
by their mark
lā
لَا
Not
yasalūna
يَسْءَلُونَ
(do) they ask
l-nāsa
النَّاسَ
the people
il'ḥāfan
إِلْحَافًا
with importunity
wamā
وَمَا
And whatever
tunfiqū
تُنْفِقُوا
you spend
min
مِنْ
of
khayrin
خَيْرٍ
good
fa-inna
فَإِنَّ
then indeed
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
bihi
بِهِ
of it
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knower

273

273.

[Charity is] for the poor who have been restricted for the cause of Allah, unable to move about in the land. An ignorant [person] would think them self-sufficient because of their restraint, but you will know them by their [characteristic] sign. They do not ask people persistently [or at all]. And whatever you spend of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.

273

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yunfiqūna
يُنْفِقُونَ
spend
amwālahum
أَمْوَالَهُمْ
their wealth
bi-al-layli
بِاللَّيْلِ
by night
wal-nahāri
وَالنَّهَارِ
and day
sirran
سِرًّا
secretly
waʿalāniyatan
وَعَلَانِيَةً
and openly
falahum
فَلَهُمْ
then for them
ajruhum
أَجْرُهُمْ
(is) their reward
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
with
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
walā
وَلَا
and no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
will grieve

274

274.

Those who spend their wealth [in Allah 's way] by night and by day, secretly and publicly - they will have their reward with their Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

274

alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
Those who
yakulūna
يَأْكُلُونَ
consume
l-riba
الرِّبَوا
[the] usury
lā
لَا
not
yaqūmūna
يَقُومُونَ
they can stand
illā
إِلَّا
except
kamā
كَمَا
like
yaqūmu
يَقُومُ
stands
alladhī
الَّذِي
the one who
yatakhabbaṭuhu
يَتَخَبَّطُهُ
confounds him
l-shayṭānu
الشَّيْطَانُ
the Shaitaan
mina
مِنَ
with
l-masi
الْمَسِّ
(his) touch
dhālika
ذَلِكَ
That
bi-annahum
بِأَنَّهُمْ
(is) because they
qālū
قَالُوا
say
innamā
إِنَّمَا
Only
l-bayʿu
الْبَيْعُ
the trade
mith'lu
مِثْلُ
(is) like
l-riba
الرِّبَوا
[the] usury
wa-aḥalla
وَأَحَلَّ
While has permitted
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
l-bayʿa
الْبَيْعَ
[the] trade
waḥarrama
وَحَرَّمَ
but (has) forbidden
l-riba
الرِّبَوا
[the] usury
faman
فَمَنْ
Then whoever
jāahu
جَاءَهُ
comes to him
mawʿiẓatun
مَوْعِظَةٌ
(the) admonition
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihi
رَبِّهِ
His Lord
fa-intahā
فَانْتَهَى
and he refrained
falahu
فَلَهُ
then for him
mā
مَا
what
salafa
سَلَفَ
(has) passed
wa-amruhu
وَأَمْرُهُ
and his case
ilā
إِلَى
(is) with
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
waman
وَمَنْ
and whoever
ʿāda
عَادَ
repeated
fa-ulāika
فَأُولَئِكَ
then those
aṣḥābu
أَصْحَابُ
(are the) companions
l-nāri
النَّارِ
(of) the Fire
hum
هُمْ
they
fīhā
فِيهَا
in it
khālidūna
خَالِدُونَ
will abide forever

275

275.

Those who consume interest cannot stand [on the Day of Resurrection] except as one stands who is being beaten by Satan into insanity. That is because they say, "Trade is [just] like interest." But Allah has permitted trade and has forbidden interest. So whoever has received an admonition from his Lord and desists may have what is past, and his affair rests with Allah. But whoever returns to [dealing in interest or usury] - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide eternally therein.

275

yamḥaqu
يَمْحَقُ
Destroys
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
l-riba
الرِّبَوا
the usury
wayur'bī
وَيُرْبِي
and (gives) increase
l-ṣadaqāti
الصَّدَقَاتِ
(for) the charities
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
lā
لَا
(does) not
yuḥibbu
يُحِبُّ
love
kulla
كُلَّ
every
kaffārin
كَفَّارٍ
ungrateful
athīmin
أَثِيمٍ
sinner

276

276.

Allah destroys interest and gives increase for charities. And Allah does not like every sinning disbeliever.

276

inna
إِنَّ
Indeed
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
waʿamilū
وَعَمِلُوا
and did
l-ṣāliḥāti
الصَّالِحَاتِ
good deeds
wa-aqāmū
وَأَقَامُوا
and established
l-ṣalata
الصَّلَوةَ
the prayer
waātawū
وَءَاتَوُا
and gave
l-zakata
الزَّكَوةَ
the zakah
lahum
لَهُمْ
for them
ajruhum
أَجْرُهُمْ
their reward
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
(is) with
rabbihim
رَبِّهِمْ
their Lord
walā
وَلَا
and no
khawfun
خَوْفٌ
fear
ʿalayhim
عَلَيْهِمْ
on them
walā
وَلَا
and not
hum
هُمْ
they
yaḥzanūna
يَحْزَنُونَ
will grieve

277

277.

Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds and establish prayer and give zakah will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

277

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]!
ittaqū
اتَّقُوا
Fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wadharū
وَذَرُوا
and give up
mā
مَا
what
baqiya
بَقِيَ
remained
mina
مِنَ
of
l-riba
الرِّبَوا
[the] usury
in
إِنْ
if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
mu'minīna
مُؤْمِنِينَ
believers

278

278.

O you who have believed, fear Allah and give up what remains [due to you] of interest, if you should be believers.

278

fa-in
فَإِنْ
And if
lam
لَمْ
not
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
you do
fadhanū
فَأْذَنُوا
then be informed
biḥarbin
بِحَرْبٍ
of a war
mina
مِنَ
from
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
warasūlihi
وَرَسُولِهِ
and His Messenger
wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
tub'tum
تُبْتُمْ
you repent
falakum
فَلَكُمْ
then for you
ruūsu
رُءُوسُ
(is)
amwālikum
أَمْوَالِكُمْ
your capital
lā
لَا
(do) not
taẓlimūna
تَظْلِمُونَ
wrong
walā
وَلَا
and not
tuẓ'lamūna
تُظْلَمُونَ
you will be wronged

279

279.

And if you do not, then be informed of a war [against you] from Allah and His Messenger. But if you repent, you may have your principal - [thus] you do no wrong, nor are you wronged.

279

wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
kāna
كَانَ
is
dhū
ذُو
the (debtor)
ʿus'ratin
عُسْرَةٍ
in difficulty
fanaẓiratun
فَنَظِرَةٌ
then postponement
ilā
إِلَى
until
maysaratin
مَيْسَرَةٍ
ease
wa-an
وَأَنْ
And if
taṣaddaqū
تَصَدَّقُوا
you remit as charity
khayrun
خَيْرٌ
(it is) better
lakum
لَكُمْ
for you
in
إِنْ
If
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you
taʿlamūna
تَعْلَمُونَ
know

280

280.

And if someone is in hardship, then [let there be] postponement until [a time of] ease. But if you give [from your right as] charity, then it is better for you, if you only knew.

280

wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
And fear
yawman
يَوْمًا
a Day
tur'jaʿūna
تُرْجَعُونَ
you will be brought back
fīhi
فِيهِ
[in it]
ilā
إِلَى
to
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
thumma
ثُمَّ
Then
tuwaffā
تُوَفَّى
(will be) repaid in full
kullu
كُلُّ
every
nafsin
نَفْسٍ
soul
mā
مَا
what
kasabat
كَسَبَتْ
it earned
wahum
وَهُمْ
and they
lā
لَا
not
yuẓ'lamūna
يُظْلَمُونَ
will be wronged

281

281.

And fear a Day when you will be returned to Allah. Then every soul will be compensated for what it earned, and they will not be treated unjustly.

281

yāayyuhā
يَاأَيُّهَا
O you
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
who
āmanū
ءَامَنُوا
believe[d]
idhā
إِذَا
When
tadāyantum
تَدَايَنْتُمْ
you contract with one another
bidaynin
بِدَيْنٍ
any debt
ilā
إِلَى
for
ajalin
أَجَلٍ
a term
musamman
مُسَمًّى
fixed
fa-uk'tubūhu
فَاكْتُبُوهُ
then write it
walyaktub
وَلْيَكْتُبْ
And let write
baynakum
بَيْنَكُمْ
between you
kātibun
كَاتِبٌ
a scribe
bil-ʿadli
بِالْعَدْلِ
in justice
walā
وَلَا
And not
yaba
يَأْبَ
(should) refuse
kātibun
كَاتِبٌ
a scribe
an
أَنْ
that
yaktuba
يَكْتُبَ
he writes
kamā
كَمَا
as
ʿallamahu
عَلَّمَهُ
(has) taught him
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
falyaktub
فَلْيَكْتُبْ
So let him write
walyum'lili
وَلْيُمْلِلِ
and let dictate
alladhī
الَّذِي
the one
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on whom
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
(is) the right
walyattaqi
وَلْيَتَّقِ
and let him fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
rabbahu
رَبَّهُ
his Lord
walā
وَلَا
and (let him) not
yabkhas
يَبْخَسْ
diminish
min'hu
مِنْهُ
from it
shayan
شَيْئًا
anything
fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
kāna
كَانَ
is
alladhī
الَّذِي
the one
ʿalayhi
عَلَيْهِ
on him
l-ḥaqu
الْحَقُّ
(is) the right
safīhan
سَفِيهًا
(of) limited understanding
aw
أَوْ
or
ḍaʿīfan
ضَعِيفًا
weak
aw
أَوْ
or
lā
لَا
not
yastaṭīʿu
يَسْتَطِيعُ
capable
an
أَنْ
that
yumilla
يُمِلَّ
(can) dictate
huwa
هُوَ
he
falyum'lil
فَلْيُمْلِلْ
then let dictate
waliyyuhu
وَلِيُّهُ
his guardian
bil-ʿadli
بِالْعَدْلِ
with justice
wa-is'tashhidū
وَاسْتَشْهِدُوا
And call for evidence
shahīdayni
شَهِيدَيْنِ
two witnesses
min
مِنْ
among
rijālikum
رِجَالِكُمْ
your men
fa-in
فَإِنْ
And if
lam
لَمْ
not
yakūnā
يَكُونَا
there are
rajulayni
رَجُلَيْنِ
two men
farajulun
فَرَجُلٌ
then one man
wa-im'ra-atāni
وَامْرَأَتَانِ
and two women
mimman
مِمَّنْ
of whom
tarḍawna
تَرْضَوْنَ
you agree
mina
مِنَ
of
l-shuhadāi
الشُّهَدَاءِ
[the] witnesses
an
أَنْ
(so) that (if)
taḍilla
تَضِلَّ
[she] errs
iḥ'dāhumā
إِحْدَاهُمَا
one of the two
fatudhakkira
فَتُذَكِّرَ
then will remind
iḥ'dāhumā
إِحْدَاهُمَا
one of the two
l-ukh'rā
الْأُخْرَى
the other
walā
وَلَا
And not
yaba
يَأْبَ
(should) refuse
l-shuhadāu
الشُّهَدَاءُ
the witnesses
idhā
إِذَا
when
mā
مَا
that
duʿū
دُعُوا
they are called
walā
وَلَا
And not
tasamū
تَسْءَمُوا
(be) weary
an
أَنْ
that
taktubūhu
تَكْتُبُوهُ
you write it
ṣaghīran
صَغِيرًا
small
aw
أَوْ
or
kabīran
كَبِيرًا
large
ilā
إِلَى
for
ajalihi
أَجَلِهِ
its term
dhālikum
ذَلِكُمْ
That
aqsaṭu
أَقْسَطُ
(is) more just
ʿinda
عِنْدَ
near
l-lahi
اللَّهِ
Allah
wa-aqwamu
وَأَقْوَمُ
and more upright
lilshahādati
لِلشَّهَادَةِ
for evidence
wa-adnā
وَأَدْنَى
and nearer
allā
أَلَّا
that not
tartābū
تَرْتَابُوا
you (have) doubt
illā
إِلَّا
except
an
أَنْ
that
takūna
تَكُونَ
be
tijāratan
تِجَارَةً
a transaction
ḥāḍiratan
حَاضِرَةً
present
tudīrūnahā
تُدِيرُونَهَا
you carry out
baynakum
بَيْنَكُمْ
among you
falaysa
فَلَيْسَ
then not
ʿalaykum
عَلَيْكُمْ
on you
junāḥun
جُنَاحٌ
any sin
allā
أَلَّا
that not
taktubūhā
تَكْتُبُوهَا
you write it
wa-ashhidū
وَأَشْهِدُوا
And take witness
idhā
إِذَا
when
tabāyaʿtum
تَبَايَعْتُمْ
you make commercial transaction
walā
وَلَا
And not
yuḍārra
يُضَارَّ
(should) be harmed
kātibun
كَاتِبٌ
(the) scribe
walā
وَلَا
and not
shahīdun
شَهِيدٌ
(the) witness
wa-in
وَإِنْ
and if
tafʿalū
تَفْعَلُوا
you do
fa-innahu
فَإِنَّهُ
then indeed it
fusūqun
فُسُوقٌ
(is) sinful conduct
bikum
بِكُمْ
for you
wa-ittaqū
وَاتَّقُوا
and fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
wayuʿallimukumu
وَيُعَلِّمُكُمُ
And teaches
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
bikulli
بِكُلِّ
of every
shayin
شَيْءٍ
thing
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knower

282

282.

O you who have believed, when you contract a debt for a specified term, write it down. And let a scribe write [it] between you in justice. Let no scribe refuse to write as Allah has taught him. So let him write and let the one who has the obligation dictate. And let him fear Allah, his Lord, and not leave anything out of it. But if the one who has the obligation is of limited understanding or weak or unable to dictate himself, then let his guardian dictate in justice. And bring to witness two witnesses from among your men. And if there are not two men [available], then a man and two women from those whom you accept as witnesses - so that if one of the women errs, then the other can remind her. And let not the witnesses refuse when they are called upon. And do not be [too] weary to write it, whether it is small or large, for its [specified] term. That is more just in the sight of Allah and stronger as evidence and more likely to prevent doubt between you, except when it is an immediate transaction which you conduct among yourselves. For [then] there is no blame upon you if you do not write it. And take witnesses when you conclude a contract. Let no scribe be harmed or any witness. For if you do so, indeed, it is [grave] disobedience in you. And fear Allah. And Allah teaches you. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

282

wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
kuntum
كُنْتُمْ
you are
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
safarin
سَفَرٍ
a journey
walam
وَلَمْ
and not
tajidū
تَجِدُوا
you find
kātiban
كَاتِبًا
a scribe
farihānun
فَرِهَانٌ
then pledge
maqbūḍatun
مَقْبُوضَةٌ
in hand
fa-in
فَإِنْ
Then if
amina
أَمِنَ
entrusts
baʿḍukum
بَعْضُكُمْ
one of you
baʿḍan
بَعْضًا
(to) another
falyu-addi
فَلْيُؤَدِّ
then let discharge
alladhī
الَّذِي

u'tumina
اؤْتُمِنَ
is entrusted
amānatahu
أَمَانَتَهُ
his trust
walyattaqi
وَلْيَتَّقِ
And let him fear
l-laha
اللَّهَ
Allah
rabbahu
رَبَّهُ
his Lord
walā
وَلَا
And (do) not
taktumū
تَكْتُمُوا
conceal
l-shahādata
الشَّهَادَةَ
the evidence
waman
وَمَنْ
And whoever
yaktum'hā
يَكْتُمْهَا
conceals it
fa-innahu
فَإِنَّهُ
then indeed he
āthimun
ءَاثِمٌ
(is) sinful
qalbuhu
قَلْبُهُ
his heart
wal-lahu
وَاللَّهُ
And Allah
bimā
بِمَا
of what
taʿmalūna
تَعْمَلُونَ
you do
ʿalīmun
عَلِيمٌ
(is) All-Knower

283

283.

And if you are on a journey and cannot find a scribe, then a security deposit [should be] taken. And if one of you entrusts another, then let him who is entrusted discharge his trust [faithfully] and let him fear Allah, his Lord. And do not conceal testimony, for whoever conceals it - his heart is indeed sinful, and Allah is Knowing of what you do.

283

lillahi
لِلَّهِ
To Allah (belongs)
mā
مَا
whatever
fī
فِي
(is) in
l-samāwāti
السَّمَاوَاتِ
the heavens
wamā
وَمَا
and whatever
fī
فِي
(is) in
l-arḍi
الْأَرْضِ
the earth
wa-in
وَإِنْ
And if
tub'dū
تُبْدُوا
you disclose
mā
مَا
what
fī
فِي
(is) in
anfusikum

yourselves

or

bihi

for it
l-lahu

فَيَغْفِرُ

shayin

thing
qadīrun

(is) All-Powerful

284

284.

To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Whether you show what is within yourselves or conceal it, Allah will bring you to account for it. Then He will forgive whom He wills and punish whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.

284

āmana
ءَامَنَ
Believed
l-rasūlu
الرَّسُولُ
the Messenger
bimā
بِمَا
in what
unzila
أُنْزِلَ
was revealed
ilayhi
إِلَيْهِ
to him
min
مِنْ
from
rabbihi
رَبِّهِ
his Lord
wal-mu'minūna
وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ
and the believers
kullun
كُلٌّ
All
āmana
ءَامَنَ
believed
bil-lahi
بِاللَّهِ
in Allah
wamalāikatihi

and His Angels

lā

between

any
min

of
rusulihi

waqālū
وَقَالُوا
And they said
samiʿ'nā
سَمِعْنَا
We heard
wa-aṭaʿnā
وَأَطَعْنَا
and we obeyed
ghuf'rānaka
غُفْرَانَكَ
(Grant) us Your forgiveness
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
our Lord
wa-ilayka
وَإِلَيْكَ
and to You
l-maṣīru
الْمَصِيرُ
(is) the return

285

285.

The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and [so have] the believers. All of them have believed in Allah and His angels and His books and His messengers, [saying], "We make no distinction between any of His messengers." And they say, "We hear and we obey. [We seek] Your forgiveness, our Lord, and to You is the [final] destination."

285

lā
لَا
(Does) not
yukallifu
يُكَلِّفُ
burden
l-lahu
اللَّهُ
Allah
nafsan
نَفْسًا
any soul
illā
إِلَّا
except
wus'ʿahā
وُسْعَهَا
its capacity
lahā
لَهَا
for it
mā
مَا
what
kasabat
كَسَبَتْ
it earned
waʿalayhā

and against it
mā
مَا
what
ik'tasabat
اكْتَسَبَتْ
it earned
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord
lā
لَا
(Do) not
tuākhidh'nā

take us to task
in

if

or

we err

رَبَّنَا
Our Lord

And (do) not

تَحْمِلْ
lay
ʿalaynā

upon us
iṣ'ran
إِصْرًا
a burden

كَمَا
like that
ḥamaltahu
حَمَلْتَهُ
(which) You laid [it]
ʿalā
عَلَى
on
alladhīna
الَّذِينَ
those who
min
مِنْ
(were) from
qablinā
قَبْلِنَا
before us
rabbanā
رَبَّنَا
Our Lord
walā
وَلَا

tuḥammil'nā
تُحَمِّلْنَا
lay on us
mā
مَا
what
lā
لَا
not
ṭāqata
طَاقَةَ
(the) strength
lanā
لَنَا
we have
bihi
بِهِ
[of it] (to bear)
wa-uʿ'fu
وَاعْفُ
And pardon
ʿannā
عَنَّا
[from] us
wa-igh'fir
وَاغْفِرْ
and forgive
lanā
لَنَا
[for] us
wa-ir'ḥamnā
وَارْحَمْنَا
and have mercy on us
anta
أَنْتَ
You (are)
mawlānā
مَوْلَانَا
our Protector
fa-unṣur'nā
فَانْصُرْنَا
so help us
ʿalā
عَلَى
against
l-qawmi
الْقَوْمِ
the people
l-kāfirīna
الْكَافِرِينَ
[the] disbelievers

286

286.

Allah does not charge a soul except [with that within] its capacity. It will have [the consequence of] what [good] it has gained, and it will bear [the consequence of] what [evil] it has earned. "Our Lord, do not impose blame upon us if we have forgotten or erred. Our Lord, and lay not upon us a burden like that which You laid upon those before us. Our Lord, and burden us not with that which we have no ability to bear. And pardon us; and forgive us; and have mercy upon us. You are our protector, so give us victory over the disbelieving people."

286

Al-Faatiha
Loading

Aal-i-Imraan
